JINA Y SU CONVIVIENTE SE DEDICAN A SU NEGOCIO YA VARIOS AÑOS, Y GRACIAS A SUS INGRESOS  AYUDAN A EDUCAR A SUS HIJOS.

EL PRÉSTAMO QUE ELLA OBTIENE LE AYUDA A CUMPLIR DE MANERA RÁPIDA CON EL PEDIDO QUE LE HACEN SUS CLIENTES,Y LA MAYORIA DE ESTOS SON DE LOS COLEGIOS, ESCUELAS, JARDIN DE NIÑOS , QUE ESTÁN EN SU LOCALIDAD.

EN ESTA OPORTUNIDAD JINA INVERTIRÁ EL DINERO OBTENIDO EN LA COMPRA DE TELAS, HILOS DE DIVERSOS COLORES, YA QUE SE ACERCA LA NAVIDAD,  Y ELLA INCREMENTA SUS PEDIDOS.

EL SUEÑO QUE ELLA TIENE ES EL DE PONER UN LOCAL CERCA A LA CALLE PRINCIPAL DE SU LOCALIDAD, PARA MEJORAR SUS INGRESOS Y APOYAR EN LOS ESTUDIOS A MIS HIJOS.

JINA Y SU FAMILIA SE SIENTE FELIZ POR QUE EXISTEN PERSONAS QUE LA AYUDAN Y LES DICE GRACIAS POR SU APOYO.
JINA VISTE UNA CASACA NEGRA Y ES LA PRIMERA DE LA IZQUIERDA (LA FOTOGRAFÍA DE LA PARTE SUPERIOR ES YOSSI, QUE LLEGO TARDE A LA REUNION)
texts.en:
Jina is a young, 35 year old mother that has two small children.  She works making and renting costumes for all occasions.  Jina and her partner have dedicated themselves to this business for a few years now, and their income has helped them to educate their children.  

The loan will help her quickly fulfill orders from her customers, most of which are from colleges, schools and preschools in her area.  Jina will take this opportunity to purchase fabrics and different colored threads, since Christmas is approaching and her orders have increased.  

Her dream is to have her own store close to the main street in her town, so that her income will increase and she will be able to support her children's education.  Jina and her family are happy that there are people who are willing to help and they are thankful for their support.  Jina is dressed in a black jacket and is the first one on the left (Yossi is in the superimposed picture as she arrived late to the meeting.

loans.use: purchase fabric, thread, buttons, tape, etc.

loans.name: Unidos Para Trabajar Group

texts.es: La Sra. Lourdes   de 36  años de edad soltera  y madre de  1  hijo, la Sra. lourdes tiene un  pequeño negocio de venta de fruta en un pequeño mercado (alquilado) ya hace un 1 año. La Sra. Lourdes,  ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes   el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus  frutas y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar más variedades de frutas, Para su posterior venta  y así seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes y así poder salir adelante. A la vez  la Sra. Lourdes y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. La Sra. Lourdes  se encuentra sentada se le distingue por su Shorts de color verde azulado, Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
Lourdes is a 36-year-old single mother of one. She has run a small business selling fruit in a small market where she rents for one year. Lourdes has gained the loyalty of her customers which has allowed her to earn what is needed to cover her household expenses. In the future she would like to own a small stall where she could sell fruit and receive higher earnings. 

This loan will be invested in the purchase of a greater variety of fruits to then resell. In this way she will continue satisfying her customers' needs and be able to get ahead. Lourdes and her fellow members are thankful to Kiva for the loan provided and the trust that is being placed in them. Lourdes is seated wearing bluish green shorts. In closing, she gives her promise that she will fulfill all of the goals that she has proposed.

loans.use: to buy fruits.

loans.name: Los Jornaleros Group

texts.es:
MARCELINA PERTENECE AL GRUPO LOS JORNALEROS, ELLA TIENE 45 AÑOS , TIENE 02 HIJOS QUE TIENE MAYORIA DE EDAD.

ELLA TRABAJA VENDIENDO ROPA EN UNA PEQUEÑA TIENDA EN SU LOCALIDAD, SUS INGRESOS LO INVIERTE EN LA EDUCACIÓN SUPERIOR/ UNIVERSIDAD DE SUS DOS HIJOS.

EL DINERO QUE OBTUVO LO INVERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRA DE POLOS, CASACAS,PANTALONES,CHOMPAS, ETC.; PARA PODER VENDERLAS EN LAS FERIAS QUE SE ORGANIZA POR FIESTAS NAVIDEÑAS.

ELLA ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA Y SORPRENDIDA POR EL APOYO DE PERSONAS DE OTROS PAISES QUE APOYAN EN SUS NEGOCIOS A SU GRUPO Y LES DICE MUCHAS GRACIAS.

ELLA VISTE CON CHOMPA NEGRA  Y PANTALÓN VERDE.
texts.en:
Marcelina belongs to the "Jornaleros" communal bank. She is 45 years old and has two adult children. She works selling clothing in a small store in her community. She has invested her earnings in the tertiary and university education of her children. 

Marcelina will use the loan to buy sweaters, jackets, polo shirts, pants, etc. for sale in the markets organized for the Christmas festivals. She is very pleased and surprised by the support given her by people from other countries. This supports the businesses of the group members and they thank you all. 

Marcelina is wearing the black sweater and green pants.

loans.use: to buy sweaters, jackets, polo shirts, pants, etc.

loans.name: Jesús Pan De Vida Group

texts.es: Katherine tiene 21 años es conviviente con un hijo dependiente. Ella hace dos años implemento su restaurante con el apoyo de su esposo  en donde ofrece comida de toda variedad y bebidas. Años atrás se dedicaba a estudiar. El préstamo lo invertirá en el pintado de su restaurante. En el grupo “JESUS PAN DE VIDA” cumple la función de secretaria. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Katherine es la que se encuentra adjunto en la parte superior izquierda que no pudo estar presente en la reunión por motivos laborales.
texts.en: Katherine is twenty-one years old. She has a dependent child with her partner. With the help of her partner, she has been carrying out her restaurant business for two years; their restaurant offers all sorts of food and beverages. Years ago, she was a student. She will use this loan to paint her restaurant. Within the "Jesús Pan De Vida" loan group, she acts as secretary. The group is grateful to Kiva lenders for their provided support. Katherine appears in the attached photo in the upper left corner; she was unable to be present at the meeting due to work reasons.

loans.use: to paint her restaurant.

loans.name: Santa Ana Group

texts.es: La Sra. Roberta   de 41  años de edad casada  y madre de  1 hijo, ella se dedica hace 18 años  a la venta de pollos y (menudencias) en un pequeño  mercado alquilado,  La Sra. Roberta   ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes   el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus  pollos y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más pollos   así poder salir adelante. A la vez  la Sra. Roberta  y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos con Kiva y Edaprospo por el préstamo otorgado  y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. A la Sra. Roberta  se le distingue por su polo  color rojo,  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
Roberta, 41, is married and the mother of one son. For 18 years she has sold chickens and giblets in a little rented market stall. Roberta has made loyal customers, which have made her an income, which covers her household expenses. In the future she would like to have her own shop where she can sell her chickens and make better profits.

With the requested loan, she will buy more chickens so she can succeed. Roberta and all the other members are grateful to Kiva and Edaprospo for the loan and for the trust that they have offered. In the photo, Roberta can be recognised by her red top. Roberta promises that she will fulfil all her proposed goals.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Las Azucenas Group

texts.es: Nidia de 34 años es casada y tiene 01 hijo, actualmente es socia del grupo “Las Azucenas” conformada por 08 socias entusiastas y trabajadoras que buscan mejorar cada día. Nidia se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza siendo sus mayores clientes familiares y vecinos de la zona.  Gracias  a su esfuerzo Nidia puede seguir apoyando a su familia. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de cremas, colonias, talcos, entre otros y de esta manera tener un stock guardado. El grupo “Las Azucenas” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito. Nidia se encuentra se encuentra de pie en la parte posterior, es la segunda del lado derecho y viste  polo color negro.
texts.en:
Nidia is 34 years old, married, and has one child. She is currently part of the group "Las Azucenas" (The Lilies), which consists of eight enthusiastic and hardworking members who are looking to improve each day.

Nidia sells beauty products. Most of her customers are relatives and neighbors in the area. Thanks to her efforts, Nidia is able to continue supporting her family. Her most recent loan request will be used to buy crèmes, colognes, talcum powders, and other items so that she can have a steady inventory.

The group "Las Azucenas" appreciates the people who made this loan possible. Nidia is standing at the back on the right-hand side, wearing a black shirt.

loans.use: to buy crèmes, colognes, talcum powders, and other items

loans.name: Gotitas De Amor Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Gotitas De Amor” está conformada por 07 mujeres  responsables con sus pagos. Eugenia de 38 años es separada y tiene 02 hijos 01 de ellos aún dependiente. Eugenia se dedica a la venta de pollos en un mercado cerca de su localidad, lleva más de 10 años en dicha actividad. Se siente feliz pues gracias a su esfuerzo puede brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Con el fin de seguir mejorando solicitó el crédito, la cual comprará pollos. Seguir implementando su negocio es su mayor anhelo. El grupo “Gotitas De Amor” agradecen a los inversionistas Kiva por apoyar en su progreso. Eugenia se encuentra sentada al lado izquierdo y tiene polo plomo.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Gotitas De Amor" (Little Drops of Love) consists of seven women who have been responsible with their payments.

Eugenia is 38 years old, separated from her spouse, and has two children, one of whom is still a dependent. She sells chickens at a market near her town. Eugenia has been in this business for more than 10 years. She is pleased because her efforts have resulted in a better quality of life for her family.

In hopes of continuing to improve, Eugenia is requesting a loan in order to buy chickens. Continuing her business is her greatest wish. The group "Gotitas De Amor" appreciates the Kiva lenders for supporting them as they make progress. Eugenia is seated on the left side and wearing a gray shirt.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es:
Juan, estudió hasta 8 grado de secundaria, está felizmente acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen 3 hijos que dependen económicamente de él,  por el momento ellos están estudiando, pero ya comenzaran a aportar dinero para la casa.

Juan se ha dedicado a ser empleado por mucho tiempo en su vida, trabajaba en una empresa vendiendo y distribuyendo helados en un camión, pero un día decidió independizarse y empezó a vender helados de forma independiente, pero lo realizaba caminando en las calles, con el tiempo notó que debía moverse más rápido para vender más, así que  se compró una motocicleta y de esta manera a mejorado sus ingresos, trabajando desde tempranas horas del día hasta el atardecer.

La época más calurosa del país es entre enero y abril, es en este tiempo donde la demanda de helados crece en gran manera, por lo tanto don Juan; necesita el préstamo para estar preparado para comprar más producto y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y obtener de su parte mayores ingresos.

Don Juan sueña con tener una mejor vivienda para su familia, pues en este momento vive solamente en un ranchito el cual está cubierto solamente con un nylon con el que se protegen del polvo y el agua y obtienen un poco de privacidad; y pues él quiere que su familia viva de una manera digna y feliz.
texts.en:
Juan studied up to 8th grade at high school and lives happily with his partner who is a housewife.  They have three children who he has to support financially.  At the moment, they are studying, but soon they will also start to contribute to the family income.

Juan has spent a lot of his life working.  He used to work in a company selling and distributing ice-cream in a truck.  However, one day he decided to go it alone and started selling ice-cream himself as he walked around the streets.  As time went on, he realized that he had to be more mobile so he bought a motorcycle.  This helped him to improve his profits as he continued to work from early in the morning until the evening.

The hottest part of the year is between January and April, which is when the demand for ice-cream goes up considerably.  Therefore, Juan needs this loan to be ready to buy more products and satisfy the customer demand, which will improve his income.

Juan dreams of having a better home for his family.  At the moment, they live in a hut which is protected from dust and water by a nylon sheet, giving them a little bit of privacy.  He would like his family to live in more dignified conditions and to be happy.

loans.use: to buy more ice-cream for the dry season.

loans.name: Lorena Marilú

texts.es:
Lorena de 37 años de edad, es una mujer luchadora quien culmino sus estudios de bachillerato, casada desde hace 12 años, madre de tres hijos los cuales están estudiando, su esposo tiene negocio propio en el cual se dedica a las tramitaciones aduanales.  

Ella por su parte, posee un negocio de venta de cosméticos en el cual ya tiene 6 años de experiencia, negocio al cual decidió dedicarse ya que su esposo se encontraba desempleado y una amiga le menciono sobre el negocio de venta de cosméticos casa por casa, y decidió entrar al negocio, luego comenzó a crecer en las ventas consiguiendo varios clientes a tal punto que ahora tiene personas trabajando para ella ya que no da abasto a cubrir su clientela.

El préstamo será utilizado, en la compra de más mercadería para el negocio, ya que sigue en ascenso y por lo cual necesita más capital de inversión y además, contratar una persona más, con lo cual genera empleo a otras personas. 

De momento la cliente menciona que el sueño que tiene es que sus hijos crezcan sanos y que logren culminar sus estudios, guiarlos junto a su esposos para que sean unas personas de bien, y en cuanto al negocio a futuro planea poner un puesto fijo y seguir siempre con la venta casa por casa y así seguir generando empleos.
texts.en:
Lorena, 37, is a hard-working woman who finished her studies at high school level.  She has been married for 12 years and has three children who are now studying.  Her husband has his own business dealing with customs procedures and paperwork.

Lorena, has her own business in which she sells cosmetics.  She has six year’s experience in this area.  She set herself up when her husband was unemployed and a friend mentioned the idea of selling cosmetics door to door.  Once she decided to start, her sales grew as she attracted many customers.  Now she has people working for her as she isn’t able to deal with all her customers herself.

She will use the loan to buy more goods for her business which continues to grow.  She needs more money to invest in it and to hire an extra person.  In this way she is also providing employment for other people, too.

At the moment her dream is to see her children grow up to be healthy and finish their studies.  Together with her husband she would like to bring them up as nice people.  As far as her business is concerned, she would like to have a fixed stall in the future, but also continue with her door to door sales and generate more work for others.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: David Osmin

texts.es:
En la fotográfia aparece David con una de sus hijas.

David de 35 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno año de secundaria, es una persona muy emprendedora y soñadora, está acompañado; su pareja se dedica a la panadería, labor que realiza en su casa con un horno de barro que tiene en el patio de su casa. Fruto de su relación la pareja tiene 5 hijos (4 niñas y un varón), todos viven juntos en armonía.

David se dedica a la albañilería, desde la adolescencia cuando inició como ayudante, el gusto por este oficio fue creciendo y también se volvió más ágil, fue ganando confianza y le empezaron a salir sus propios contratos, entonces decide independizarse, y ya lleva quince años dedicándose a esta labor, también sabe instalar closets para dormitorios. Le ha ido muy bien y espera seguir creciendo en conocimiento. La ciudad, donde realiza la mayoría de los trabajos, le queda a 15 minutos en carro aproximadamente donde labora hasta al atardecer.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para arreglar un carro que su hermano desde los Estados Unidos le regaló, espera obtener un buen dinero al venderlo, y de esta manera invertirlo en materiales para su negocio y otra pate tenerlo para su familia y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida.

David sueña con tener siempre trabajo y ganar fama, para de esta manera obtener mejores ingresos y que le pueda dar a sus hijos la mejor calidad de vida que se pueda, para que ellos lleguen a estudiar en la universidad y lleguen a ser futuros profesionales.
texts.en:
David, 35, who appears in the photo with one of his daughters, studied at high school until the 9th grade.  He is a very ambitious and entrepreneurial person.  He has a partner who works making bread in a clay oven which they have in their patio.  The couple has five children (four girls and one boy) and they all live together happily.

David has worked as a builder since he was a teenager.  He started out as a helper but his enthusiasm for this line of work grew and he became better at it.  As he became more confident, he started to get his own jobs and so he decided to work independently.  He has been doing this for 15 years now.  He can also build wardrobes in bedrooms.  Things have been going very well and he hopes to keep improving his skills.  The city where he does most of his work is about 15 minutes away by car and he works there until it goes dark.

He is asking for a loan to repair the car that his brother gave him from the U.S.  He hopes to sell it for a good price so that he can invest in material for his work.  Another part he will set aside for his family to help improve their standard of living.

David hopes to always have work and build a good reputation so that he can improve his income and provide a better life for his children so that they can study at university and become professionals themselves in the future.

loans.use: to repair a car that his brother gave him from the U.S.

loans.name: María Dinora

texts.es:
María estudió hasta 7mo año de secundaria, está felizmente casada, su pareja se dedica al trabajo agropecuario. Por situaciones naturales ella no puede tener hijos. Sin embargo, ha criado a cuatro muchachos que ella considera como hijos suyos, actualmente solo los dos menores viven con ellos y le ayudan en la tienda y en los oficios de casa y de campo. Ellos dependen económicamente de la pareja.

María administra una tienda ubicada en su casa, con la cual pasa entretenida vendiendo a sus vecinos que se acercan a comprar productos necesarios para el hogar, cuando no está vendiendo se dedica a los cuidados del hogar. Tiene 6 años de tener la tienda y la abrió porque en ese entonces su compañero de vida, no encontraba un buen trabajo y por lo tanto decidió abrirla y de esa manera obtener un ingreso para contribuir con las necesidades del hogar.

Ella necesita el préstamo, porque quiere arreglar el patio de la casa, el cual es de tierra y ella quiere ponerle cemento para que luzca mejor y sea más ventajoso para contrarrestar la época lluviosa, también quiere comprar más producto para su tienda, para tenerla más surtida y cubrir con la demanda de los clientes. Esto mejorara la comodidad familiar en cuanto al patio y aumentara los ingresos en cuanto a la tienda.

Ella aspira hacer más grande su negocio de manera que pueda abastecer, con las necesidades de cada una de las personas que viven en la zona, que no solo necesitan productos para el hogar; sino también insumos agrícolas para sus cultivos. Sueña con establecerse económicamente para que ella y toda su familia puedan gozar de una excelente calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria studied at high school until seventh grade.  She is happily married and her husband works in agriculture.  She is unable to have her own children; however, she has raised four boys who she thinks of as her own.  At the moment, only two of them live with her, helping her in her shop and with the jobs at home and in the fields.  They depend financially on her and her husband.

Maria has a shop set up in her house.  When she is not doing the housework, she enjoys selling household products to her neighbors.  She started the shop six years ago because at that time, her husband was unemployed and it was a way for her to generate an income to support her family.

She needs the loan to repair her patio, putting cement down over the earth so that it looks better and copes better in the rainy season.  She also wants to buy products for her shop, to be able to offer a wider range to suit her customers’ demand.  Repairing the patio will provide more comfort for the family and more products for her shop will help increase profit. 

She would like to improve her business to the point where she can cater for the needs of all those who live in her area.  They are customers who need not only household products, but also agricultural supplies.  She hopes to become financially secure so that her whole family can enjoy a better standard of living.

loans.use: to repair the patio in her house, putting down concrete so it is nicer and copes better with the rain; and also to buy more products for her shop to cover customer demand.

loans.name: Marta Julia

texts.es:
Marta de 56 años de edad, nunca fue a la escuela, está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a la agricultura y cuida ganado, tienen 4 hijos y ninguno vive con ellos pues todos están casados y nadie mas vive con ellos.  

 Marta se dedica a la agricultura desde que vivía con su papá, pues fue él quien le enseñó a trabajar, ella recuerda que siempre le decía que aprendiera a trabajar para que no dependiera solo de su marido y fue así que aprendió el trabajo. Además, desde hace 20 años vende tamales, enchiladas, pasteles, tostadas y más, ella se levanta a las 4:30 AM para preparar el desayuno a su pareja y luego va a dejar el ganado al potrero que se encuentra a unos 30 minutos de la casa, en ocasiones se queda trabajando con su esposo en la agricultura cuando no va a hacer venta, también 2 de sus hijos le ayudan en la preparación y venta de tamales.
  

El préstamos será utilizado, para comprar  2 novillas pues ya sacó la cosecha y le quedó el pasto bueno para repastear ganado y es por eso que solicita este préstamo a CREDICAMPO. 

Su sueño es poder comprar un terreno y dejarles un espacio a cada uno de sus hijos para que construyan su casa, comprar unas 4 vacas lecheras para tener otro ingreso económico, además de la ganancia espera pagar el crédito, para tener las puertas abiertas en la institución.
texts.en:
Marta is 56 years old and never went to school. She has a partner, who works in agriculture and cattle raising. The couple has four children, none of whom lives at home as they are all married. Marta and her partner live alone.

Marta has worked in agriculture since she lived with her father, who taught her this trade. Marta remembers that he always said that she must learn to work so that she would not always depend on her husband. In addition to the agricultural work, for 20 years Marta has also been selling tamales, enchiladas, cakes and other items. Marta gets up at 4.30am in order to prepare her partner's breakfast and then she goes out to take the cattle to the pasture, 30 minutes away from the house. Marta sometimes stays to help her husband with the farming work if she is not going out to sell her foods. Two of the couple's children help Marta to prepare and sell the tamales.

This loan from Credicampo will be used to buy two young bulls as, having collected the harvest, the pasture is good grazing cattle. 

Marta's dream is to buy a plot of land and to leave a space on it for each of her children to build their own houses. She also wants to buy four dairy cows in order to have another source of income. Marta also wants to pay off her loan in order to have the possibility of taking out a  future loan.

loans.use: to buy two young bulls as, having collected the harvest, the pasture is good grazing cattle.

loans.name: Rosa Aminta

texts.es:
Rosa de 35 años de edad, estudió hasta 7mo año del colegio, está felizmente acompañada, su compañero de vida es empleado en una hacienda ganadera donde realiza diferentes actividades correspondientes a la ganadería, con él solo tiene una hija que siempre anda con ella. En total Rosa, tiene 4 hijos, 3 de ellos fruto de un  matrimonio que por situaciones de la vida tuvo que terminar, de esos tres solo una hija vive en su casa. También, vive con ellos la mamá deRosa, que es la dueña original de la casa y  goza en gran manera de las alegrías de sus nietos.

Hace algún tiempo Rosa, emigró hacia los Estados Unidos en busca de una mejor vida, allá trabajó por 5 años amueblando casas, trabajo que le rindió algunos frutos.  Posteriormente, decidió regresar a su tierra natal a establecerse nuevamente. Hace un año decidió comprar un camión con el cual con ayuda de su  compañero de vida realizan varios viajes a personas que necesitan transportar animales, material agrícola, arena, jugadores de futbol etc. La idea surgió por la gran demanda de transporte de carga que existía en la zona, esto le ha generado buenos ingresos y esperan seguir haciéndolo.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para arreglar un baño de la casa, en el cual quiere instalarle una ducha, lavamanos,  luz eléctrica y repellar las paredes, para de esta manera ir poco a poco mejorando su vivienda.

Rosa aspira con comprar otro camión y de esta manera aumentar sus ganancias, para tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia. También sueña con ver que sus hijos triunfar y lleguen a ser buenos profesionales para el país y así  formar sus propios hogares.
texts.en:
Rosa, 35, studied until seventh grade.  She lives happily with her partner who works on a cattle ranch.  Together they have one daughter, who is always by her side.  Rosa has four children in total, three others from another marriage which ended because of certain things that happen in life.  Of these three other children, only one daughter lives with her.  Rosa’s mother also lives with them.  The house was hers originally and she loves spending time with her grandchildren.

A while ago, Rosa went to the United States to look for a better life.  She worked there for five years furnishing houses.  She was quite successful in this job.  Later, she decided to return home and settle down again.  A year ago she decided to buy a truck which she uses with the help of her partner to make trips for people who need to transport animals, agricultural supplies, sand, even a football team and other things.  She got the idea due to the high demand for heavy goods transport in the area.  This business has generated a lot of income and she hopes it will continue.

She is asking for a loan to renovate a bathroom in her house.  She wants to install a shower, washbasin, light and plaster the walls.  This will help her to gradually improve her home.

She would like to buy another truck to increase her profits and have a better quality of life for her family.  She also hopes to see her children be successful and become good workers for the country and form a household of their own.

loans.use: to renovate a bathroom in her house, installing a shower, washbasin and light and also plastering the walls; all of which will help her improve her home.

loans.name: Osmar De La Cruz

texts.es:
Osmar de 30 años de edad,  es una persona trabajadora con muchos sueños en su vida, estudió hasta 9no año de secundaria, está felizmente casado y su pareja se dedica a los cuidados del hogar, tienen 4 hijos, de los cuales 2 de ellos van a la escuela y todos dependen económicamente de él.

Osmar ha tenido muchos trabajos en su vida, pero lo que más le gustó fue lo de elaborar tejas de barro para las casas, aprendió este oficio trabajando en las principales tejerías de la zona, donde conoció todo el proceso necesario que esto conlleva, desde batir el barro hasta cocerlo en el horno, fue así que decidió independizarse y abrir su propia tejería. Con esfuerzo y dedicación las cosas se les han ido dando, por el momento ninguno de sus hijos se involucran en el trabajo pues todavía están muy pequeños, pero espero poder heredarles este arte.

Don Osmar sabe que es en verano cuando la gente se prepara para la venida del invierno y por lo tanto necesitan techos seguros que los resguarden de la lluvia. Él necesita el préstamo, para pagar la suficiente mano de obra y que sus empleados se sientan satisfechos y de esta manera que su negocio siempre este en actividad, para obtener buenos ingresos para ser utilizarlos con su familia.

Él sueña con tener una tejera que sea reconocida en toda la zona y poder darle a su familia la calidad de vida con la que él siempre ha soñado, para así ver que sus hijos crezcan sanos y estudien en la universidad, para llegar a ser buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Osmar is 30 years old. He is hard-working and has many dreams. Osmar completed up to ninth grade at secondary school. He is happily married and his wife is a housewife. The couple has four children, two of whom are in school and all of whom depend financially upon their father.

Osmar has had many jobs in his life but the one he liked most was producing mud tiles for houses. He learned this trade working at tile factories in the area. There he learned all he needed to know about the process, from beating the mud to cooking it in the oven. After learning all this, Osmar decided to go it alone and open his own tile factory. With effort and dedication, things have been going well. None of Osmar's children are involved in the work yet but they are still very young. Osmar hopes that they will inherit this skill.

Osmar know that it is in summer that people being to prepare for winter and, so, they need safe tiles that protect their houses from the rain. Osmar needs this loan to pay labourers and to make sure his employees are happy so that his business is always operating. With this he can earn a good income to use to support his family.

Osmar dreams of having a tile factory that is known across the local area and of being able to give the quality of life he has always dreamed of to his family. He wants to see his children grow up healthy and study at university so that they can have a profession.

loans.use: to pay labourers and to make sure his employees are happy so that his business is always operating.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
María de 37 años de edad,  estudio hasta bachillerato, ya no siguió por lo económico y porque formo su propia familia, ella esta acompañada y su pareja trabaja en una escuela como entrenador de fútbol, tiene 2 hijos y están estudiando bachillerato, y nadie mas vive con ellos.

María se dedica al comercio en una tienda desde hace tres años, antes trabajaba en una distribuidora de productos. Pero, comenta que un día con su compañero decidieron  iniciar su propio negocio. Pues ella todo el día pasaba fuera  de casa y se descuidaba de sus hijos y fue por eso que decidieron abrir una pequeña tienda, para no descuidar la casa. Ella se levanta  a las 5:AM para atender los clientes que llegan a buscar el pan y el café muy temprano, en el negocio se involucra toda su familia. 

El préstamo sera utilizado,  para comprar 10 quintales de maíz, 10 de frijol,20 galones de aceite, 15 fardos de papel higiénico,20 fardos de lejía  20 fardos de detergente, 5 qq de azúcar, 10 cajas de jabón , de lavar ropa y también  una parte de ese dinero lo invertirá en los gastos del estudio de sus  hijos. 

Su sueño es ver a sus hijos graduarse en una carrera universitaria,ya que ella no lo logro,tener una tienda más grande,construir su propia casa ya que hoy vive en una casa de su mamá. Con las ganancias espera pagar el crédito y ahorrar para poder cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
María is 37 years old and completed high school. After that she did not continue her education for financial reasons and because she started her own family. María has a partner, who works as a school football coach. The couple has two children, both in high school. Nobody else lives in the house with the family.

Having worked in a distribution centre beforehand, María has now been running a shop for three years. She tells us that, one day, she and her colleague decided to start their own business. In her previous job María spent all day away from the home and didn't look after her children. Because of this, she and her colleague opened a small shop, so as not to neglect their households. María gets up at 5am to tend to customers who come looking for bread and coffee very early. All the family works at the business.

This loan will be used to buy 1000 lbs of corn, 1000 lbs, of beans, 20 gallons of water, 15 packs of toilet paper, 20 packs of bleach, 20 packs of detergent, 500 lbs of sugar, 10 boxes of soap for washing clothes, and to help pay for her children's education.

María's dream is to see her children graduate from university as she was never able to do this. She wants to have a bigger shop and build her own house, as she currently lives in a house owned by her mother. With her profits, María hopes to pay off her loan and to save up to be able to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to buy 1000 lbs of corn, 1000 lbs, of beans, 20 gallons of water, 15 packs of toilet paper, 20 packs of bleach, 20 packs of detergent, 500 lbs of sugar, 10 boxes of soap for washing clothes, and to help pay for her children's education.

loans.name: José David

texts.es:
David de 25 años de edad es bachiller, esta acompañado, su compañera de vida se dedica al oficio de la casa y tiene un hijo de un año de edad, actualmente vive en casa de su suegra ya que él no tiene una casa propia.

David es empleado en un taller de electricidad automotriz, desde hace 5 años, se dedica a este oficio ya que en  el bachillerato aprendio un poco y como ya no pudo seguir estudiando, busco trabajo en este taller, para ello viaja 11 kilometros de ida y 11 kilometros de regreso.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una motocicleta, ya que aveces sale tarde de su trabajo y ya no encuentra bus, para regresar a casa y en su motocicleta ya no tendrá ese problema. 

David planea ahorrar para comprarse un terreno y luego hacer su propia casa y dar a su hijo estudio para que sea un profesional.
texts.en:
David is 25 years old and has a bachelor’s degree.  His wife is a housewife and they have a one year old son.  They currently live with his mother-in-law since he doesn’t have a home of his own.

David has been working for an automotive electrical workshop for five years and does this type of work that he learned as part of his bachelor’s education.  He sought out a job in this workshop since he was not able to continue studying.  He has to travel 11 km each way to get to work. 

He is asking for this loan to buy a motorcycle, since he sometimes works late and can’t find a bus to get home.  He will no longer have this problem with a motorcycle.  David plans to save up to buy land and then build his own house so that his son will become a professional.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: José Medardo

texts.es:
José de 45 años de edad, solo estudio tercer grado, ya que su madre no tuvo las condiciones económicas para darle estudio, él esta acompañado y su compañera de vida se dedica a atender una pequeña tienda que posee, junto con ellos vive su mamá  la cual ya esta muy anciana.

José tiene una tiendita desde hace 6 años y se dedica a la corta de caña en una hacienda, tambien trabaja como vigilante se ha dedicado a esto, ya que no tiene ninguna otra oportunidad de empleo, para ir a su trabajo viaja en bicicleta unos 7 kms de ida y 7kms de regreso. 


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar maya metálica y cerrar su terreno, ya que así podrá tener un poco mas de seguridad de que no se le metan a robarle a su tienda.

José  sueña con hacer mas grande su tienda, para lo cual debe administrar bien sus ganancias y sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Jose is 45 years old and has a third grade education, since his mother did not have the financial resources to provide him with an education.  He is married  and his wife is in charge of the small store they have.  His elderly mother lives with them.

Jose has had his store for six years and he also cuts sugar cane on a plantation and works as a security guard.  He does these things because he doesn’t have any other work opportunities.  He rides a bicycle 7km each way to get to work.

He is asking for this loan to buy a metal fence to close off his land so he can be a bit more secure and prevent burglaries to his store.

Jose dreams of growing his store for which he must carefully manage his profits and savings.

loans.use: to put up a fence.

loans.name: Santos Ysabel

texts.es:
Santos de 49 años de edad,  no asistió a la escuela pues a sus padres nunca les pareció importante el estudio, está casada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura y al comercio, tiene 4 hijos, 3 ya están acompañados solo 1 vive con ellos y está estudiando en la escuela.

Santos se dedica a la venta de tamales, atol desde hace 20 años pues nos contó que fue la necesidad la que la llevó a dedicarse al comercio, ya que era una forma de ayudarle a su pareja y sacar a sus hijos adelante, además tiene otro ingreso de un molino, antes de dedicarse al comercio ella trabajaba en la agricultura. Su día comienza a las 4:00 AM donde se levanta a preparar el atol porque a las 5:30 llegan los primeros clientes, luego su esposo sale a venderlo de casa en casa y a veces va a los trabajadores del cañal, mientras su esposo sale a vender ella atiende el molino, por la tarde hace tostadas, enchiladas y otros.    
  

El préstamo será invertido en la construcción de una granja o porqueriza donde comprará 4 cerdos, 1 cerda reproductora y 3 cerdos, además de concentrado, vacunas y vitaminas.


Su sueño es que su última niña, se gradúe en una carrera universitaria, además sueña con construir su casa de ladrillo que hoy es de adobe, con la ganancia espera cancelar el crédito y de lo que le sobre espera cumplir el sueño de tener una granja grande.
texts.en:
Santos is 49 years old and did not go to school as her parents did not think education was important. Santos is married and her husband works in farming and in business. The couple has four children - three are already married and just one lives at home still. She is studying in school.

Santos has been making a living selling tamales and "atol" (a cornflour drink) for 20 years. She tells us that she started this business out of necessity, as it was a way of helping her husband and of helping of her children to get ahead. Santos also earns an income from the grinder which she owns. Before starting her business, Santos worked in agriculture.

Santos' day starts at 4am, when she gets up to prepare the cornflour drink. At 5.30, her first customers arrive. Later, Santos' husband goes out to sell the drink from door-to-door and, sometimes, to the canal workers. When her husband is out making sales, Santos tends to customers looking to use the grinder. In the afternoon, she makes enchiladas, fried tortillas and other foods.

This loan will be used to build a farm or pigsty; Santos will buy four pigs, one sow and three boards as well as feeds, vaccinations and vitamins.

Santos' dream is for her youngest daughter to graduate from university; she also dreams of building a brick house as her current house was made with adobe blocks. With her earnings, Santos hopes to pay off her debt and, with money left over, she hopes to achieve her dream of having a big farm.

loans.use: to build a farm or pigsty; she will buy four pigs, one sow and three boards as well as feeds, vaccinations and vitamins.

loans.name: Nostalgia Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NOSTALGIA” iniciará el décimo tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Erlinda es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de celulares, venta de material de escritorio, venta de ropa, venta de víveres, venta de joyas, venta de cosméticos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Erlinda es integrante, ella indica que hace tres ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su tía hace varios años al apoyarle en su negocio, posterior a tener su pareja decide emprender su negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa) que adquirirá de las tienda mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la puntualidad que realiza su Banca Comunal.
texts.en:
The “NOSTALGIA” communal bank is in its thirteenth cycle in Pro Mujer, as a part of the Los Andes center. It is made up of eight members and is led by a board of directors of which Erlinda is the president. The businesses the members have in the association are varied. Among them are selling food, selling cell phones, selling stationery, selling clothes, selling groceries, selling jewelry, and selling cosmetics. 

The loan they will take out will benefit the micro-businesswomen, including Erlinda. She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for three cycles. She joined at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Right now, she has a business selling clothes. She says that she learned this business from her aunt several years ago when she helped her in her business. Later she and her spouse decided to start their own independent business.
 
The loan she will take out is to increase capital by buying clothes. She will acquire them in the wholesaler stores in the city of El Alto. Later she will sell them in her sales space. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, since she is in a common law marriage and has four children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the punctuality in her communal bank.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Alai

texts.en: Alai is a 39-year-old married woman with three children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, bananas, and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Alai has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a weed sprayer, axes, taro roots, a spade, filings, and a wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SBPD since 2009. With her profits, Alai hopes to improve her business and to support her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a weed sprayer, axes, taro roots, a spade, filings, and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Tuafale

texts.en: Tuafale is 25 years old and married with 2 children. She runs a small business selling fish in her community and has been doing this for many years. Tuafale has requested a loan to buy a torch, a spear, a knife, hooks, goggles, and fishing nets. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Tuafale will improve her house and save more money for her children's educations.

loans.use: to buy a torch, a spear, a knife, hooks, goggles, and fishing nets.

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
José Antonio es un microempresario cliente de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:

José tiene 46 años, es casado y tiene 2 hijos. Vive en casa propia y tiene una estética como negocio. 

Su estética está ubicada en la avenida principal de la colonia, de esta manera sus clientas ya lo tienen ubicado; y así, lo buscan y recomiendas. José Antonio comenta que afortunadamente siempre tiene clientes en el salón. Pide este préstamo para comprar mercancía necesaria para su negocio, como lo son tintes, peróxidos, tenazas y secadoras. 

Gracias al esfuerzo de su negocio, en conjunto con la ayuda de su esposa, ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. Su principal reto es hacer crecer más su negocio, consiguiendo un local más grande.
texts.en:
José Antonio has a small business and is a customer with this Kuba Financiero organisation. This is his story.

José is 46 years old, married and has two children. He lives in his own house and runs a beauty salon.

His beauty salon is on the main street of the local area and so his customers can find him easily. Customers look for José and recommend him to others. José tells us that, fortunately, he always has customers at his work. He is applying for this loan in order to buy necessary merchandise for his business, such as dyes, peroxides, tweezers and hairdryers. 

Thanks to his effort at work, alongside his wife José has been able to help the family to prosper. His main challenge has been expanding his business and looking for larger premises.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as dyes, peroxide, straighteners, and hairdryers, for his business.

loans.name: Trabajadoras De Barcenas Group

texts.es:
Duo Trabajadoras de Barcenas
Berta tiene 39 años de edad, es casada, tiene 5 hijos de (19, 17,15, 12,9) ella  se dedica a la venta de helados, gelatinas, agua pura y diversidad de frutas con chocolate,  inicio su negocio debido  a que su familia es muy grande el ingreso del esposo no alcanzaba para poder proporcionarles a sus hijos lo básico,  actualmente gracias a los ingresos que generan el negocio ha podido darles la oportunidad a su hijo mayor a terminar una carrera a nivel medio y así la familia tendrá un mejor futuro,  agradece el apoyo que se le brinda con créditos para poder seguir invirtiendo en su negocio su mayor ahnelo es tener una casita propia ya que actualmente alquila.
texts.en:
Duo Trabajadoras de Barcenas

Berta, 39, is married and has 5 children ages 19, 17, 15, 12 and 9. She sells ice cream, gelatin, filtered water and a variety of fruits with chocolate. She started her business because she has a large family and her husband’s income wasn’t enough to provide for her children’s basic needs. Now, thanks to her income that she earns from her business, she has been able to give her eldest son the opportunity to finish school and therefore allowing her family to have a better future. 

She is grateful for the support given to her with the loan, to be able to continue investing in her business. Her greatest wish is to have her own house as she is now renting.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make ice cream.

loans.name: Dúo Morando Con Cristo Group

texts.es:
DUO Morando con cristo
Doña Consuelo es originaria de la aldea xenimajuyu, del municipio de Tecpán, ella tiene 58 años de edad, bajo su responsabilidad esta su hijo, ella cuenta con una pequeña tienda de venta de artículos de consumo diario y también a la elaboración de tejidos a mano.
Desde hace varios años ella se ha dedicado a estas actividades y gracias a Dios poco a poco a podido salir adelante, gracia también al apoyo de su esposo y el de sus hijos ella sigue adelante con su negocio. 
El sueño de ella es ampliar más su tienda, surtirlo con más variedad de productos, ya que así ella tendrá mejores ganancias y mandar a su hijo a la escuela para un futuro mejor.
Ha tenido varios créditos kivas, gracias a Dios y a la responsabilidad de ella en sus pagos no ha caído en mora, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles(consumo diario)
texts.en:
Consuelo is from the village of Xenimajuyu, in Tecpán. She is 58 years old and has one son in her care. She has a small grocery store and she also makes hand-made fabrics. She has been doing both for several years and fortunately she has been able to get ahead little by little. Thanks also to her husband and children's support, she keeps her business going.
 
Her dream is to expand her store and stock up on a wider variety of products, because that will result in better earnings and she will be able to send her son to school so that he can have a better future.

She has received several Kiva loans and thanks to God and to her own responsibility she has never been delinquent on her payments. She is requesting this loan to buy basic food items.

loans.use: to buy food items to sel..

loans.name: Dúo Deslumbrante Ll Group

texts.es: dúo deslumbrante ll esta formado por doña Edendida Cecilia de 36 años  ella tiene 3 hijos de (16, 8, 12)  ella actualmente tiene en su domicilio su negocio,  ella vende una variedad de productos como (ropa para dama, niños, caballero, juguetes, utensilios de cocina etc.) su negocio lo inició vendiendo ropa de dama,  ella  solicita un crédito para invertir en la compra de mercadería como pantalones para dama y para niña ya que es una temporada donde sus clientes necesitan ropa para la feria de ciudad vieja y la temporada navideña, ella quiere aprovechar para obtener mejores ventas en su negocio y lograr surtir mejor su negocio para estas fechas, su mayor sueño es poderle dar a sus hijos una mejor educación  y darle mejores oportunidades la cual ella no pudo, su hija mayor inicia la universidad el próximo año, espera que ustedes le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
The group "Deslumbrante II" was stated by Doña Edendida Cecilia. She is 36 years old and has three children (ages 16, 8, and 12). Edendida currently has a business in her home where she sells a variety of products such as clothing for women, children, and men; toys; cooking utensils; and other items. She originally started out selling women's clothing.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of merchandise, such as women's and girls' trousers, since this is the time when her customers need clothes for the old city fair and for the Christmas season. Edendida wants to take advantage of this opportunity to generate better sales for her business and to have more inventory so that she can be stocked for these dates.

Her greatest wish is to provide her children with the best education and to give them better opportunities that she was not able to have. Her oldest daughter starts university next year, so she hopes that the Kiva lenders will help with the loan that she has requested.

loans.use: to buy new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Las Elegidas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS ELEGIDAS” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Victoria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura de deportivos, venta de plásticos, venta de comida, venta de batidos, carnicería, servicio de reparación de aparatos electrónicos, venta de ropa, tejido de busos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Victoria es integrante, ella indica que hace dos ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de servicio de reparación de aparatos electrónicos; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendieron conjuntamente su esposo, ya que él conocía la técnica, la que poco a poco aprendió y en la actualidad es la mano derecha de su esposo. 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cables y herramientas) que adquirirá de las tiendas de la Ciudad de Oruro y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.

En la fotografía se identifica a una señora que acompaña al grupo, ella esta vestida con una chopa nergra con franjas blancas
texts.en:
The communal bank "Las Elegidas" will begin its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata regional center. It consists of eight members and is led by a board of directors, where Señora Victoria is the president. The businesses of the members of the group are varied; among them are sports clothing, selling plastic items, selling food, selling smoothies, butcher shop, electronic repair services, selling clothing, and knitting sweaters.

The loan that they will take out will benefit these little microentrepreneurs, of which Señora Victoria is a member. She comments that she joined Pro Mujer two loan cycles ago, entering at the invitation of a loan officer of the institution who went to visit her in her home. At this time she has a business of providing repair services for electronic equipment; she makes it known that she and her husband began this business together, since he knew the technology, which she learned little by little, and now she is the right hand of her husband.

The loan that she will take out is to increase their capital to buy cables and tools, which she will acquire in the shops in the city of Oruro and then will put in their sales space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support their family, since she is married and has three children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health area that the institution offers.

In the photo is a woman who accompanied the group. She is wearing a black sweater with white bands.

loans.use: to buy cables and tools

loans.name: Akapana Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AKAPANA”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lucia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de lanas, tejido de prendas, , venta de leche, venta de toallas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lucia es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de leche; cuenta que este negocio lo implemento por recomendación de su madre quien le enseño este negocio desde niña, cuando falleció su esposo decide comenzar con el mimo negocio independientemente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de forraje para ganado) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de las comunidades aledañas a su domicilio y posteriormente  a la crianza, comercializará la leche a las empresas lácteas. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es viuda y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el pago del crédito que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Akapana" will begin its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana regional center. It consists of eight members, and it is led by a board of directors, where Señora Lucia is the president. The businesses of the members of the group are varied; among them are selling food, selling wool, knitting clothing, selling milk, and selling towels.

The loan that they will take out will benefit these small microentrepreneurs, of which Señora Lucia is a member. She states that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago at the invitation of a loan officer from the institution who came to visit her in her home. At this time she has a business of selling milk. She relates that she set up this business on the recommendation of her mother, who taught her this business when she was a little girl. When her husband died, she decided to begin the same business independently.

The loan that she is taking out now is to increase her capital to buy fodder for her livestock, which she will acquire from the wholesalers in the communities surrounding her home, and after breeding them, she will sell the milk to the dairy businesses. This form of work allows her to maintain her household as best she can, since she is a widow and has three children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the loan payment plans that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy fodder for livestock

loans.name: Kalala

texts.en: Kalala is a 34-year-old married woman with no children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, bananas and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Kalala has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a weed sprayer, bush knives, spades and a wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. With her profits, Kalala hopes to improve her business and to support her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a weed sprayer, bush knives, spades and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Fagalua

texts.en: Fagalua is a 57-year-old woman who is married with 5 children. She has a small Samoan cocoa business. She has 4 years of experience with this business. Fagalua needs a loan to buy cocoa beans, foam cups, fertilizer, and a backpack sprayer. She will use her profits to upgrade her family's standard of living. Fagalua joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy cocoa beans, foam cups, fertilizer, and a backpack sprayer.

loans.name: Puerta Del Sol Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PUERTA DEL SOL” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Margarita es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de carne de chancho, venta de vasos, venta de ovejas, venta de gorras, costura de busos, tienda de abarrotes, tejido de mantas, venta de pescados.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Margarita es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de papa y chuño (papa deshidratada); da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio porque desde niña ella ya conocía la forma de comercialización de estos productos porque ayudaba a su madre.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papa y chuño) que adquirirá de las comunidades aledañas a la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Puerta del Sol" will begin its fifth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata regional center. It consists of nine members and is led by a board of directions, where Señora Margarita is the president. The businesses of the members of the communal bank are varied; among them are selling pork, selling drinking glasses, selling sheep, selling hats, making casual clothes, grocery store, weaving blankets, and selling fish.

The loan that they will take out will benefit these little microentrepreneurs, of which Señora Margarita is a member. She indicates that she became a member of Pro Mujer three years ago, joining at the invitation of a loan officer from the institution who came to visit her in her home. At this time she has a business of selling potatoes and chuño (dehydrated potatoes); she lets it be known that she began this business because she knew how to commercialize these products since she was a little girl, because she helped her mother.

The loan that she will take out now will be used to increase her capital to buy potatoes and chuño, which she will acquire in the communities surrounding the city of La Paz, and then she will sell them in her sales space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, since she is married and has three children.

When she is asked what she likes about Por Mujer, she responds that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and dehydrated potatoes to sell

loans.name: Olive

texts.en: Olive is a single 47-year-old lady. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has 3 years of experience with this business. Olive needs a loan to buy bags of flour, cooking oil, baking powder, yeast, tongs, etc. She plans to use her profits to expand her business and to save for unexpected emergencies. Olive has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, cooking oil, baking powder, yeast, tongs, etc

loans.name: Gotitas De Oro Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “GOTITAS DE ORO” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Julia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de artefactos electrónicos, venta de carne de cordero, elaboración de bancos, venta de productos ESIKA, tejido de mantas y gorras, venta de cerveza, venta de tullmas (cordones para trenzas de mujeres), taller mecánico.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Julia es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su hija que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller mecánico; da a conocer que este negocio lo trabaja conjuntamente su esposo, ya que después de casado deciden emprender esta actividad.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arco para soldar metal) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a lo instalará en su espacio de servicio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y el crédito accesible que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Gotitas de Oro" (Droplets of Gold) will begin its fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of Los Andes regional center. It consists of nine members and is led by a board of directors, where Señora Julia is the president. The businesses of the members of the group are varied; among them are selling electronic devices, selling lamb meat, making benches, selling Esika products, knitting blankets and hats, selling beer, selling tullmas (ties for women's braids), and mechanics shop.

The loan that they will take out will benefit these little microentrepreneurs, where Señora Julia is a member. She indicates that she became a member of Pro Mujer two years ago, joining at the invitation of her daughter, who is a member of the institution. At this time her business is a mechanic's shop; she makes it known that she works together with her husband in this business, since they decided to set up this business after getting married.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase their capital to buy an arc for soldering metal, which she will acquire from merchants in the city of La Paz and then will install in their service space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, since she is married and has five children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health area and the accessible credit that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy an arc to solder metal

loans.name: Kiswaras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KISWARAS”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Damiana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de pan de laja, venta de tucumanas, panadería, venta de cerveza, venta de juguetes, venta de verduras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Damiana es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de panadería; cuenta que este negocio lo implemento por recomendación de su madre quien le enseño este negocio desde niña, cuando decide tener pareja comenzó con el negocio independientemente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de harina) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el pago del crédito que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank ‘KISWARAS’ is starting its third cycle with Pro Mujer, through the Copacabana regional office. The communal bank is made up of eight members and is headed by a board of directors, of which Damiana is the President. The members of this communal bank have various businesses, including selling Laja bread, selling tucumanas [a type of empanada, a meat-filled pastry], a bakery, selling beer, selling toys and fruit sales.

This loan will be used to benefit small business owners, including Damiana. She says she has been a member of Pro Mujer for two years, joining by invitation of a facilitator who visited her at home. Currently, Damiana has a bakery business. She says that she started this business on recommendation from her mother, who taught her the business as a child. When she decided to have a partner, she started the business independently.

The loan she is taking out now will increase her capital (to buy flour), which she will buy from wholesale vendors from Cuidad de La Paz. She will then sell her products in her retail space. This kind of work helps her generate income to support her household, as she lives in a common-law marriage and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Damiana replies that she likes the loan payments that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy flour

loans.name: Gladiolos De Parcopata Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “GLADIOLOS DE PARCOPATA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Alejandra es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas, venta de verduras, artesano de mantas de vicuña, venta de carne, servicio de construcción.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Alejandra es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su hermano que es socio de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de carne; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años, ya que era el negocio familiar, posteriormente a tener su propia familia decide seguir con el negocio independientemente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de carne) que adquirirá de las comunidades cercanas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar, ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “GLADIOLOS DE PARCOPATA” communal bank will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer, as a part of the Villa Adela regional center.  The association is made up of 8 members and is directed by a board of which Alejandra is the President.  The businesses that the association members carry out vary, and among them are: blanket weaving, the sale of vegetables, artisan vicuna blankets, the sale of meat, and construction services.  The loans they take out benefit small business owners, including Alejandra.  

Alejandra indicates that this is the first time she is a part of Pro Mujer, joining thanks to the invitation of her brother who is a member of the institution.   At the moment, she has a butcher business; this work she learned several years ago, as it was a family business. Later, when she had her own family, she decided to continue with the business independently.  
 
The loan requested now will be used for an increase in inventory (purchase of meat) that will be acquired from the nearby communities of Ciudad de El Alto and will later be sold in her retail space.   This work allows her to earn income that will help her maintain her home, as she is single and has 2 children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the ability of the institution to offer her a means of saving.

loans.use: to purchase meat

loans.name: Por Siempre Alegres Sr Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “POR SIEMPRE ALEGRES SR” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes (ocho mujere y un varon) y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Valeriana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de polainas, venta de accesorios de vehículos, venta de ropa de bebe, venta de comida, tejido de mantas, venta de busos, carnicería, venta de bañadores.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Valeriana es integrante, ella indica que es el primer ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de abarrotes y carne; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia y ya que en los mercados de la ciudad de El estos productos tienen amplia comercialización.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de aceite y heladera) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de capacitación en crédito y salud que le ofrece la institución.

En la imagen falta una señora que se retiró porque tuvo que irse a su negocio.
texts.en:
“Por Siempre Alegres SR” (Always Cheerful SR) is a Communal Bank that will start its seventh cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Community Center. It is composed of nine members, eight women and one man, and guided by a directive board presided over by Valeriana. The member of the Communal Bank engage in different activities such as knitting leggings, selling car accessories, selling clothes for babies, weaving blankets, selling sweatshirts, running a butcher shop, selling bathing suits.

Valeriana is one of the micro entrepreneurs forming this group, and she will benefit from the requested loan. She says she has been a member of Pro Mujer for one cycle, having been invited by a friend who is a member of the institution. She is currently running a butcher shop selling groceries and meat, an activity she says she has started out of her own initiative and that she works in the markets of the town of El. These products sell very well.

The loan she is now requesting will be used to increase her working capital by buying oil and a fridge that she will buy from wholesalers in the town of El Alto, to then sell it in her stall. This type of activity helps her earning an income to economically support her family, as she is married and she has three children.

When asked about what she likes of Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the seminars on loan and health offered by the institution.

One of the ladies is missing from the picture because she was called from her shop and had to go there.

loans.use: To buy oil and a fridge.

loans.name: Concenti2 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CONCENTI2” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Fermina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de jugos de quinua, hilado de lana de vicuña, venta de fruta, elaboración de pan, venta de pollos a la broster, servicio de transporte, costura de mochilas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Fermina es integrante, ella indica que hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de pollos a la broster; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años de un trabajo anterior, posteriormente a su matrimonio decide emprender su propio espacio de comercialización.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de carne de pollo por mayor) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar, ya que ella es casada y tiene siete hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro  que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The CONCENTI2 communal bank will begin its sixth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Adela regional center.  It is comprised of eight members, and it is led by a board of directors.  Fermina is the president.  The businesses of the members of the communal bank are varied and include selling quinoa juices, spinning vicuna wool, selling fruit, making bread, selling roasted chicken, transportation service, and making backpacks.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small businesswomen where Fermina is a member.  She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for six months.  She joined by invitation from a friend, who is a member of the institution.  She currently has a business selling roasted chicken.  She says that she learned this business several years ago from a previous job.  After her marriage, she decided to undertake her own sales space.

The loan that she will now take out is to buy chicken wholesale, which she will get at the wholesale stores in the city of El Alto.  She will later make the chicken and sell it at her sales space.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support, as much as possible, her household.  She is married and has seven children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes the savings that the institution offers her.

loans.use: to buy chicken wholesale.

loans.name: Alianza Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ALIANZA” iniciará el vigésimo segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Antonia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de chancaca (dulce andino), venta de queso, tejido y venta de manta, taller de cerrajería, artesanías, tienda de barrio, adornos de auto, tejido de prendas de vestir.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Antonia es integrante, ella indica que hace diez ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia y ya que en los mercados de la ciudad de El Alto al observar el amplio mercado que tiene.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The community association group "ALIANZA" [Alliance] will begin its twenty-second cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Pan American regional office. The group consists of eight members and is headed by a board of which Antonia is President. The businesses that the members of the community association have are varied and include the sale of chancaca (an Andean sweet), selling cheese, weaving and selling blankets, a locksmith shop, crafts, a neighborhood store, selling car decorations, and knitting garments.

The loan they are requesting will be useful for a small microentrepreneur like Antonia. She has been working with Pro Mujer for ten cycles, entering on an invitation from a friend who is also a member of the institution. Today, she has a business selling food. She learned this business on her own initiative observing the ample markets in the city of El Alto. 

The loan she is requesting will bring an increase in working capital to purchase vegetables wholesale in the markets in the city of El Alto. She will then sell the products in her retail space. This business allows her to generate resources to support her family, her husband and two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Antonia says that she likes the health training offered by the institution.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale vegetables.

loans.name: Plana Mayor Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PLANA MAYOR” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Estela es la Presidenta.
