The loan that they are taking out will benefit small-time microentrepreneurs, one of whom is Natty.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer three cycles ago, signing up due to an invitation from one of the organization’s promotors, who visited her in her home.  She currently has a business exporting artisan dolls.  She shares that she began this type of work to help her aunt with her aunt’s business.  Later she decided to begin her own business to help her husband.

The loan that she is taking out is to increase her capital and buy fabric, which she will get from the wholesale stores in El Alto city.  After making the dolls, she will sell them in her business.  This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family, because she is married and has a child.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the organization’s health sphere.

One woman is missing in the photo because she had a medical appointment.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Los Andes Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LOS ANDES” iniciará el vigésimo quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de productos de limpieza, servicio de albañil, venta de calzados, comerciante de awayos, venta de coca.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Maria es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su cuñada que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de pan; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por recomendación de su amiga que realizaba la misma actividad, al observar el comercio del producto decide emprender su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de pan) que adquirirá de las panaderías de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene cinco hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los créditos que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Los Andes Communal bank will begin its twenty-fifth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana regional center.  It is comprised of eight members and led by a board of directors.  Maria is the president.  The businesses of the members of the communal bank are varied and include selling cleaning products, bricklaying services, selling shoes, selling traditional woven textiles, and selling coca.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small business women where Maria is a member.  She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for two years.  She joined by invitation from her sister-in-law, who is a member of the association.

She currently has a business of selling bread.  She say that she undertook this business on recommendation from a friend who conducted the same business activity.  Upon observing how the product sold, she decided to undertake her own business.

The loan she will now take out is to buy bread that she will get at the bakeries in the city of El Alto.  She will later sell it at her sales space.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family.  She is in a common-law marriage, and she has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the loans that are offered to her by the institution.

loans.use: to buy bread.

loans.name: Rosas De Coaine Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS DE COAINE” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Felipa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: selección de café, venta de ropa, venta de fruta, costura de ropa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Felipa es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de asesora de la institución que fue a visitarle. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller de costura; da a conocer que este negocio lo implemento hace varios años atrás por iniciativa de una amiga que trabajaba en el mismo rubro.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de la ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible sus estudios, ya que ella es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en el área de salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The “ROSAS DE COAINE” communal bank is starting its first cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Collpani regional office. It has 8 members and is governed by a board of directors of whom Felipa is the president. The members' businesses are varied and include: coffee, clothing sales, fruit sales, and clothes making.
This loan will benefit these small businesses. Felipe tells us that this is her first time being part of Pro Mujer. She joined at the invitation of a consultant from the institution who came to visit her. She currently has a sewing workshop. She tells us that she started her business several years ago with the initiative of a friend who worked in the same area.
This loan is for an increase in working capital (to buy fabric). She will buy fabric from the markets in El Alto city, and then make and sell garments in her sales space. This work allows her to generate an income to maintain her studies where possible; she is single.
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the health training and the loans.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Pinos Y Trebol Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PINOS Y TREBOL” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Martina es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de zapatillas, venta de lana, elaboración de salteñas, venta de llauchas, venta de azúcar y arroz, venta de verduras, venta de productos Herbalife.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Martina es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de llauchas y salteñas (ambas meriendas bolivianas); da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace veinte años, cuando trabajaba de como vendedora, cuando formo un pequeño ahorro decide emprender un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de horno) que adquirirá de las fábricas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo implementará en su espacio de trabajo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene seis hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los créditos, los ahorros, y el área de salud que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Pinos and Trebol” (Pines and Clover) will start its fourth funding cycle with Pro Mujer as a part of Centro Focal de Panamericana.  The communal bank is made up of eight members and is overseen by a board of directors, of which señora Martina is the treasurer.  The members' businesses are varied and include: slipper sales, wool sales, making meat pies and "llauchas" (empanadas), sugar and rice sales, vegetable sales and selling Herbalife products.

The loan that the members are taking out will benefit small, micro-entrepreneurs, of which señora Martina is one.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer one year ago when a promoter from the institution came to visit her.  Señora Martina currently has a business selling "llauchas" and meat pies, (both are Bolivian snacks).  She learned this line of work twenty years ago, when she worked selling the snacks.  When she had put together some savings, she started her own, independent business. 
 
The loan that señora Martina is requesting is to increase her capital; she will purchase an oven from a factory in El Alto and later install it in her place of work.  Her work allows her to generate income to support her family.  She lives with her partner and has six children.

When asked what she likes best about Pro Mujer, señora Martina says that she likes the loans, the savings program and the health classes offered by the institution.

loans.use: to purchase an oven.

loans.name: Luz De Mi Vida Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUZ DE MI VIDA” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Oshin es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura de chamarras, tejido de mantas, venta de fajas, tienda de barrio, servicio de peluquería, venta de lencería, venta de shampoo.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Oshin es integrante, ella indica que hace año y medio que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación su tía que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de lencería; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su hermana que tiene el mismo negocio, posteriormente decide implementar un espacio de comercialización independiente ya que es un buen producto de venta.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lencería) que adquirirá de la ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible sus estudios, ya que ella es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en el área de salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The Luz De Mi Vida communal bank will begin its seventh cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani regional center.  It is comprised of nine members and led by a board of directors.  Oshin is the president.  The businesses of the members of the communal bank are varied and include making jackets, weaving blankets, selling belts, neighborhood store, hairdressing services, selling lingerie, and selling shampoo.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small business people where Oshin is a member.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer a year and a half ago.  She joined by invitation from her aunt, a member of the institution.  Oshin currently has a business of selling lingerie.  She says that she learned this business from her sister, who has the same business.  Later, she decided to set up an independent sales space because it is a good product to sell.

The loan that she will now take out is to buy lingerie that she will get at the fairs in the city of El Alto.  Afterwards, she will sell it at her sales space.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her studies as much as possible.  She is single.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the training about health and loans.

loans.use: to buy lingerie.

loans.name: Triunfadoras De Senkata Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TRIUNFADORAS DE SENKATA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Delia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, venta de jugo de naranja, venta de chicharron (comida típica boliviana), venta de ropa interior, servicio de construcción.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Delia es integrante, ella indica que hace varios años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de verduras; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió al observar el mercado y la amplia comercialización de estos productos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras) que adquirirá de las comerciantes mayoristas y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones, área de salud y los créditos que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The community bank "Triumphant Women of Senkata" will begin its first term in Pro Mujer as part of the regional hub of Senkata. It is comprised of eight members and is run by a board of directors and the president, Delia. The members run various businesses, including vegetable sales, orange juice sales, chicharron (a typical Bolivian food) sales, undergarment sales, and construction services.

The loan the group receives will benefit all the small business owners in the group where Delia is a member. She joined the Pro Mujer several years ago at the invitation of a promotional officer who came to visit her at her home. She currently has a business selling vegetables. She told us that she learned the business by watching the markets and observing the broad sales of that product. 

She will use this loan to increase her capital through the purchase of vegetables from wholesale merchants for later resale in her market stall. This work allows her to generate enough income to support her family. She lives in a common-law marriage and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes the training, the health services, and the loans that the institution offers.

loans.use: buy vegetables

loans.name: Florida Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLORIDA” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Cecilia es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, taller de tejido, venta de comida, carnicería, venta de libros, tienda de barrio, venta de sogas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Cecilia es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una asesora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió al ver la oportunidad de que en cercanía de su domicilio no existía un centro de venta y ella decide implementarlo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de víveres) que adquirirá de la ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “Florida” (Flowery & Colorful) communal bank will begin its fourth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani regional hub. It is made up of nine members and is lead by a Board of Directors, of which Cecilia is Treasurer.  The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry out are varied; among them are: food sales, a weaving workshop, food sales, a butcher shop, book sales, a neighborhood store, and rope sales.

The loan that they are taking out will benefit small-time microentrepreneurs, one of whom is Señora Cecilia.  She says that she has been with Pro Mujer for four cycles, joining at the invitation of one of the organization’s consultants, who came to visit her in her home.  She currently runs a neighborhood shop.  She shares that she learned this business once she noticed that there wasn’t a shop in the area, and so she decided to start one.

The loan that she is taking out now is to increase her capital (to buy supplies) that she will get in the city markets of El Alto, and later will sell in her shop.  This type of work allows her to generate income to take care of her family as well as possible, because she is married and has four children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the organization’s health sphere.

loans.use: to buy supplies to sell

loans.name: Kantutas De Igachi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KANTUTITAS DE IGACHI” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Jovita es la Presidenta. El negocios que tienen las integrantes de la asociación comunal es la venta de leche, misma que entregan a las empresas distribuidoras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Jovita es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de leche; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia al observar la oportunidad de negocio compro una vaca, con la cual empezó su negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de vacas) que adquirirá de las comunidades del departamento de La Paz y posteriormente a la crianza lo comercializará. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen no esta presente una socia, ya que tuvo que ir a patorear su ganado.
texts.en:
The community bank "Kantutas de Igachi" is starting its first term with Pro Mujer and is part of the regional hub of Copacabana. It is comprised of nine members, and is run by a board of directors and a president, Mrs. Jovita. The members' business is the sale of milk to distribution companies.

The loan that they will receive will benefit all of the small business owners in the group, including Jovita. She joined Pro Mujer a year ago at the invitation of a friend, who was also a member of the institution. Her current business is selling milk. She told us that she started this business on her own initiative; noticing the business opportunity, she bought a cow and started her business that way.

Jovita will use this loan to increase her capital through the purchase of cows, which she will acquire from the communities around the department of La Paz, and after raising them, she will use sell their milk. This work allows her to generate enough income to support her family. She is single and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes the savings that the institution offers.  

Note: One member is not present in the picture because she had to look after her animals.

loans.use: buy dairy cows

loans.name: Picaflor Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PICAFLOR II” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosmery es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: Venta de cosméticos, empresa de reciclajes, venta de verduras, venta de repuestas, tienda de artículos varios, producción de verduras, talle r de mecánica, venta de repuestos de autos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosmery es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su cuñada que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años de sus padres ya que el mismo fue un negocio familiar, posteriormente decide emprender su propio espacio de comercialización.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en crédito que le ofrece la institución.

En la imagen acompaña al grupo el hijo de una socia,él esta al lado de la ventana con una polera blanca.
texts.en:
The Picaflor 11 Community Bank is beginning its fifth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación group. There are eight members and a board of directors. Sra. Rosmery is the secretary. The members have a variety of businesses such as selling cosmetics, a recycling business, selling vegetables, selling spare parts, shop selling various merchandise, growing vegetables, mechanic shop, and selling car parts.

The loan they are seeking will benefit these small-business owners like Sra. Rosmery. She joined Pro Mujer two years ago at the invitation of her sister-in-law who is also a member. Now Rosmery has a business selling clothing, a job she learned from her parents who ran a family business. Later she decided to start her own business.

The loan she is now seeking is to buy more clothing from the wholesale dealers in the town of El Alto, and then sell it on her own stall. The money she earns will allow her to better maintain her house where she lives with her husband and three children. When Rosmery is asked what she most likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that it is the training about loans.

In addition to the group members in the photo is the son of one of the members. He is next to the window wearing a white t-shirt.

loans.use: Compra de ropa

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SAN ANTONIO” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacanaya, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Alicia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de papa y chuño (papa deshidratada), producción y venta de abarcas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Alicia es integrante, ella indica que hace dos ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción y venta de abarcas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres, ya que el mismo fue un negocio familiar, posterior a su matrimonio decide establecer un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de llantas de auto) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar, ya que ella es casada y tiene siete hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro y las capacitaciones que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “SAN ANTONIO” communal bank is starting their second cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Patacanaya regional office. It is made up of 8 members lead by a board of directors with Alicia serving as president. The businesses that the members run are selling potatoes and chuño (dried potatoes) and the production and sale of sandals.

The loan will benefit all these micro-entrepreneurs of whom Alicia is one. She says she has been a member of Pro Mujer for two loan cycles and she joined on the invitation of a friend who is also a member of the institution. Currently she has a business producing and selling sandals. She learned this business from her parents as it was the family business. After she got married she decided to open her own business. 

The loan she is requesting will be used to expand her capital, buying car tires, which she will acquire from wholesalers in the city of El Alto. She will make the sandals and sell them in her sales place. This form of work allows her to generate the resources she needs to support her household as well as she can. She is married and has 7 children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she replied that she liked the savings and training provided by the institution.

loans.use: to buy car tires.

loans.name: Flor De Puyas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE PUYAS” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Margarita es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de papas, venta de comida, venta de chuño (papa deshidratada), venta de ganado, tejido y venta de ropa de bebe, venta de queso, venta de oca, tejido de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Margarita es integrante, ella indica que es la dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de oca (tuberculo); da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años aprendiendo de su amiga que negocia el mismo producto, pasado el tiempo decide  implementar su negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de oca) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de su comunidad y posteriormente lo comercializará en comunidades aledañas. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Flor de Puyas" communal bank will begin its third cycle with Pro Mujer from the Achacachi Regional Office. The group is made up of ten members and led by a directive in which Margarita is President. The businesses that the communal bank members carry out are varied and include potato sales, food sales, chuño (dried potato) sales, livestock sales, woven goods and baby clothing sales, cheese sales, oca (Andean tuber vegetable) sales, and woven blankets. 

The loan that they are requesting will benefit the group of micro-enterpreneurs that Margarita belongs to. She says that she joined Pro Mujer two years upon upon the invitation of a representative of the institution that went to visit her home. She currently has a business selling oca. She learned how to run this type of business years ago by learning from a friend that sells the same product. As time passed, she decided to set up her own business. 

The loan that she is taking out now is to increase capital by purchasing oca from the wholesale vendors in her community. She will then sell the good in the neighboring communities. This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family. She is in a civil union and has three children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the trainings that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy oca (an Andean tuber vegetable).

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESPERANZA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Laura es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de jugos de quinua, hilado de lana de vicuña, venta de fruta, elaboración de pan, venta de pollos a la broster, servicio de transporte, costura de mochilas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Laura es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años de un trabajo anterior, posteriormente decide emprender su propio espacio de comercialización.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar, ya que ella es soltera y vive con sus padres.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la atención del personal que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “ESPERANZA” communal bank has started their second cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Exaltación branch. It is composed of 8 members who are lead by a board of directors of whom Laura is the Secretary. The businesses of the members are varied, including: the sale of quinoa juice, the sale of vicuña wool, making bread, selling roasted chicken, transportation services, and making backpacks.

The loan will benefit all these micro-entrepreneurs, of whom Laura is one. She says that she joined Pro Mujer eight months ago on the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Currently her business is selling food. She explains that she learned how to do this through the work she did before. She decided to open her own commercial space. 

The loan she is requesting is to increase her capital, buying vegetables wholesale, which she will acquire from wholesalers in the city of El Alto. She'll  later sell them in her commercial space. This way of working allows her to support her household as well as possible. She is single and lives with her parents. When asked what she likes about pro Mujer, she stated that she liked the attention she receives from the staff of the institution.

loans.use: to buy vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Maranatha Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MARANATHA” iniciará el décimo cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Miriam es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, tienda de lubricantes, servicio de trámites, venta de comida, venta de zapatos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Miriam es integrante, ella indica que hace siete años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su hermana que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años de sus amigos, ya que ayudaba en sus negocio, con el pasar del tiempo decide implementar un espacio propio de venta.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en crédito que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Marantha Community Bank is beginning its fourteenth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación group. There are eight members and a board of directors; Sra. Mirian is the treasurer. The members run the following businesses: selling clothing, store selling lubricants, document processing assistance, food selling, selling footwear.

The loan the group is seeking will benefit small business owners like Miriam. She joined Pro Mujer seven years ago at the invitation of her sister who is also a member. Now she runs a business selling clothing, a job she learned from her friends as she used to help with their businesses. As time passed she decided to start a business of her own.

The loan she is now seeking is to buy more clothing from the wholesale dealers in the town of El Alto, and then sell it on her own stall. The money she earns will allow her to better maintain her house where she lives with her husband and two children. When Miriam is asked what she most likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that it is the training about loans.

loans.use: buy clothing

loans.name: Caramelo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CARAMELO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Julia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas, servicio de transporte, servicio de seguridad, venta de ropa, tienda de barrio, venta de comida, venta de papa, venta de  fruta.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Julia es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido y venta de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años de su tía, ya que ayudaba en su negocio, con el pasar del tiempo decide implementar un espacio de trabajo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar, ya que ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en crédito que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Caramelo Community Bank is beginning its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación group. There are nine members and a board of directors; Sra. Julia is the president. The members run the following businesses: weaving blankets, transportation, security, selling clothing, neighbourhood store, food selling, selling potatoes, selling fruit.

The loan the group is seeking will benefit small business owners like Julia. She joined Pro Mujer four loan cycles ago at the invitation of a representative of the institution who came to her house. Now she has a weaving business and sells blankets. She learned the work from her aunt as she helped her with her business. As time passed she decided to start a business of her own.

The loan she is now seeking is to buy wool from the wholesale dealers in the town of El Alto, and then after making the blankets she will sell them on her own stall. The money she earns will allow her to better maintain her house. She is single and has three children. When Julia is asked what she most likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that it is the training about loans.

loans.use: buy wool

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “RENACER” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sonia es la Presidenta. El negocio que tienen las integrantes de la asociación comunal es la venta de leche, misma que entregan a las empresas distribuidoras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sonia es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de leche; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia al observar la oportunidad de negocio compro una vaca, con la cual empezó su negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de forraje) que adquirirá de las comunidades del departamento de La Paz y posteriormente a la crianza de sus animales lo comercializará. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Renacer" [Rebirth] Village Bank will start its second cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Focal Center of Copacabana. It is made of up eight members and is directed by a board where Sonia is the president. The business that the members of the communal bank have is the sale of milk, which they sell to distribution businesses.

The loan that they will take out will benefit the small microenterprise owners where Sonia is a member. She says that one year ago Pro Mujer became involved, beginning by invitation of a promoter of the institution that went to visit her in her house. Currently, she has a business selling milk; she notes that she started this business by her own initiative upon observing the business opportunity of purchasing a cow, with which she started her business.

The loan that she will now take out is for the increase of capital (purchase of fodder) that she will acquire from the communities of the department of La Paz. After the raising of her animals, she will sell. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, since she lives in a free union and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the savings that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy fodder.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: Don Jorge es originario de la ciudad de Estelí. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de discos CD, el cual le ha permitido salir adelante y prosperar en su negocio. Se siente agradecido con Kiva y MiCredito ya que logro aumentar sus ventas y ha obtenido mejores ganancias. Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar: CDs y DVDs. Con el fin de ofrecer más productos y lograr posicionarse en el mercado. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá aumentar las ventas e introducir nuevos productos en su negocio.
texts.en: Jorge is originally from the city of Estelí. He is a businessman, making a living selling CDs. This work has allowed him to get ahead and prosper in his business. Jorge is grateful to Kiva and MiCredito as he was able to increase his sales and profits with his previous loan. He is applying for a new loan in order to buy CDs and DVDs in order to offer more products and to be well-established on the market. Jorge thinks that this loan will be of great help to him as he will be able to increase sales and introduce new products to his business.

loans.use: to buy CDs and DVDs.

loans.name: Exa

texts.es:
Exa es una mujer de 49 años de edad, no estudio cuando era joven no tuvo la oportunidad. Actualmente, esta sola su compañero de vida viajo a Estados Unidos hace muchos años, pero no existe comunicación con él. Ella se dedica a los oficios domésticos y su hijo que tiene 21 año de edad es pastor evangélico, quien recibe otros ingresos por asesoría territorial a sus colegas pastores. 

Exa se dedica a los oficios domésticos  y a la siembra de plátano, antes de sembrar plátano sembraba maíz hoy tiene cuatro años de sembrar este producto, le dedica tres horas diarias en limpieza y fertilización así como sacando producto para la venta , el único hijo que tiene se dedica a pastorea  una iglesia  en el caserío vecino.  

El préstamo que esta solicitado a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar una motocicleta,  para que su hijo pueda trasladarse a las iglesias que tiene como compromiso estar con un calendario bien diseñado, por lo que es necesario la motocicleta , con esto estará satisfaciendo la necesidad de poder tener una opción de poder trasladar se de una manera más rápida.

Exa en el futuro planea que su hijo se prepare en el rubro de la lectura de la biblia, ya que tiene el apoyo de los pastores de la zona y de muchas iglesias,  por lo que quiere ver a su hijo una gran persona.
texts.en:
Exa is 49 years old and did not have the opportunity to go to school. She is currently alone as her life partner travelled to the US many years ago and they do not communicate. Exa does the household chores while her 21-year-old son is an evangelical pastor. He receives an income for his pastoral work.

Exa does the household chores and also grows plantains. Before growing bananas, Exa used to sow corn. She has now been growing bananas for four years, spending three hours every day cleaning and putting down fertiliser, and harvesting her products to sell them. Exa's only son is a pastor at a church in the neighbouring village.

Exa is applying for this loan from CrediCampo in order to buy a motorcycle, so that her son can travel to the churches where he works. He has a strict timetable and so needs a motorcycle. This will allow him to travel around more quickly.

In the future, Exa wants her son to train to be a Bible reader as he has the support of local pastors and churches. Exa wants to see her son became a great person.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Simorn

texts.en:
Simorn is 34 yars old and a resident from Ruessei Kaev district, Phnom Penh. She is married with six children, two of whom have been settled for marriage. Simorn finished her education at a primary level due to her family’s economic constraints; this has resulted in her present career as a cleaner. To add to her income, Simorn's husband and son are involved in selling fermented fish and providing motor-taxi services respectively.

As of now, Simorn would like to borrow a loan to renovate her house as it’s not comfortable for the family. The loan will be used to cover the floor with ceramic tiles and replace decayed wallboard. In the future, Simorn hopes to save enough money to invest in other business activities, so she can improve income for her family.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom is originally from Phnom Penh. She is married and the mother of three children who are working in various positions. Mom is 47 years old. Mom makes and sells Khmer cakes around her community to make a livelihood. Mom started in the business for the past two years ago and this is a good financial support for her family. 

Mom would like to make some home renovations, but she has inadequate capital. That’s why she is asking for a loan in order to buy wood and pay for labor costs incurred in performing the construction. She believes this loan will be a great help because she can provide her children with a comfortable shelter. Her plan for the future is to maintain her business.

loans.use: to buy wood and pay for labor costs incurred in performing the construction of home renovation.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Pov is 50 years old and married with seven children, four of whom are employed in various positions and two are going to school. Pov earns a living by farming in Kandal province. With the support of her husband, she owns and manages a two-hectare farm for growing Khmer longans and mung beans, which she sells in the local markets. Pov is borrowing USD 800 loan to hire laborers to work on her plantation. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to hire laborers to work on her plantation.

loans.name: Ror

texts.en:
Ror, aged 65, is the widowed mother of three children, two of whom are employed as a garment worker and a retailer. Ror earns a living by running a store out of her home where she sells different kinds of household products and, in the evening, beef soup with noodles as a way to earn more income.  She does well with this business and is able to provide for her family. 

Ror is requesting a loan from HKL to buy kitchen materials such as bowls, plastic baskets, cutting boards and other items that her daughter can sell in her store. This will allow her daughter to continue working with her current business and earn a stable income. Ror's goal for the future is to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy kitchen supplies for her daughter’s store.

loans.name: Nen

texts.en:
Nen, aged 57, is widowed woman who operates a business venture in the agricultural sector growing rice crops in Kampong Cham province. She has some children who help with her every-day farming chores. She has been involved in this for more than 15 years, earning a decent income for the family.

Nen has successfully repaid her previous loans from HKL, which she used in developing her farm and family. Now, Nen has requested a new loan to invest in the purchase of banana fruits from local growers which she plans to resell in the markets at a reasonable price. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve their living conditions and save for the future expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase banana fruits from local growers to sell in the markets at a reasonable price.

loans.name: Kear

texts.en:
From a peaceful village, Kampong Cham, Kear is a 41 years old and a loving father of five children who are in various ages. Kear cultivates the land and grows rice on his own farm with the support from his wife and some children. Having been in this business for more than 15 years, he is able to generate approximately USD 5.00 per day. 

In order to help him further develop his farming business, he is asking for a loan to buy a piece of land to enlarge his area for farming rice. This will help Kear improve his farming and have a bountiful harvest in years to come. In the future, Kear will continue developing his farm and make a consistent income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land to enlarge his area for farming rice

loans.name: Toulas

texts.en:
Toulas is 32 years old, and married with two little children. He runs a transportation business providing a service to passengers around the city of Phnom Penh. He owns a Tuk Tuk motorcycle, and gets up very early to and go out on the streets of the city looking for casual passengers who need transport from one place to another. He has been doing this work for more than two years, and he has been able to gain more trust from his customers. He is able to earn approximately USD 6 per day.

Toulas is now asking for a USD 200 loan, so he will be able to buy some spare parts for his motorcycle and make some repairs. He is very grateful for the support that Kiva lenders are offering him, since, thanks to their help he will be able to make a sustainable business and continue supporting his family with the income he earns.

loans.use: to buy some spare parts of his motorcycle and make some repairs.

loans.name: Nhar

texts.en:
Nhar is 54 of ages, married and has four grown-up children. She is a widow and lives with her children in a remote area of Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising seasonal crops such as rice and vegetables. Having been in this business for over 30 years, she is able to earn approximately USD 6.00 per day. 

Nhar is taking out this loan to add to her existing capital in order to build a new home for her oldest child, who has been married already and needs to have his own home. She will continue working with her farming project and generate income to repay the loan back. Thanks to this loan, she will improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to build a new home for her oldest child

loans.name: Lolo Group

texts.fr:
LOLO est un groupe de l’association SIGUIDIA de N’TENTOU. Il regroupe 4 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne cinq enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de d’habillements, des cosmétiques et de la friperie à l’image de SALIMATA  qui est la seule personne assise de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à N’TENTOU dans la  préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe décident d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. 
SALIMATA, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, deux balles de friperies.  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses produits à  OUELESSEBOUGOU en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Lolo is a group that is part of the Siguidia association in N’Tentou. The group is made up of four married women who know each other through being relations and neighbours. 

The women in the group have an average age of 30, and are all married with have five children on average. They are involved in various business activities, such as selling clothing, cosmetics and second-hand clothing, like Salimata, who is pictured sitting down. They live in large traditional families in N’Tentou in the Kati prefecture (in the Koulikoro region in the Republic of Mali).

The women have been involved in small-scale business for several years, and are very much in demand. 

In order to satisfy growing customer demand, the members of the group have decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance programme. This is their first solidarity loan. 

Salimata intends to use her loan to buy two bales of second-hand clothing. She buys her supplies from wholesalers in Bamako and locally, and sells her products to individuals in Ouelessebougou, both for cash and on credit, to a customer base that includes both men and women.   

Salimata hopes to make 20 000 CFA francs per month, which will allow her to repay the loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing

loans.name: Lesilaina

texts.en:
Lesilaina is 49 years old and married with 4 children. She runs a small business selling fish in her community and has been doing this for many years. 

Lesilaina has requested a loan to buy fishing nets, torch (flashlight), hooks, goggles, knife and a spear. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Lesilaina will improve her house and save more for her children's educations.

loans.use: to buy goggles, fishing net, torch, spear, knife, hooks, etc.

loans.name: Pamata

texts.en:
Pamata is an 18-year-old single lady with no children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu (giant taro), bananas and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years.

Pamata has requested a loan to buy chemicals, weed sprayer, timber, nails, bush knives and an axe. She has been a member of SBPD since 2013. With her profits, Pamata hopes to improve her business and support her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, weed sprayer, timber, nails, bush knives, and an axe

loans.name: Leafa

texts.en:
Leafa is a 19-year-old single lady with no children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu (giant taro), bananas and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years.

Leafa has requested a loan to buy chemicals, weed sprayer, bush knives, wheelbarrow, chainsaw and an axe. She has been a member of SBPD since 2013. With her profits, Leafa hopes to improve her business and support her family.

loans.use: to buy a weed sprayer, wheelbarrow, bush knives, an axe, and a chainsaw

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DANAYA ont en moyenne  40 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à   LAFIABOUGOU l’un des quartiers de la ville de SAN  dans la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers, condiments etc.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leur  6 eme   prêt solidaire. SALI 1ere femme assise à  la gauche sur la photo  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter quelques paires de boucle d’oreilles, de chaines pour le cou et des bracelets en caoutchouc. Elle s’approvisionne à SAN. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women in the Danaya group are 40 years old on average, and have an average of five children. They all live in traditional extended families in Lafiabougou, one of the neighbourhoods in the town of San (in the 4th administrative region of Mali).

The women are all related and their business activities include buying and selling various products, such as condiments, for example.

Having successfully repaid all their previous loans, the women in the Danaya group are requesting their 6th solidarity loan. 

Sali, pictured sitting on the left, intends to use her loan to buy a few pairs of earrings, some necklaces and some rubber bracelets. Sali buys her supplies in San. She sells her goods to both men and women customers, who buy with cash or on credit.

Sali is hoping to make a monthly average of 40 000 CFA francs, which will be spent on healthcare, food, clothing and school fees. The remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy jewellery

loans.name: Teriya Group

texts.fr:
Teriya est un groupe de l’association BALIMAYA du quartier MISSION CATHOLIQUE. Il regroupe 4 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans. Mariées avec au moins cinq enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments et de légumes à l’image de AMI qui est assise de la gauche vers la droite  de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à OUELESSEBOUGOU dans la  préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a trois ans. Elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt solidaire. 
AMI, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des condiments alimentaires de différentes sortes (poivre, tomate, oignon, choux, aubergine et gombo séché).  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses articles à OUELESSEBOUGOU, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Teriya is a group that is part of the Balimaya association, located in the Catholic Mission district. The group is made up of four married women who know each other through being relations and neighbours. They have an average age of 40 and are all married with at least five children. 

The women in the group are involved in various business activities such as selling condiments and vegetables, like Ami, who is pictured sitting on the left. They all live in large traditional families in Ouelessebougou in the Kati prefecture (in the Koulikoro region in the Republic of Mali). 

The women have been involved in small-scale business for several years, and are very much in demand. 

In order to satisfy growing customer demand, the members of the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance programme three years ago. This is their fifth solidarity loan. 

Ami is planning to use her loan to buy various items of condiments and produce (pepper, tomatoes, onions, aubergines and dried okra). She buys her supplies from wholesalers in Bamako and locally, and sells her produce to individuals in Ouelessebougou, both for cash and on credit, to a customer base that includes both men and women.   

Ami hopes to make 30 000 CFA francs per month, which will allow her to repay the loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BADEGNA ont en moyenne  45 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à   MEDINE l’un des quartiers de la ville de SAN  dans la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente d’articles divers.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe BADEGNA sont à leur 5 eme   prêt solidaire. AWA 1 ère femme de la droite  sur la photo  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des parures pour les femmes, dix poupées, dix paires chaussures et dix chapeaux. Elle s’approvisionne à SAN et dans les villages environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women in the Badegna group are 45 years old on average, and have an average of five children. They all live in traditional extended families in Medine, one of the neighbourhoods in the town of San (in the 4th administrative region of Mali).

The women are all related and their business activities include trading various products.

Having successfully repaid all their previous loans, the women in the Badegna group are requesting their 5th solidarity loan. 

Awa, pictured on the far right, intends to use her loan to buy jewellery for women, ten dolls, ten pairs of shoes and ten hats. She buys her supplies in San and the surrounding villages and sells her goods to both men and women customers, who buy with cash or on credit.

Awa is hoping to make a monthly average of 25 000 CFA francs, which will be spent on healthcare, food, clothing and school fees. The remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy various items

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BENKADI ont en moyenne  35 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies     dans la ville de BLA dans la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers, poissons, grains de céréales, etc.
Les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur  1 er  prêt solidaire. AWA 2 eme  femme assise à   gauche vers la droite sur la photo  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter un sac de 50kgs de sucre, 10 paquets de bonbons et 10 paquets de biscuits. Elle s’approvisionne à BLA chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 14 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women in the Benkadi group are 35 years old on average, and have an average of three children. They all live in traditional extended families in Bla, a town in the 4th administrative region of Mali.

The women are all related and their business activities include buying and selling various produce, such as fish or cereals for example.

This is the first solidarity loan for the women in the Benkadi group. 

Awa, who is pictured second from the left, would like to use her loan to buy one 50kg-sack of sugar, ten packets of sweets and ten packets of biscuits. 

She buys her supplies from wholesalers in Bla and sells her goods to both men and women customers, who buy with cash or often on credit.

Awa is hoping to make a monthly average of 14 000 CFA francs, which will be spent on healthcare, food, clothing and school fees. The remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Dúo Salud Y Vida Group

texts.es:
Dúo Salud y Vida
Dúo conformado por Jacinto, soltero y originario del área de San Martin Jilotepeque.Jacinto es propietario de un moto taxi. Gracias al apoyo de la fundación el se siente apoyado en su negocio, por medio de su trabajo ayuda a su familia con los gastos de la casa.es una persona responsable para pagar y solicita el crédito para invertir en comprar repuestos para su mototaxi a así obtener más ingresos y ganancias.
texts.en:
The "Salud y Vida" Duo

One member of this duo of Jacinto, who is single and originally from San Martin Jilotepeque. Jacinto owns a motorbike taxi. Thanks to help from the foundation, Jacinto feels supported in his business. It is with his business that Jacinto is able to help his family with household costs. He is responsible with repayments and is applying for a loan in order to buy spare parts for his mototaxi and to increase his income and profits.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for a mototaxi

loans.name: Fualaau

texts.en:
Fualaau is a 36-year-old woman who is married with three children. She has a taxi where she can earn money for a living. She has 3 years with this business.

Fualaau needs a loan to buy tires, a tire wrench, spare tires, seat covers and door mats. She will use her profits for her children's education and to support her family. Fualaau joined SPBD in 2000 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy tyres, a tyre wrench, spare tyres, seat covers, door mats, etc.

loans.name: Tiresa

texts.en: Tiresa is a 37-year-old married woman with two children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, bananas and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Tiresa has requested a loan to buy chemicals, weed sprayer, timber, nails, bush knives and an ax.  She has been a member of SPBD since 2013.  With her profits,Tiresa hopes to improve her business and support her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, weed sprayer, timber, nails, bush knives and an ax.

loans.name: Sary

texts.en:
Sary is an experienced farmer from the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham. She grows rice on her own farm, which is 10 minute walk from her home. Sary has great support from her husband and some children, so she is able to manage around one hectare and half of farmland.  Having been in this business for almost 15 years, she earns approximately KHR 20,000 per day. 

In order to improve the income of her family, Sary has considered creating a new business of tailoring clothes because she has enough skills for this type of business. Due to inadequate capital, Sary would like to borrow a loan in the sum of KHR 3,000,000 to help her build a tailoring shop.  With this loan, she will be able to improve her income and better her living conditions. Sary is photographed with her husband in the photo.

loans.use: to build a tailoring shop.

loans.name: Exaltacion

texts.en:
Exaltacion owns and operates a retail business selling assorted kinds of groceries to earn a living. She has been in her business for more than ten years, earning well for the family. She had a previous loan that she used in addition to her inventory capital, and she has successfully repaid it.

Recently she took a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to purchase more grocery goods to sell. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Edwin José

texts.es:
Edwin de 34 años de edad, es un agricultor, estudio hasta tercer año de primaria, a pesar del grado de estudio tiene una visión de progreso, posee un pequeño foto estudio en su casa, normalmente lo maneja la esposa, hoy este año también pondrán un nuevo negocio. De los dos hijos uno comenzara a estudiar este año .


Edwin tiene el negocio de un estudio fotográfico, siembra la agricultura  y este año pondrá otro negocio en el centro escolar de la comunidad, la foto estudio lo tiene desde hace varios años, fue una iniciativa tomando en cuenta que en la comunidad no existía quien ofreciera estos servicios . Lo que el cliente hace es que no tiene horario de trabajo lo hace a cualquier hora del día y de noche.  


El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar bebida envasada, hieleras para mantener heladas las bebidas y construir un cafetin para no estar trasladando la venta. Todo esto para instalar su nuevo negocio.

En el futuro don Edwin quiere instalar una foto estudio, en una ciudad donde le permita darse a conocer y que crezca su negocio, para darle un estudio a sus hijos que en este año iniciara uno de ellos y lo mejor darle un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Edwin is 34 years old and is a farmer. He completed up to third grade of primary school but, in spite of this, he still wants to progress. Edwin has a small photography studio in his house, which his wife usually manages. This year Edwin will also start a new business. Edwin has two children, one of whom will start school this year.

Edwin has a photography studio, he sows crops, and this year he will open a new business at a local school. Edwin has had the studio for a number of years, having opened it when he noticed that there were no businesses offering such services in the community. Edwin does not have a fixed timetable for work - he works at any time of the day or night.

This loan from Credicampo will be used to buy drinks in bottles, fridges for the drinks and to build a small café so as not to have to go out to make sales - all this is to set up his new business.

In the future, Edwin would like to set up a photo studio in a city where his business can become well-known and will expand. He wants to give his children a photography studio and to offer his customers the best possible service.

loans.use: to buy drinks in bottles, fridges for the drinks and to build a small café so as not to have to go out to make sales - all this is to set up his new business.

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en: Mareta is a 54-year-old married woman with ten children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, bananas and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Mareta has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a weed-sprayer, timber, nails, bush knives and an axe. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. With her profits, Mareta hopes to improve her housing and support her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a weedsprayer, timber, nails, bush knives, and an axe.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DANAYA ont en moyenne  35 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies     dans la ville de BLA dans la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des  articles divers et des condiments.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leur  2 eme   prêt solidaire. MINATA 2 eme  femme de  la droite sur la photo  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  100kgs d’oignons séchés. Elle s’approvisionne à BLA pendant les jours des foires. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women in the Danaya group are 35 years old on average, and have an average of five children. They all live in traditional extended families in Bla, a town in the 4th administrative region of Mali.

The women are all related and their business activities include buying and selling various products, such as condiments, for example.

Having successfully repaid their previous loan, the women in the Danaya group are requesting their 2nd solidarity loan. 

Minata, pictured second from the right, intends to use her loan to buy 100 kilograms of dried onions. She buys her supplies in Bla on market days. She sells her goods to both men and women customers, who buy with cash or often on credit.

Minata is hoping to make a monthly average of 10 000 CFA francs, which will be spent on healthcare, food and school fees. The remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy dried onions

loans.name: El Prado Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “EL PRADO” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, venta de queso, venta de ropa, venta de dulces, venta de cargadores.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Maria es integrante, ella indica que hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura de chalecos; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió cuando fue a Brasil a trabajar, cuando reunió un pequeño capital decide retornar a Bolivia y emprender su propio espacio de trabajo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de las tienda mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones de su Banca Comunal.
texts.en:
The communal bank group "El Prado" will begin their second loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the regional office Centro Focal de Los Andes. The group is made up of eight members and is run by a board of directors, of which María is the president. The members of the bank group are engaged in various businesses, among them the following: selling blankets, selling cheese, selling clothing, selling sweets, and selling chargers.

The loan they will take out will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs, of which María is one. She indicates that she has been part of Pro Mujer for six months, having joined at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. She currently has a business sewing vests; she lets us know that she learned this business when she went to work in Brazil. When she gathered a small amount of capital she decided to return to Bolivia and open her own workspace. 

The loan she will now take out is for the increase of capital to buy fabric, which she will get in the wholesale stores in the city of El Alto, and later, after working with it, she will sell it in her place of sale. This work allows her to generate resources to support her family, as she is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the meetings of her communal bank.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DANAYA ont en moyenne  34 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies     dans la ville de BLA dans la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente de condiments, d’habillements et de poissons.
Les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leur  1 er   prêt solidaire. ADIARATOU 1ere femme assise à  la gauche sur la photo  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 50kg de poissons frais une partie est vendue et l’autre séchée. Elle s’approvisionne à BLA avec les pêcheurs. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 14 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women in the Danaya group are 34 years old on average, and have an average of three children. They all live in traditional extended families in Bla, a town in the 4th administrative region of Mali.

The women are all related and their business activities include buying and selling condiments, clothing and fish.

This is the first solidarity loan for the women in the Danaya group. 

Adiaratou, picture sitting on the left, intends to use her loan to buy 50kg of fresh fish. She will sell some of the fish and dry the rest. She buys her supplies from the fishermen in Bla and sells her goods to both men and women customers, who buy with cash or on credit.

Adiaratou is hoping to make a monthly average of 14 000 CFA francs, which will be spent on healthcare, food, clothing and school fees. The remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Leotele

texts.en: Leotele is 43 years old and married with 2 children. She runs a small business selling meat buns in her community. She has been doing this for 5 years. Leotele has requested a loan to buy mutton flaps, dripping oil, flour, soy sauce, plastic bags and foam plates. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Leotele will support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy mutton flaps, dripping oil, flour, soy sauce, plastic bags and foam plates.

loans.name: Malia Ioana

texts.en: Malia Ioana is a divorced, 45-year-old lady. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has 3 years of experience with this business. Malia Ioana needs a loan to buy bags of flour, cooking oil, baking powder, yeast, and tongs. She plans to use her profits to expand her business and to save for unexpected emergencies. Malia Ioana has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, cooking oil, baking powder, yeast, tongs, etc.

loans.name: Sue

texts.en: Sue is a 37-year-old married woman with 5 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, bananas and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Sue has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a weedsprayer, timber, nails, bush knives and an axe. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. With her profits, Sue hopes to improve her business and save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a weedsprayer, timber, nails, bush knives, and an axe.

loans.name: Lauiula

texts.en: Lauiula is a 52-year-old married woman with 4 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, bananas and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Lauiula has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a weedsprayer, timber, nails, bush knives and an axe. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. With her profits, Lauila hopes to improve her business and save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a weedsprayer, timber, nails, bush knives, and an axe.

loans.name: Cracekelly

texts.en: Cracekelly is a 21-year-old woman, who is single with no children. She has a small business sewing. She has 3 years with this business. Cracekelly needs a loan to buy materials, threads, needles and a sewing machine. She will use her profits to improve her business. Cracekelly joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials, threads, needles and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Neetia

texts.en: Neetia is a 20-year-old single lady with no children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, bananas and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Neetia has requested a loan to buy chemicals, weed sprayer, timber, nails, bush knives and an ax.  She has been a member of SPBD since 2013. With her profits, Neetia hopes to improve her business and to support her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, weed sprayer, timber, nails, bush knives and an ax.

loans.name: Imeleta

texts.en:
Imeleta is 40-years-old and divorced with six children. 

She has a small garden where she grows cabbages, ginger, capsicum and cucumbers that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for six years.  Imeleta needs a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, chemicals, vegetable seeds, pick, rake, shovel and a garden hose. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2010.  Imeleta will use the profits from her sales to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, chemicals, vegetable seeds, pick, rake, shovel and a garden hose

loans.name: Ula

texts.en: Ula is a 20-year-old single lady with no children. She owns and operates a small store, selling daily consumption items such as rice, flour, sugar, salt, chicken legs, mutton flaps, etc. She has been doing this for five years. Ula needs a loan to buy a bag of sugar, bag of rice, bag of flour, salt and a freezer. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business and to save for unexpected emergencies. She became a member of SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a bag of sugar, bag of rice, bag of flour, salt and a freezer

loans.name: Jeneve

texts.en:
This is Jeneve, age 38 and a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines.  Her partner is Ronnie, a fireman, and they have children. She and her partner manage their household while operating the business. She works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jeneve operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece.
