Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php10,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Jeneve hopes that her business will flourish and dreams to give her children a good life and education.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Yunguyo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “YUNGUYO” iniciará el octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Claudina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de chompas, tienda de barrio, elaboración de calzados, venta de tullmas, tejido de mantas, confección de enaguas, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Claudina es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace veinte años, al observar que estos productos son ampliamente comercializados en el mercado.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, aceite, fideo) que adquirirá de las ferias tradicionales de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es viuda y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de capacitación y los ahorros que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “YUNGUYO” communal bank is in its eighth cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes center.  It’s made up of nine members and directed by a board of directors where Claudia serves as the president.  The members’ businesses include knitting sweaters, a neighborhood store, shoe making, selling hairclips, blanket knitting, petticoat making, and selling food.

This loan will benefit their small businesses, including Claudia’s.  She has been with Pro Mujer for two years and joined on the invitation of a promoter who visited her in her home.  She has a food business and says that she learned this business 20 years ago by watching these items being widely sold in the market.

This loan will allow her to increase her working capital and buy rice, cooking oil, noodles at the traditional fairs in the city of El Alto, and sell the merchandise in her stall.  This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family, since she is a widow and has six children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training on savings.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Deme Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DEME ont en moyenne  40 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies     dans la ville de BLA dans la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente de condiments etc.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DEME sont à leur  2 eme   prêt solidaire. NENE 2 eme femme  à partir de  la gauche sur la photo  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 paquets de cube Maggi, 10kg de sucre,10 paquets    de cigarettes et des sachets de lait en poudre. Elle s’approvisionne à BLA chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 12 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la nourriture, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women in the Deme group are 40 years old on average, and have an average of four children. They all live in traditional extended families in Bla, a town in the 4th administrative region of Mali.

The women are all related and their business activities include buying and selling various products, such as condiments, for example.

Having successfully repaid their previous loan, the women in the Deme group are requesting their 2nd solidarity loan. 

Nene, picture second from the left, intends to use her loan to buy 20 packets of Maggi stock cubes, 10 kilograms of sugar, 10 packets of cigarettes and some sachets of powdered milk. She buys her supplies from wholesalers in Bla and sells her goods to both men and women customers, who buy with cash or on credit.

Nene is hoping to make a monthly average of 12 000 CFA francs, which will be spent on food and school fees. The remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Lauesi

texts.en:
Lauesi, 45, is a married lady. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business.

Lauesi needs a loan to buy a bag of flour, cooking oil, baking powder, yeast, and tongs. 

She plans to use her profits to expand her business and to save for unexpected emergencies.

Lauesi has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy a bag of flour, cooking oil, baking powder, yeast, tongs, etc...

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DJEKAFO ont en moyenne  37 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies     dans la ville de BLA dans la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des articles divers, des condiments, des grains de céréales et des parures.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DJEKAFO sont à leur  2 eme   prêt solidaire. SAFOURA    la femme au milieu sur la photo  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  20 complets d’habits pour enfants, des bracelets et des colliers. Elle s’approvisionne à BLA pendant les jours des foires chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 9 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women in the Djekafo group are 37 years old on average, and have an average of four children. They all live in traditional extended families in Bla, a town in the 4th administrative region of Mali.

The women are all related and their business activities include buying and selling various products, such as condiments, cereals or jewellery.

Having successfully repaid their previous loan, the women in the Djekafo group are requesting their 2nd solidarity loan. 

Safoura, pictured in the middle of the photo, intends to use her loan to buy 20 outfits for children, as well as some bracelets and necklaces. She buys her supplies in Bla from wholesalers on market days and sells her goods to both men and women customers, who buy with cash or on credit.

Safoura is hoping to make a monthly average of 9 000 CFA francs, which will be spent on school fees. The remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy various items

loans.name: General Pando Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “GENERAL PANDO” iniciará el décimo sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Caren es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura de faldas, venta de refrescos, venta de artefactos electrónicos, venta de frutas, costura de chalecos, costura de mochilas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Caren es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su madre que es socia en la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura de chamarras; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años atrás, ya que el mismo es un negocio familiar, el crédito que ahora sacará es para emprender un negocio independiente a su familia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de las tiendas de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantenerse independientemente, ya que ella está cursando estudios superiores.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro y crédito que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank  "General Pando" will begin their sixteenth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the regional office Centro Focal de Senkata. The group is made up of eight members and is run by a board of directors, of which Caren is the Treasurer. The members of the communal bank are engaged in various businesses, including sewing skirts, selling soft drinks, selling electronic devices, selling fruit, sewing vests and sewing backpacks.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs, including Caren. She indicates that this is the first time she has been part of Pro Mujer, having joined at the invitation of her mother, who is a member of the institution. Caren currently has a business sewing jackets; she says that she learned this business several years ago, as it is a family business. The loan she will take out now is to begin a business independent of her family.

The loan she will take out nos is to increase capital to buy fabric, which she will get at stores in La Paz and later, after sewing with it, she will sell it at her place of sale. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support herself independently, as she is in higher education.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the savings and loans that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Djiguiseme Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DJIGUISEME ont en moyenne 38 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies     dans la ville de BLA dans la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers, condiments, légumes etc.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DJIGUISEME sont à leur  2ème prêt solidaire. KIYA 1 ère  femme assise à  la gauche sur la photo  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 50 paires de boucle d’oreilles et 200 bracelets en caoutchouc. Elle s’approvisionne à SAN. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women in the Djiguiseme group are 38 years old on average, and have an average of two children. They all live in traditional extended families in Bla, a town in the 4th administrative region of Mali.

The women are all related and their business activities include buying and selling various products, such as condiments or vegetables for example.

Having successfully repaid their previous loan, the women in the Djiguiseme group are requesting their 2nd solidarity loan. 

Kiya, pictured sitting on the left, intends to use her loan to buy 50 pairs of earrings and 200 rubber bracelets. She buys her supplies in San and sells her goods to both men and women customers, who buy with cash or on credit.

Kiya is hoping to make a monthly average of 40 000 CFA francs, which will be spent on healthcare, food, clothing and school fees. The remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy jewellery

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en:
Arnold is 25 years old; he operates a farming business. He would like to develop his farming business to gain a higher income. 

To make that possible, he is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase farm supplies such as fertilizer and pesticides.

He hopes that through these farm inputs that he will apply to his crops, his yield will be higher.  The income from this business will serve as savings to secure his family's future, especially for the education of his child.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as as fertilizer and pesticides to use for farming

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia helps her husband operating their own business in retailing crabs and prawn. They earn a good living. She has been in this business for many years. She took a new loan from GDMPC to buy additional crabs and prawn to sell. She plans to own a retailing stall in the market where she can sell her products. In the future, she wants to improve the general living of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy additional crabs and prawn to sell.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
This is Olivia, 38, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. Her partner is Gary, a businessman, and they have children. She and her partner manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Olivia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php 30,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Olivia dreams of expanding her business, and hopes to give her children a good life and education.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draws strength from studying the Word of God.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is married with three children. She managed a store and sells a variety of products such as rice, canned goods, and spices. 

Lucila aspires to have a continuous smooth flow of her retail business. That's the reason why she is borrowing a loan of PHP 20,000, which will be used to buy additional products to display such as rice, canned goods, and other spices needed within her community. 

She's hoping for continuous access to financial services from lenders so she can meet the needs of her family and expand her retail store someday.

loans.use: to purchased rice, canned goods, and spices for her retail store

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 45 years old, married and has two children who are still attending school. She has a general store. She started this kind of business when she pawned her jewelry to a pawnshop. The money she got from her pawned jewelry served as her starting capital to operate her business.

Evelyn sells grocery items in their village. While running the business, she realizes that her gained profit is not enough to cover their daily needs and the education of her children. With her situation she decided to add a little meat of chicken, pork, fish and vegetables to sell. Evelyn's dream is to make her small store into a bigger grocery store and to own some farmland. 

To make all her dreams come true, Evelyn is now requesting a loan of 35,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy grocery items, meat, fish and vegetables to sell. She hopes to grow the business and earn a higher income that will enable her to invest in farmland.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, meat, fish and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en: Mylene's priority in life is her child's education. Through her business buying and selling of scrap materials, she is able to buy their daily basic foods. Her goal is to save some of her earnings for the education of her child soon. Mylene is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy scraps of metal, plastic and used bottles. She hopes to continue growing the business while managing it. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy scraps of metal, plastic and used bottles.

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima is a 34-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and only child attending school. In 2008, she started running her tailoring business at her home. Her income is important to help with her household expenses and pay her child’s school fees. 

Her story exemplifies the day-to-day challenges Lebanese women are facing in running a business and at the same time raising children and taking care of their houses. Her husband works at a local company, and they cooperate together to meet the needs of life. 

Today, she is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase new tailoring machinery. She states that the loan will certainly help her extend her trade and increase her income by a large percentage. In the future, she plans to borrow more Kiva loans to develop her work further.

loans.use: to purchase new tailoring machinery

loans.name: Mahina

texts.ru:
Эту юную предпринимательницу зовут Махина. Ей 27 лет. Она разведена. У нее есть один ребенок. Его зовут Бобочон. Ему 4 года.
Махина недавно начала свой бизнес, чтобы покрыть семейные расходы, быть самостоятельной и вырастить своего сына достойным мужчиной. Она берет кредит, чтобы привезти товар (мужскую одежду) из Китая и перепродать оптовым продавцам. Она такой работой начала заниматься недавно. Ее брат имеет большой стаж в этой сфере деятельности. Брат поможет Махине в ее бизнесе. Махина сможет почувствовать себя самостоятельной и обеспечить своего ребенка.
texts.en:
This young entrepreneur is called Mahina. She is 27 years old. She is divorced. She has one small child. His name is Bobojon. He is four years old.

Mahina recently started her own business, in order to cover the family expenses, to be self-sufficient and to grow her son into a decent man. She is taking a loan to transport goods (men's clothing) from China and to resell to wholesalers. She started to engage in this work recently. Her brother has a lot of experience in this sphere of activities. Mahina's brother helps her in her business.

Mahina will be able to feel independent and to support her child.

loans.use: to buy men's clothing

loans.name: Lui

texts.en:
Lui is a single 37-year-old male. He paints clothes and sells them in his community to earn a living; he has been doing this for three years. 

Lui has requested a loan to buy paints, fabrics, elei board, pencils, and glitter. 

He plans to use his profits to extend his business and support his family. He joined SPBD in November, 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy paints, fabrics, elei board, pencils, and glitter

loans.name: Naziramo

texts.ru:
Назирамо живет в городе Душанбе. Ей 35 лет. Назирамо развелась с мужем и сейчас растет детей одна. Она мама троих детей. У нее сын и две дочки. Развод не сломал Назиру и она нашла в себе силы продвигаться вперед ради своих детей. 
  Назирамо хочет работать и ей нужно обеспечивать детей. Она умеет шить и шьет очень хорошо. Для Назирамо время проведенное за швейной машинкой одно удовольствие и она решила совместить приятное с полезным. Назирамо планирует брать заказы для шитья на дому. Но ее швейная машинка очень старая и ее срочно необходимо приобрести новую, так как она уже нашла клиентов. Чтобы купить необходимую швейную машинку у Назирамо не хватает средств, и она просит ей помочь собрать недостающую сумму, купить швейную машинку и начать деятельность.
texts.en:
Naziramo lives in the city of Dushanbe. She is 35 years old. Naziramo is divorced from her husband and is now raising the children alone. She is the mother of three children. She has a son and two daughters. The divorce did not break Naziramo and she found strength in herself to move forward for the sake of the children.

Naziramo wants to work and she needs to support the children. She knows how to sew and sews very well. For Naziramo, spending time at the sewing machine is a pleasure and she decided to combine pleasure with utility. Naziramo plans to take orders for sewing at her home. But her sewing machine is very old and it is urgent for her to acquire a new one, since she has already found customers. Naziramo lacks resources to buy the needed sewing machine, and she is requesting help to collect the missing sum, to buy a sewing machine and to being activities.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine in order to offer services as a dressmaker

loans.name: Navy

texts.en: Navy is a 51-year-old woman who is married with five children. She has a small business, a flea market. She has many years with this business.  Navy needs a loan to buy color paints, material rolls, threads, zippers, paint rollers, brushes, earrings, kava bowls, traditional tapa cloth and bangles. She will use her profits to improve her business. Navy joined SPBD in 2008 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy color paints, material rolls, threads, zippers, paint rollers, brushes, earrings, kava bowls, traditional tapa cloth and bangles

loans.name: Sau's Group

texts.en:
Sau is a 52-year-old farmer in Dong Anh, Ha Noi. Her husband is gone. She has only one son who is a worker. Her monthly income is around 2,000,000 VND. She is also a babysitter for her neighborhood. As a very hardworking woman, she wants to take up poultry farming to raise more income. Thus, she would like to borrow 6,322,000 VND to buy chickens and build a new coop. The other members that are part of Sau’s group are included in the following list:
•	Tham is 42 years old. She has two children. She would like to borrow 6,322,000 VND to invest in her store
•	Thoa is 45 years old. She has two children. She would like to borrow 6,322,000 VND to breed chickens, gooses.
•	Hien is 61 years old. Similar to Thoa, she would like to borrow 6,322,000 VND to raise chickens.
•	Hang is 33 years old. She is a tailor. She would love to borrow 5,014,000 VND to spend on her tailor shop.
•	Anh is 30 years old. As a farmer, she would love to borrow 5,014,000 VND to feed chickens.
•	Hoa is 30 years old. She has two children. Hoa wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to invest in her grocery.

loans.use: to buy chickens and build a new coop.

loans.name: Hai's Group

texts.en:
Hai was born in 1983. She has two daughters who are learning at primary school and kindergarten. Her husband is a carpenter. Hai is a pharmacist to earn a living. Besides, she grows crop and feeds poultry to raise more income. Her family’s total earnings are about VND 12,000,000 per month. Her challenge in life and work is capital shortage to buy wood. Her pharmacy is not located in busy area. Furthermore, she wants to continue to study to widen her knowledge. Her dream is having the ability to enlarge her pharmacy, expand her husband carpentry workshop and build a new house. She wants to provide the best condition for her children to study and develop. This loan is one of steps helps her reaching to this dream. 
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In this new loan cycle, she would like to borrow VND 6,048,000 to buy medicine for her pharmacy. 
Other members who are part of Hai's group include the following:
•	Them was born in 1973. She has 3 children. She would love to borrow VND 10,976,000 to invest in her grocery shop.
•	Hoa was born in 1976. She has 2 children. She wants to borrow VND 8,736,000 to buy rice for the purpose of making rice paper.
•	Ty was born in 1955. As Ty is a weaver, Ty would love to borrow VND 6,496,000 to buy bamboo.
•	Dao was born in 1963.  Dao would like to borrow VND 8,736,000 to buy soya beans to invest in her family business which is producing soy sauce. 
•	Tuoi was born in 1985. She is a carpenter. Tuoi would like to borrow VND 5,152,000 to buy wood.

loans.use: to buy medicine for her pharmacy

loans.name: Ai's Group

texts.en:
Ai was born in 1979. She is a single mother of three little children. She is a farmer. In addition, she raises pigs and purchases scrap metal to resell with the purpose of earning more income. 

Her monthly income is only 4,000,000 VND. Her challenge is a shortage of capital to buy scrap metal. She would like to borrow 6,048,000 VND. With the borrowed money, Ai will have the capability to buy one ton of scrap metal from the Sam Sung factory. The profits earned from this business would help her improve the living condition of her family, send her children to school, and buy more pigs to raise.
 
Ai has successfully repaid her loans two times. This is the third time she has participated in SEDA’s credit program. 

Other members who are part of Ai’s group are included in the following list:

Xuan, a mother of three children, is a builder. She would like to borrow 7,392,000 VND to buy more pigs.

Lan was born in 1959 and has three children. She sells vegetables in a local market. She wants to borrow 6,944,000 VND to raise pigs.

Nam is a farmer. She was born in 1953 and has two children. She would love to borrow 7,392,000 VND to invest in her tailor shop.

Bao was born in 1962 and has three children. She raises chickens to earn a living. She wants to borrow 6,944,000 VND to buy more chickens.

loans.use: to buy one ton of scrap metal for resale

loans.name: Anh's Group

texts.en:
Anh was born in 1974 in a village where carpentry is a traditional job. Her husband is a carpenter and she is a farmer. With a monthly income of 12,000,000 VND for the whole family, Anh does not have enough to take good care of her children. Her oldest child is studying in the 11th grade, the youngest one is studying in the 6th grade, and another child is studying in the 9th grade.  

For the purpose of providing better living conditions and education for her children, Anh would love to expand her carpentry workshop and buy a professional woodworking machine. With a proactive, hardworking and passionate interest in business, Anh believe that she will be successful in developing her family business. Thus, she would love to borrow 10,976,000 VND to buy a carpentry machine. This is the seventh time she has applied to the credit program. 

Anh is the leader of a group which contains eight members. The other members in her group are also applying to the program to fulfill their common dreams of improving their living conditions and raising their children well. 

The name of Anh’s group members are listed as follow:

Tuong was born in 1977. She has 3 kids. Tuong would like to borrow 10,976,000 VND to invest in her family carpentry workshop. 
Similar to Tuong, Phuong, who was born in 1971 and has 2 children, wants to borrow 9,736,000 VND to spend on her carpentry workshop.
Sinh was born in 1972 and is a business woman. She would love to borrow money to finance her unique business which is trading hair to create toupees. 
Tinh was born in 1974 also wants to borrow 9,184,000 VND to do carpentry.

loans.use: to buy a carpentry machine

loans.name: Hue's Group

texts.en:
Hue was born in 1988. She has two daughters who are studying at primary school and kindergarten. Her husband is a construction worker. His income is about 5,500,000 VND. Hue is a barber to earn a living. She earns about 4,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for six years. Her family’s total earnings are about 10,500,000 VND per month. Her challenge in life and work is that her barber shop is too small and outlandish. Her dream is that her children will have good conditions to learn and that her house will be larger. This loan is one of the steps helping her to reach this dream. She can buy some more barber tools for her shop to gain earnings and save profit for her children’s education. Hue has a passion for business. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 8,736,000 VND and repaid on time. In this new loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,736,000 VND to buy barber tools, hair stylers, and shampoo for her shop. She always wants to expand her business and raise her children well.

Other members who are part of Hue's group include the following:
Mai is 38 years old. She has three children. She is a farmer. She wants to borrow 8,736,000 VND to buy food for chickens.
	
Chanh is 54 years old. She has three children. She is a farmer. She wants to borrow 8,736,000 VND to buy food for pigs.

Phuong is 30 years old. She has two children. She is a driver. She wants to borrow 6,944,000 VND to repair her car.

Dung is 37 years old. She has two children. She is a seller. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy materials to make picture frames.

Hue is 32 years old. She has two children. She is a beverage seller. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy chickens to raise.

loans.use: to buy barber tools, hair stylers, and shampoo for her shop.

loans.name: Van's Group

texts.en:
Van is 40 years old. She has two children. Her daughter is married. Her son is a carpenter.  Her husband is also a carpenter. Van produces rice paper and weaves bamboo to earn a living. Additionally, Van also grows crops to raise more money for her family. Her family’s total earnings are about 23,000,000 VND per month. Her challenges in life and work are a lack of capital to buy wood to expand her family carpentry workshop. She dreams of having a new and modern house and enlarging her carpentry workshop. This loan is one step toward helping her achieve this dream. She can buy more wood then raise more revenue from her family business. Thus, she can save her profits for her dream. 

Van has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed VND 9,632,000 and repaid on time. In this new loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,976,000 VND to buy wood.  

Other members who are part of Van's group include the following: 

Hiep was born in 1966. She has three children. She would like to borrow VND 8,736,000 to invest in her family business which is selling gas.

Thanh was born in 1947. She wants to borrow VND 6,048,000 to raise chickens.

Mai was born in 1963. She has three children. She would like to borrow VND 10,976,000 to sell eggs in a local market.

Luong was born in 1953. She would love to borrow VND 6,496,000 to invest in her carpentry workshop.

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his tuition fee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools for building like a cement mixer, jacks, and wood.

loans.name: Florida

texts.en: Florida is 43 years old, married and has three children. To help her spouse, who derives income from farming, she patiently cooks and sells fish balls, kikiam and other street foods to people within her village. She also sells vegetables and bananas as her additional source of income. Though she only gets minimal income from it, she still enjoys her small business. Florida is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more vegetables, fish balls and hotdogs to sell. She hopes to keep gaining profits in her food vending business. Her photo was taken on her way to the market to get some vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables, fish balls and hotdogs to sell.

loans.name: Ameera

texts.en:
Ameera is 35 years old, divorced, and she lives in Gaza. She has more than nine years of experience in the kindergarten field. In 2011 she decided to open her own kindergarten.  She has three teachers, and they are also have good experience in this field.

Her dream is to see her business expand; her kindergartens are really distinct from other kindergartens on the area, and she hopes to provide all the needs for the kids.

Ameera asking Ryada for this loan to buy toys for the kids and furniture.  

She is very grateful to everyone who helps her to achieve success.

loans.use: to buy toys for kids and furniture for her kindergarten.

loans.name: Mary Raquel

texts.es: Doña Mary Raquel es originaria del área de san Martin Jilotepeque y desde hace más de cinco años se ha dedicado junto a su esposo e hijos a la crianza de ganado vacuno y pollos. Estos productos tienen buena demanda en el mercado. Mary Raquel esta muy contenta porque por medio de este trabajo está ayudando a su esposo, ya que el sueño de ambos es que sus 4 hijos estudien y lleguen a tener una profesión. En sus pagos a sido puntual espera que ustedes le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en: Mary Raquel is from the area of San Martin Jilotepeque and for more than five years has been raising cattle and poultry with her husband and children. Their produce is in high demand at the market. Mary Raquel is very happy that through this work she is able to help her husband. They both dream that their four children will be able to study and have a profession. She has been punctual with her repayments and hopes that you will be able to help her with the loan she has asked for.

loans.use: to buy animals to raise.

loans.name: Lolito

texts.en:
Lolito is thankful for the financial assistance extended to him. He was able to buy more grocery items for his variety store. He also has a repacking business and his loan helped a lot too. He is being able to help his family with the income that he is getting from his business. 
 
He would like to apply for another 24,000 PHP loan. He will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to his inventory. He will also use the loan in his repacking business. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Lolito dreams of being more successful in his business and hopes to help his siblings with their studies.  He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week. This is where he finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to his inventory.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Farming has been Lolita's business involvement. According to her, it requires patience, endurance and hard work. She devotes her time to her farming business and has been able to keep it for ten years. Lolita doesn't stop believing that someday she could improve her way of living and earn greater income.

Lolita would like to request additional capital amounting to PHP 12,000. She will use this amount in buying farm inputs, such as one (1) sack of seeds, seven (7) sacks of fertilizers and one (1) liter of insecticide. She hopes that she can maintain her farming business so she can sustain her family's basic necessities and make her farming business a viable source of income.

loans.use: to purchase 1 sack of seeds, 7 sacks of fertilizers and 1 liter of insecticides to use for farming.

loans.name: Elvis

texts.en:
Elvis is 45 years old. He is a father of three children.

He would like to use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer for his corn crop production. He needs to buy fertilizer to increase production on his corn farm.

But his capital is not enough, so he is requesting a loan of PHP 18,000.

He knows that the additional capital would help him a lot, especially in improving his financial stability and in obtaining machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to increase his crop production

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina operates a junk shop which she has been selling used bottles, metal, and plastic for over three years. She is married and has three grown children. 

She uses her earned profits as revolving capital to buy more junk, but due to insufficient funds, she would like to request a loan of PHP 23,000 to buy scraps of metal, plastic, and bottles from her customers. 

Marina will continue to thrive with the business she has now.

loans.use: to buy scraps of metal, plastic, and bottles from her customers.

loans.name: Don Béni Group

texts.fr: La cliente Ngalesya est une brave commerçante, trésorière et membre d’un collectif d’affaires «Don béni »,   entrepreneur, âgée de 33 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants qui tous étudient. La cliente est une vendeuse des divers articles d’alimentation. Elle installe sa marchandise dans une maison d’alimentation sur la route principale de la ville. Il commença ses business avec le fonds reçu de son mari . Son conjoint est un fonctionnaire dans une Organisation non gouvernementale (Humanitaire). Plus tard, il bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 7 ans qu’il exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 5 cartons de jus, 50 fromages, 5 cartons des canettes sucrées, 30 pommes, 1 carton de Heineken, 5 bouteilles de vin, etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. En définitif, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des hommes  et femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout ; pendant ce moment critique, post conflit à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Ngalesya, age 33, is an entrepreneur and a brave merchant. She's a member and the treasurer of Don Béni Group. She's married and the mother of four children, who all go to school.

She sells various food products. She installs her products in a store alongside the town's main road. She started her business with funds received from her husband, a clerk in an NGO (humanitarian aid).

Later on, she obtained a loan from Kiva's partner, the MFI Hekima. She's been running this business for the past seven years. This new loan will be used to buy 5 boxes of juice, 50 cheeses, 5 boxes of can of soft drinks, 30 apples, 1 box of Heineken beer, 5 bottles of wine, etc.

She wishes to increase her working capital, build a house, feed her children and send them to school. In the end, she strongly thanks Hekima for helping to make men and women who are excluded from traditional banks self-supporting, especially during this critical post-war time in the East of the country.

loans.use: to buy juice, cheese, soft drinks, apples, beer, wine, etc

loans.name: Styopa

texts.en:
Styopa lives in the Marts village of the Lori region.  He is an agronomist with ten years of experience working in that field. Styopa keeps a livestock which includes sheep, cows, pigs, chickens and five colonies of bees. He also owns a plot of land where grass is cultivated. WIth over ten years of experience in the agricultural field, Styopa currently owns a farm which is profitable enough for covering his family's basic costs. By applying for this loan of USD 2,000, Styopa asks for financial support.  He plans to purchase forage for feeding the livestock during the winter season, as the grass that he cultivates isn't enough for that. The loan will be a big support to this hard working farmer to continue running his farm and sustaining his family's living. 
Styopa lives with his wife, mother and three children (ages 8, 5 and 2-years-old).

loans.use: to purchase forage for feeding the livestock during the winter season

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana lives in Margahovit village in the Lori region with her husband, two sons, and daughter-in-law. Svetlana and her husband have been involved in agricultural activities for 20 years. They run a farm which currently includes chickens, cows, and a pig. This hard-working couple also cultivate potatoes and other vegetables and fruits. 

Svetlana's husband owns a truck which helps him to complete orders for some agricultural work. The main income for the family is their farming business. Svetlana and her husband take the gathered harvest to the nearby open market and sell it. Svetlana has applied for this loan of USD 
$1,500 which she needs for purchasing forage for feeding the livestock. The loan will greatly assist her and her family, and she hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to buy forage for feeding the livestock in the winter season

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
This is Eufemia, 60, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She has children and grandchildren. With the help of her children, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Eufemia operates a retail stall rental business. They are rented on a monthly basis, and she has four stalls. She earns a minimum of 12,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every month.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be using the loan for the repair and maintenance of her stalls. 

Eufemia dreams that she will have more stalls and hopes to help in sending her grandchildren to school. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the repair and maintenance of her stalls.

loans.name: Lena

texts.en:
Lena is a young farmer from Gyumri city in the Shirak region. She lives with her father and brother.  Lena's father works in the government sector. His salary, unfortunately, is so low that it is impossible to meet the needs of his family based on that salary alone. To assist her father in earning a living Lena is engaged in agribusiness; she breeds cattle and livestock including sheep, pigs, piglets, and hens, and cultivates wheat and apples. Her brother helps her sell the agricultural products in the local market, which provides a very important source of the family's income. 

To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way and to be able to meet the increasing needs of her family, Lena needs a loan of 1,500 USD to purchase a pig and two cows.  She and her family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will greatly appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount of money to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase a pig and two cows

loans.name: Ramela

texts.en:
Ramela is an experienced farmer from the village of Khot in the region of Syuniq. She lives with her husband and two daughters. To take care of her family, Ramela is extensively engaged in agribusiness. With the help of her husband she is involved in breeding a herd of sheep and in the cultivation of wheat, beans, potatoes and grass. They sell the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family's income. 

As life is getting more expensive with time, Ramela wants to expand her agribusiness in order to meet the growing needs of her family more effectively. A loan of USD 1,300 will be a huge help to this hardworking woman and her family, enabling her to purchase 10 sheep. Ramela and her family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will be thankful to them for helping to collect the needed loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sheep

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is a young farmer from the village of Krasar in the region of Shirak. She lives with her husband, two sons (11 and 4 years old), her 9-year-old daughter and her elderly pensioner mother-in-law (Marine's husband and two of the children are in the photo). Marine's husband works in the police force. However, his salary alone is not enough to cover the family's needs. 

To assist her husband in earning a living, Marine is engaged in cattle breeding, pig breeding and the cultivation of wheat and grass. She realizes the sale of the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of income for the family. Her family member assist her greatly in her daily activities related to farming. 

To sustain her agribusiness, Marine currently needs a loan of USD 2,000 to purchase forage for the cattle and to buy fuel for the agricultural machinery. She and her family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan amount to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase forage for the cattle and buy fuel for the agricultural machinery

loans.name: Salvi

texts.en:
Salvi lives in Saramej village in the Lori region. She is the hardworking mother of a big family. Salvi lives with her husband, two sons, daughter-in-law and little granddaughters. She and her family have been involved in agriculture for 20 years. They keep cows, pigs and chickens and also are involved in land cultivation. Salvi cultivates different types of fruit trees and vegetables. 

Realizing the importance of agricultural income for her family, Salvi now wants to increase it. She has applied for this loan to purchase four calves and forage for feeding the livestock. She and her family will be very grateful to lenders for their trust and support.

loans.use: to buy four calves and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Arturik

texts.en: Arturik is from Lernavan village in the Lori region. He is a father of two daughters and together with his wife, has been involved in agriculture. In particular, they run a farm that includes chickens, pigs and a cow and they cultivate fruits and vegetables. The main income of the family comes from farming. As a result of Arturik's hard and tireless work, he was able to sell meat and dairy products to re-sellers and thereby provide basic living condition for his family. Now, by applying for this loan of USD 1,500 Arturik would like to enlarge his farm. He will be able to purchase a cow and forage for feeding the livestock. The loan will be a huge help for this agronomist and he will be very grateful for the lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and forage

loans.name: Suren

texts.en: Suren is an experienced farmer from Pambak village in the Lori region. He lives with his wife. For more than 20 years, Suren and his wife have been engaged in the agribusiness. They are involved in cattle breeding, in aviculture, in beekeeping, and in the cultivation of potato. Suren realizes the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family's income. His wife assists him greatly in his everyday activities related to farming. To continue running his agribusiness in a sustainable way Suren needs a loan of USD 1,500 to purchase some forage for the cattle and to buy two heifers. With the help of the loan, Suren will expand his agribusiness, which will help him to more effectively meet the increasing needs of his family. Suren and his wife rely heavily on the good will of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount of the loan to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase forage and two heifers

loans.name: Sosik

texts.en:
Sosik is an experienced farmer from the village of Tatev in the region of Syuniq. She lives with her husband. To take care of their needs, both of them are engaged in agribusiness. They are involved in cattle breeding, in aviculture, in sheep breeding and in the cultivation of potatoes and grass. Sosik's husband sells the agricultural products in the local market, and this is the main source of family's income. 

To continue running her agribusiness in a productive and sustainable way, Sosik needs to make some investments. She needs a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase a cow and some forage for the cattle. Sosik and her husband rely highly on the goodwill of the lenders and will appreciate their help in collecting the needed loan amount to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and some forage for the cattle

loans.name: Khachik

texts.en: Khachik is a farmer who is already highly skilled in animal breeding and land cultivation. He has 2 cows, 2 calves, 25 sheep and 15 chickens. He also cultivates potatoes and grains. He and his family live in Zovasar village where his wife helps him with his work. Agriculture helps the family have a stable income during the year so it is very important for Khachik to enlarge his farm. He is asking for this loan to be able to purchase two calves and forage for feeding the livestock. The loan will be a great help for him and Khachik will be very grateful for that.

loans.use: to buy calves and forage

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate the livestock barn.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is from Ani Kayaran village where she lives together with her son. Susanna has been engaged in agriculture for many years. She keeps chickens and four cows and cultivates barley. Her son helps her to sell the gathered agricultural harvest in the nearby open market and so they are able to earn their living.

Susanna currently is asking for a loan of USD 3,000 to be able to purchase 4 oxen, 10 piglets and forage for feeding the livestock. The loan will be a huge help for this hard working woman to enlarge her farm and gather more income for her son.

loans.use: to purchase oxen, piglets and forage

loans.name: Hakob

texts.en: Hakob is a hardworking father of three children (shown in the photo). He is an agronomist with many years of experience running a farm. The farm currently includes chickens, pigs, piglets, sheep and cows. Hakob's wife makes cheese and other milk products and Hakob sells it to local re-sellers. Both Hakob and his wife work really hard to be able to cover the family’s daily needs and provide a good quality life for their school age children. Now, to be able to renovate the barn and purchase forage for feeding the livestock, Hakob is asking for this loan of USD 1,500. The barn that Hakob owns is damaged and needs to be renovated. It is very important for Hakob to organize the renovation before the late winter and be prepared for cold weather conditions. He and his whole family hope for your support.

loans.use: to renovate his barn and buy forage

loans.name: Khachatur

texts.en:
Khachatur is from Lejan village of the Lori region. He lives with his wife and two school-age sons (ages 9 and 7 years old). Khachatur is a farmer with many years of experience. He currently keeps two cows and a pig and also cultivates corn, wheat and potatoes.

Khachatur is perfectly managing to earn income from his farming business and give appropriate living conditions to his family. Currently, because of many costs that need to be spent on the farm, Khachatur faces financial difficulties. He asks for this loan of USD 1,500 to be able to purchase three calves and forage for feeding the livestock during the winter season. 

The loan will greatly assist him, and Khachatur will be able to run his farming business.

loans.use: to purchase three calves and forage for feeding the livestock during the winter season.

loans.name: Tovmas

texts.en:
Tovmas lives in Talin with his big family. He lives with his wife, three little children, parents and sister. The whole family is involved in agriculture. The livestock that they currently own consists of cows, pigs, turkeys, sheep and piglets. Tovmas also owns 8 colonies of bees and together with his wife gathers high quality honey from it. Tovmas sells the gathered agricultural products to the local resellers and gets income for his family. Agriculture is the only source of family's income, so it is very important for Tovmas to enlarge it. He is currently asking for this loan of USD 3,000 to be able to purchase forage for feeding the livestock during the winter season. The loan will greatly assist Tovmas as he will be able to cover other daily costs of his family.
Tovmas is a really hard working farmer and hopes that the loan will improve his farm and will assist him to solve the financial problems that he is currently facing.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock during the winter.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is from the village of Margahovit in the region of Lori. Together with her family, Marieta has been involved in agriculture for many years. The family owns livestock, including cows, pig, chickens and turkeys. Marietta also cultivates potato and grass, which her husband sells in the nearby open market.
Marieta and her husband are already really skilled in the farming business and farming has become a part of their lives.

Now, by applying for this loan, Marieta asks for financial support from Kiva lenders. She needs this loan to be able to purchase six calves and expand her livestock. This will enlarge her income from agriculture and Marieta and her husband will be able to improve their living conditions. Marieta lives with her son and his family (her grandson is in the photo).

loans.use: to pay for six calves

loans.name: Argeshtin

texts.en:
Argeshtin is a young farmer from Ishkhanasar village in the Syuniq region. He lives with his wife and 6-year-old daughter. To take care of his family, Argeshtin is extensively engaged in agriculture; he is involved in cattle breeding, breeding piglets and hens, beekeeping, and cultivating wheat, potatoes, apples and walnuts. His wife assists him greatly in his daily activities related to farming. Argeshtin sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of his family's income. 

To be able to continue running his business in a sustainable way Argeshtin needs a loan of 3,000 USD to purchase three calves and some forage for his cattle. With the help of the loan, Argeshtin will be able to develop his business and to more effectively meet the growing needs of his family. He and his family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will be grateful to them for their help in collecting the needed amount of loan.

loans.use: to purchase three calves and forage for his cattle

loans.name: Seda

texts.en:
Seda lives in a small but very beautiful village, Ashotavan which is in the Syuniq region. She is farmer with 10 years of experience running a farm. The farm currently includes beehives, cows, chickens, and bulls. Seda also own a plot of land where she cultivates different types of fruits and vegetables. Seda has signed an agreement with local re-sellers who purchase agricultural products from her (honey, meat, milk, fruits, and vegetables). Agriculture helps Seda to earn income for her living and she is a very attentive and careful farmer.
Seda would like to ask for a loan of 3,000 USD from Kiva lenders to be able to purchase forage for her livestock and fuel for organizing cultivation processes. She will be very thankful to lenders as the loan will assist her in solving financial problems that she currently faces and will help her continue running her farming business.

loans.use: to pay for forage for her livestock and fuel for organizing cultivation processes

loans.name: Hranush

texts.en:
Hranush is involved in agriculture. She runs a farm that includes sheep, cows, chickens and pigs. Near the house Hranush also owns a plot of agricultural land where she cultivates potatoes and grass. Hranush is a very hardworking farmer and the mother of three children (her eldest child is in the photo). Hranush's husband assists his wife with farming activities. He takes the gathered harvest to the market and sells it to gather income that is vital for the family. 

Because of the family's poor conditions, Hranush has applied to local financial institutions several times. Because Hranush is very responsible and attentive, she has paid them successfully. Now she is applying for a loan of 1,500 USD from Kiva lenders. The loan will help her to purchase ten sheep and forage for feeding the livestock in the winter. The loan will greatly assist Hranush and she hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for ten sheep and feed for the livestock

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane is a farmer from Lernapat village in the Lori region. She lives with her husband, her school-age son and daughter, and her elderly pensioner parents-in-law. To take care of her family’s needs Gayane is extensively engaged in agriculture. With the help of her family members she is involved in cattle and pig breeding, aviculture, and cultivating wheat and potatoes. Gayane’s husband sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family’s income. 

As life is getting more expensive day by day, Gayane wants to expand her agricultural business a little bit to be able to more effectively meet the needs of her family. A loan of 2,500 USD will help her greatly, enabling her to purchase four calves and to buy some forage for her cattle. Gayane and her family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount to sustain her business.

loans.use: to purchase four calves and to buy forage for her cattle

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is from the village of Lernantsq in the Lori region. Together with her son (who is 30 years old), Mariam works at a local village school. Together with her work at the school, Mariam and her family have been involved in agriculture for 30 years. She has a plot of land and a small farm where she has 3 cows, 25 chickens, and 4 sheep. Mariam's husband sells all of the products (meat, milk, and eggs) at the Lori wholesale market to re-sellers.

Mariam's husband and sons help her in her farming activities very much. Currently, Mariam asks a loan of 1,500 USD to be able to purchase a cow and forage for feeding the livestock. 

The whole family will be very grateful to lenders for supporting their farming business and helping them with their current financial difficulties.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is an experienced agronomist from village of Voskehask in the region of Shirak. She lives with her son, her parents and her sister. Susanna's son is currently a migrant laborer in Russia; he works there and sends money to the family to take care of their needs. Susanna is engaged in cattle breeding, aviculture and the cultivation of wheat and alfalfa. Susanna and her sister sell the agricultural products in the local market, and this produces the main source of the family's income. 

Susanna's agribusiness currently needs some investment in order to continue functioning in a sustainable way. A loan of USD 3,000 will help this hardworking woman and her family greatly by enabling her to purchase seven calves, buy fertilizers, obtain fuel for the agricultural machinery and pay for harvesting services. Susanna and her family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan amount.

loans.use: to purchase seven calves, buy fertilizer, obtain fuel for the agricultural machinery and pay for harvesting services

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en:
Mareta is from the village of Spandaryan. She is a 41-year-old mother of two children (ages 12 and 23 years old).

Mareta and her husband have been involved in agriculture for more than 15 years. Through those years of hard and tireless work they was able to run a successful farm, which currently helps them earn their living. Mareta's husband and son sell the gathered agricultural products (meat, milk, vegetables) in the local open market. Because of the family's hard financial times, Mareta isn't currently able to invest in her farm. She asks for this loan of 3,000 USD to be able to purchase seeds for cultivation, forage for the livestock, and to pay for transportation costs. This will be a big support to the family and they will be able to continue their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for cultivation, forage for the livestock, and to pay for trasportation costs

loans.name: Smbat

texts.en: Smbat is from the village of Saramej in the Lori region. He is a hardworking farmer with many years of experience working in that field. Currently Smbat runs a farm which includes sheep, cows, piglets and chickens. Smbat lives with his wife, mother, brother, and two little children (ages 8 and 4). He also owns a plot of land where wheat is cultivated. Now Smbat wants to borrow $1,500 USD to be able to purchase seeds for cultivation as well as forage for the livestock. Smbat will be very grateful to the lenders for support. The loan is important for this hardworking man and he hopes for your goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for seeds for cultivation as well as forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Yervand

texts.en:
Yervand is a young farmer from Shenatagh village in the Syuniq region. He lives with his wife. Yervand is a contractual serviceman in the military and is the only breadwinner of the family. His salary, however, is not enough to fully meet the needs of his family. With the help of his wife Yervand is engaged in cattle breeding, breeding sheep, and cultivating wheat, potatoes, apples, pears, and walnuts. He sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of the family's income. 

To continue running his agricultural business in a sustainable way, Yervand needs to make some investments. He needs a loan of 2,600 USD to purchase two calves, forage for his cattle, fuel for his agricultural machinery, and wheat seeds. Yervand and his wife highly rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will greatly appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan to maintain and develop their business.

loans.use: to purchase two calves, forage for his cattle, fuel for his agricultural machinery, and wheat seeds

loans.name: Martik

texts.en:
Martik is an experienced farmer from Norapat village in the Armavir region. He lives with his wife and two school-aged sons. Martik repairs refrigerators and is the main breadwinner of his family. To be able to meet his family’s needs, Martik is also engaged in breeding pigs and in cultivating wheat, cucumbers, tomatoes, onions and watermelons. His wife assists him greatly in his everyday activities related to farming. Martik sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family’s income. 

To continue running his agricultural business in a sustainable way, Martik needs to make some investments. He needs a loan of 3,000 USD to purchase three pigs, feed for the livestock, and fertilizer and to pay for harvesting services. Martik and his family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount to maintain and develop their business.

loans.use: to purchase three pigs, feed for the livestock, and fertilizer and to pay for harvesting services

loans.name: Arayik

texts.en:
Arayik is a farmer with 25 years of experience. His farm includes chickens, pig, and two cows. Near the village where Arayik and his family live, he also owns a plot of agricultural land, where he cultivates different types of vegetables and fruits. Arayik sells the gathered harvest to local re-sellers and gathers income for his family. Arayik lives with his mother, wife and two children, aged 18 and 13. 

Realizing the importance of agricultural income for his family, Arayik would like to expand his farm. He requests a loan of 1,500 USD to be able to purchase three oxen. The loan will greatly help Arayik to increase his income from agriculture and ensure a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy three oxen

loans.name: Karapet

texts.en:
Karapet is an experienced agronomist from Armavir village in the Armavir region. He lives with his wife, son, daughter-in-law, and elderly pensioner mother-in-law. To take care of his family, Karapet is engaged in cattle and pig breeding, aviculture, and cultivating several fruits (peaches, apricots, cherries, and grapes). Karapet’s family members assist him greatly in his everyday activates related to farming. His son helps him sell the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family’s income. 

To be able to continue running his agricultural business in a sustainable way, Karapet needs a loan of 3,000 USD to purchase three steers and feed for the livestock. The loan will help Karapet to more effectively meet the increasing needs of his family. Karapet and his family highly rely on the goodwill of the lenders and appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount.

loans.use: to purchase three steers and feed for the livestock

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen and his wife live near Sisian city, and they own a plot of land where they cultivate wheat. Karen sells the gathered wheat to the local re-sellers and earns an income for his family. Due to the hard work, Karen manages to sustain their living conditions. 

Now, because of financial difficulties that Karen faces, he would like to ask support from Kiva lenders. The requested amount of 3,000 USD will help Karen to purchase wheat seeds and fuel for transporting the gathered harvest to the market. Karen will be very grateful for the loan from lenders, and it will be a great assistance to Karen and his wife for continuing their farming business.

loans.use: to pay for wheat seeds and fuel for transporting the gathered harvest to the market.

loans.name: Yeghish

texts.en:
Yeghish is an experienced agronomist from the Nor-Armavir village of the Armavir region. He lives with his wife and son. The latter is a labor migrant in Russia; he works there and sends money to the family to take care of their needs. Yeghish works for the local village self-governance body, and his wife works at the local village school as a teacher. All of the family works very hard to be able to cover their daily expenses. 

As their salaries are not enough to fully meet their needs, Yeghish and his wife are also engaged in agribusiness. They are involved in the cultivation of tomatoes, onions, watermelons, peaches, apricots, cherries, plums, and grapes. Yeghish and his wife sell the agricultural products in the local market, which is a very important source of their income. 

To continue running his agribusiness in a sustainable way, Yeghish needs to make some investments. A loan of 3,000 USD will be a huge support to Yeghish and his family, enabling him to purchase fertilizers, tomato and onion seeds, fuel for agricultural machinery, and to pay for harvesting services. Yeghish and his family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and appreciate the support for the loan amount necessary to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, tomato and onion seeds, fuel for agricultural machinery, and to pay for harvesting services.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is an experienced farmer from Lori-Berd village in the Lori region. She lives with her husband and three school-aged children (two daughters and a son). Eliza works as a teacher at the local village school. Teachers' salaries are unfortunately so low that it is impossible for her to earn a living for her family. To be able to cover the family’s expenses, Eliza is engaged in breeding cattle and piglets, aviculture, and cultivating potatoes and grass. Her husband sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of income for the family. 

To continue her agricultural business in a sustainable way, Eliza needs to make some investments. A loan of 2,100 USD will be a huge support to this hardworking woman and her family, enabling her to purchase a cow, two steers, and some feed for the cattle. Eliza and her family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount to maintain and develop her agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase a cow, two steers, and some feed for her cattle

location.town: Lori Berd village of Lori region

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna lives in Shenatagh village with her husband and two adult children. She works at the village school as a gatekeeper and has also been involved in agriculture for 20 years. Together with her husband Anna keeps livestock consisting of 10 cows and 10 sheep. The gathered milk and meat is sold to local re-sellers and the couple is able to earn income for their family. The family also owns agricultural land where different types of fruits and vegetables are being cultivated. As a very enthusiastic and hardworking farmer Anna would like to enlarge her farm. She has applied for this loan of USD 3,000 to be able to purchase 20 sheep to enrich her livestock herd.
Anna will be very thankful to Kiva lenders who assist her in developing her farming business thus being able to ensure better life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase 20 sheep.

loans.name: Nadya

texts.en:
Nadya is a young farmer from Qarakert village in the Armavir region. She lives with her husband, 8-year-old daughter, 6-year-old son, and her parents-in-law. Her husband and father-in-law are construction workers and the main breadwinners of the family. 

To assist them in earning a living, Nadya is involved in agribusiness; she cultivates onions and watermelons. She sells the agricultural products in the local market. Her mother-in-law helps her with everyday activities related to her agribusiness. 

Nadya’s agribusiness currently needs some investment for its continued and sustained development. Nadya needs a loan of 1,500 USD to purchase fertilizers and onion seeds and to pay for harvesting services. She and her family rely strongly on the goodwill of the lenders and appreciate the support for the loan amount necessary to sustain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and onion seeds and to pay for harvesting services.

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en: Vardan is an experienced farmer from Sisian, in the Syuniq region. He lives with his wife and elderly pensioner parents. He works as a clerk in the government sector and is the main breadwinner of the family. His salary, however, is not enough to cover the growing costs of the family. To be able cover the other costs Vardan is engaged in cattle breeding, in aviculture, and in the cultivation of wheat and potato. He sells the agricultural products at the local market, which is the main source of family’s income. His wife helps him greatly in daily activities related to farming. To continue running his agribusiness in a sustainable way Vardan needs a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase two pigs, forage for cattle, and to renovate the agricultural machinery. Vardan and his family rely on the good will of the lenders and will be thankful to them for the support.

loans.use: to purchase two pigs, forage for cattle, and to renovate the agricultural machinery.

loans.name: Asya

texts.en:
Asya is from Sisian. She is a teacher at a local school with many years of experience. Asya lives with her husband, two children and mother-in-law. Together with her family, Asya is also involved in agriculture. She cultivates wheat and her husband sells the gathered harvest at the local markets. Currently by applying for this loan Asya is asking for financial support from the Kiva lenders. The requested loan of USD 2,500 will give her an opportunity to purchase seeds for cultivation of the land.
Asya will be very grateful to the lenders for support and she hopes that this loan will give her and her family an opportunity to run a successful farm.

loans.use: to pay for seeds for cultivation.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is an experienced farmer from Aygevan village in the Ararat region. She lives with her husband. Emma works at the village local school as a teacher. Unfortunately, the teachers’ salary is very low, and it is impossible to afford a living based on that salary. 

To be able to meet her family’s needs, Emma, with the help of her husband, is extensively engaged in agribusiness. They breed livestock including sheep, a pig, piglets, hens, and turkeys. They also cultivate peaches, apples, and grapes. Emma’s husband sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of income for them. 

Emma wants to expand her agribusiness a little bit to be able to effectively meet the growing needs of her family. A loan of 3,000 USD will help her greatly and will enable her to purchase a pig, two calves, and some forage for the livestock. Emma and her husband rely strongly on the goodwill of the lenders and are thankful to them for their help in supporting the necessary loan amount.

loans.use: to purchase a pig, two calves, and some forage for the livestock.

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima is an experienced farmer from Dalarik village in the Armavir region. She lives with her husband, daughter, and 6-year-old granddaughter. Rima’s husband works for a private construction company and is the main breadwinner of the family. Rima’s daughter gets a disability pension. To assist her husband in earning a living for the family, Rima is extensively engaged in agriculture. She is involved in cattle breeding and in cultivating watermelon, apples, peaches, cherries, strawberries, apples, and grapes. Her husband sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of the family’s income. 

To continue running her agricultural business in a sustainable way Rima needs to make some investments in it; she needs to buy a supply of forage for her cattle. A loan of 3,000 USD will be a huge support to this hardworking woman. Rima and her family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount to sustain their business.

loans.use: to purchase forage for her cattle

loans.name: Karine

texts.en: Karine is an experienced agronomist from Haytagh village, in the Armavir region. She lives with her son, daughter-in-law, and her two school-aged grandchildren. To take care of her family’s needs Karine is engaged in agribusiness. With the help of her family members she is involved in the cultivation of potatoes, beets, greens, and strawberries. Karine’s son sells the agricultural products at the local market, which is the main source of the family’s income. As life is getting more expensive day by day Karine wants to expand her agribusiness to be able to more effectively cover the family’s expenses. She currently needs to make some investments to the agribusiness to reach her goal. A loan of USD 3,000 will help Karine and her family greatly, enabling her to purchase necessary materials (cellophane, pipes, and irrigation system) for greenhouse construction, to buy cucumber seeds, and to purchase fertilizers. Karine and her family rely on the good will of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan amount to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase necessary materials (cellophane, pipes, and irrigation system) for greenhouse construction, to buy cucumber seeds, and to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Khonishoy

texts.ru: Хонишой 62 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитали 4 детей, все дети женаты, проживают своей самостоятельной жизнью. У Хонишой на попечении 2 внука. У Хонишой - среднее образование, сразу же после окончания школы она вышла замуж за Жапара. Родила детей, всю жизнь Хонишой занимается ведением домашнего хозяйства, супруг имеет высшее образование работает в госужреждении, имеет стабильную зарплату. А Хонишой тем временем занимается животноводством, стартовав 25 лет назад, с покупки скота на 15,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Хонишой, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 12 дойных коров. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Хонишой обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку бычков для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Хонишой планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Khonishoy is 62 years old, married, and together with her spouse raised four children. All the children are married, living their independent lives. Khonishoy has two grandchildren in her care. Khonishoy has a secondary education. Immediately after graduation, she married Zhapar. She had children, and all her life has been engaged in running the domestic homestead. Her husband has a higher education, works in a state institution, and has a stable income. But Khonishoy in this same time has been engaged in raising livestock, having started 25 years ago with a livestock purchase of 15,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Khonishoy currently has on her homestead: 12 dairy cows. Monthly income amounts to 15,000 som (KGS).

In order to further develop her homestead, Khonishoy applied to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan - to purchase steers for expanding her livestock count.

Khonishoy plans to invest income from the loan in further propagation of domestic livestock.

loans.use: to buy steers

loans.name: Melanya

texts.en:
Melanya is from Lanjazat village in the Ararat region. She lives with her husband, son, daughter, and her elderly pensioner mother-in-law. Melanya works at the village local school as a teacher, and her husband works in the private sector. Both of them work hard to be able to earn a living for the family. Their salaries, however, are very low, and it is almost impossible to cover the growing needs of the family based on those salaries alone. 

To be able to take care of her family’s needs, Melanya is extensively engaged in agribusiness; she cultivates peaches, plums, apples, and strawberries. Melanya and her family have special refrigerators where they keep fruits for a long time and sell those fruits during the winter.  Her husband and son sell the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of their income.
