Elle s approvisionne à Dioila chez les grossistes venant de Fana en pâte de tomate, d’arachide, de cube Maggi, de sel d’oignon, d’aubergine de l’ail de poivre et poivron. Elle revend ses condiments en détail à une clientèle mixte   clientèle à Dioila. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 38000 FCFA. Ce bénéfice sera réinjecté dans son activité de vente de condiment.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is made up of married women who, on average, are 39 years old and have four children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Dioila, Kaladougou commune, Dioila prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region in the Republic of Mali). The women know each other from family, neighborhood, and friendship ties.

The group works in food preparation and the selling of condiments, fruits, and vegetables. They are on their sixth group loan.

Sali, the first person standing on the left, sells condiments. She procures her goods in Dioila from wholesalers coming from Fana [and will buy] tomato paste, ground nuts, Maggi cubes, onion salt, eggplants, garlic, peppers, and pepper.

She will resell her condiments at retail to a mixed clientele in Dioila. She hopes to earn a monthly profit of 38,000 francs CFA. These earnings will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Esmenia

texts.en:
Esmenia is 57 years old, married, and has seven children. She has a small farm of crops, which she has been doing for more than 40 years. 

Esmenia is requesting a loan for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy pesticides, insecticides, and fertilizer. She hopes to keep improving her farming business so she can earn a greater income, which will be used to support her family and children.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides, insecticides, and fertilizer

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita runs a sari-sari (variety) store within her village, which is near a school. She is 49 years old, married, and has one child. Juanita has operated her business for eight years. Her secrets of being successful are her love of her business and her ability to manage it well. 

Juanita would like to take out a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy drinks, snack foods, biscuits, and breads to sell. She is sure that increasing the products she sells will help her reach new customers and increase her income. Juanita hopes to succeed in her business.

loans.use: to buy drinks, snack foods, biscuits, and breads to sell

loans.name: Jebie

texts.en: Jebie helps her husband in their fishing business to make a living. She has been selling fish in the market for 15 years, and she earns well from it. She joined GDMPC in 2009 and recently took a loan to buy fishing materials like nets and hooks. Being positive about the future, she longs to become successful in her business so she can expand in some neighboring areas.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like nets and hooks

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
10 years in the printing press business, Jocelyn is still struggling to find ways for her business to do well. She is 44, married, and from the province of Isabela.

Jocelyn is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to have additional capital to buy materials for her business.

She always dreams that her business will expand so that she can employ people to work in her shop.

loans.use: to have additional capital to buy materials for her printing business

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. 

Julie is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

Julie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. 

She hopes her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Sinoun's Group

texts.en:
Sinoun is 39 years old, married, and has four children. Two of her children are dependents and still in school. To make a living, she has been farming rice and growing sesame for several years. The current business earns her about 26,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.
 
Sinoun’s group of three people has been with Kiva’s partner VisionFund for three cycles. They have successfully repaid the loans. Now she is leading her group to ask for a new loan. As the leader, Sinoun is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her sesame. She hopes to grow more sesame so she can earn more and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for sesame

loans.name: Naira

texts.en: Naira is an experienced agronomist from the village of Araqs in the Armavir region. She lives with her husband and 4-year-old son. To take care of her family, Naira is engaged in the cultivation of wheat and greens. With the help of her husband, she sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family’s income. As the family’s needs are increasing with time, Naira is thinking of expanding her agribusiness to be able to make ends meet. She currently cultivates greens in the greenhouse and wants to start cultivation of different plants in the greenhouse. For that reason she wants to build a new greenhouse. To reach that goal Naira needs to make some investments. She needs a loan of 3,000 USD to purchase necessary materials (cellophane, bottles) for greenhouse construction, to buy fertilizers, and to purchase cucumber seeds. Naira and her family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan amount to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase necessary materials (cellophane, bottles) for greenhouse construction, fertilizers, and cucumber seeds

loans.name: Shirak

texts.en: Shirak is an experienced farmer from the village of Taronik in the Shirak region. He lives with his wife and three children (two sons – 13 and 6 years old, and his 12-year-old daughter). Shirak works in the government sector. His salary, however, is not enough to fully meet the family’s needs. To take care of his family’s needs, Shirak is engaged in the cultivation of wheat, greens, and alfalfa. He sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of his family’s income.  As life is getting more expensive, as time progresses, Shirak wants to expand his agribusiness a little bit to be able to effectively cover the family’s needs. A loan of 1,500 USD will be a huge support to this hardworking man and his family and will enable him to purchase bottles and cellophane for constructing a new greenhouse and to buy fertilizers. Shirak and his family heavily rely on the goodwill of lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan amount to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase bottles and cellophane for constructing a new greenhouse and to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine lives in Dashtavan village of the Ararat region. She is an agronomist with 10 years of experience running a farm. Karine lives with her husband and 25-year-old son, who help her with the farm. Specifically, the family owns two pigs and a greenhouse, where different types of greens are cultivated. 

Karine has now applied for this loan because she needs financial support. The greenhouse that she owns is too old and needs to be renovated. Because of the family's basic costs, Karine isn't able to renovate it. That's the reason she decided to ask for help. Karine will be very grateful to Kiva lenders for their trust and support, and, with the loan's help, she will be able to renovate the greenhouse and increase cultivation.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the greenhouse

loans.name: Bavakan

texts.en: Bavakan is from the village of Horom in the Shirak region. She lives with her elderly, pensioner mother. Bavakan works as the chief accountant of the village ambulatory service and is the only breadwinner of the family. Her salary, however, is very low, and she cannot afford a living based on that salary alone. To be able to fully meet the family’s needs, Bavakan is also engaged in cattle breeding, in aviculture, in breeding piglets, in beekeeping, and in cultivation of wheat and potato.  She sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of income for the family. To be able to continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Bavakan needs a loan of 2,800 USD to purchase wheat seeds, to buy forage for cattle, to pay for harvesting services, and to make previous credit repayments. Bavakan and her elderly mother rely on the goodwill of lenders and will be grateful to them for their help in collecting the needed loan amount.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds, to buy forage for cattle, to pay for harvesting services, and to make previous credit repayments

loans.name: Yuriy

texts.ru: Юрий предоставляет услуги по ремонту и внутренней отделке жилых помещений. У него многолетний опыт работы и много клиентов. Юрий сам разрабатывает и предлагает дизайн стен, подвесных потолков, также кладет кафельную плитку и ламинат. На полученную прибыль Юрий делает ремонт уже в своем доме. Юрий женат, у него двое детей - сын (1 год) и дочь (7 лет). Юрий просит предоставить ему кредит на приобретение инструментов для работы. Данный бизнес является основным источников дохода для семьи Юрия.
texts.en:
Yuriy offers repair services and interior decoration of dwellings. He has many years of work experience and many customers. Yuriy himself develops and offers design for walls and ceilings, and also lays tiles and linoleum. 

With the earned income, Yuriy does repairs on his own home. Yuriy is married and has two children: a son (1 year old) and a daughter (7 years old). Yuriy is requesting a loan to acquire tools for work instruments. The business is the main source of income for Yuriy's family.

loans.use: to purchase tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current stock levels of her second-hand clothing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a truck, five-gallon bottles, and other equipment.

loans.name: Akisa

texts.en:
Akisa is a 30-year-old single woman with no children.
 
She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years.

Akisa has requested a loan to buy a shovel, a wheelbarrow, fertilizer, chemicals, bush knives and boots.
 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Akisa hopes to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy a shovel, a wheelbarrow, fertilizer, chemicals, bush knives and boots.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a gas cooker for use in their house and ingredients for preparing food in her food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize and cassava.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize and cassava dough, groundnut paste for groundnut soup, and tinned tomatoes to improve her overall banku sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase different sizes of rubber containers, buckets, and bowls to increase her existing rubber containers capacity.

loans.name: Ndiaga

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ndiaga, est chauffeur depuis 2002.Il est marié et père de deux enfants. Il conduit un véhicule qui ne lui appartient pas, c’est la raison pour laquelle, il sollicite un crédit de 300000F CFA afin de compléter et d’acheter un véhicule pour lui-même. Ndiaga commence sa journée à 6h du matin et travaille jusqu’à 20h ou même 21h parfois.
 Avec les bénéfices de son activité, Ndiaga peut mettre de l’argent de coté et s’occuper de sa famille. S’il avait les moyens, il chercherait au moins deux véhicules, l’un qu’il conduirait lui-même, l’autre qu’il donnerait à un de ses cousins et récolterait les recettes, en le rémunérant mensuellement.
texts.en:
Ndiaga has been a driver since 2002. He is married and has two children. He drives a car which does not belong to him and for this reason he is requesting a loan of 300,000FCFA to finalise the purchase of his own car. Ndiaga begins his day at 6am and works to 8pm or even 9pm sometimes.

With the profits he makes from his activity, Ndiaga can put aside money and take care of his family. If he had the means he would get at least two cars, so that he could drive one himself, and give the other to his cousin; he would then collect the income by paying him on a monthly basis.

loans.use: to finalise the purchase of a car.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita owns and operates a retail business in their village to earn a living. She has been in her business for more than ten years, earning well for the family's needs. She has successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC that she used to improve her business. 

Recently, she took a new loan to purchase livestock feeds since she is engaged in another line of business where she raises pigs to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feeds.

loans.name: Hamidou Raby Group

texts.fr: Le groupement  s’appelle HAMIDOU RABY.  Il est composé de 10 personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier et font pour la plupart la même activité.  MASSAKE est leur présidente, on le reconnait sur la photo par la main sur le cou, elle est marié et mère de famille.  elle évolue dans la commercialisation des produits alimentaires  comme le riz, l’huile, le sucre, le lait etc………. et a une expérience de plus de 3ans. elle commence sa journée à 9h pour la finir à 16h.elle a besoin de ce prêt pour acheter et vendre des produits alimentaires.  A l’avenir elle souhaite ouvrir une boutique dans le marché et diversifier ses produits. Ainsi elle pourra augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
The group named "Hamidou Raby" is made up of 10 women who live in the same area and are mostly in the same type of business.

Massake is their president, and has put her hand to her neck in the photo. She is married and the mother of a family. She has been working selling food products like rice, oil, sugar, milk, etc. for more than three years.

She starts his day at 9 a.m. and finishes at 4 p.m.

She needs this loan to help buy and sell her food products. 

In the future, she would like to open a shop in the market and diversify her products. Then she will be able to increase her revenues and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food products like rice, oil, and sugar

loans.name: Sopey Galass Group

texts.fr: SOPEY GALASS est un groupement composé de 5 personnes. Elles habitent dans le même quartier et se réunissent tous les débuts de semaine. Leur présidente est KHADY, c'est elle qui détient le carnet de membre sur la photo. C'est une femme mariée et mère de famille. Elle évolue dans la vente de tissus. Elle a une expérience de plus de 5ans et commence sa journée à 8h pour la finir à 19h. Elle sollicite ce montant pour acheter et vendre des tissus dans le marché de la commune. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des charges familiales. A l’avenir elle souhaite diversifier ses produits et augmenter ses revenus afin de pouvoir améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
"Sopey Galass" is a group made up of five women. They live in the same area and they meet at the start of each week. Their president is Khady; she is holding the membership booklet in her hand in the photo. She is married and a mother of a family.

Khady works selling fabrics. She has been doing this for more than five years. She starts her day at 8 a.m. and finishes at 7 p.m. 

She is seeking a loan to buy and sell fabrics in an area market. 

She helps her husband with the family expenses.

In the future, she would like to diversify her products and increase her revenues in order to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric to resell

loans.name: Solidarite Santhiaba Ii Group

texts.fr: SOLIDARITE SANTHIABA II  est un groupement composé de 15 personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier et font tous la même activité. Elles se réunissent à chaque fois de besoin et ont la même ambition. Leur présidente s’appelle KHADY qui est mariée et mère de famille. Sur la photo, elle est assise au centre avec la main levée. Elle a comme activité primaire le commerce et sollicite ce montant pour acheter un grand stock de riz et le revendre après. Elle commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 18h. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. A l’avenir elle voudrait diversifier ses produits et augmenter ses revenus afin de pouvoir améliorer les conditions de vi de sa famille.
texts.en:
"Solidarite Santhiaba II" is a group of 15 people who live in the same area and work in the same business. They meet each time they need to and have the same goals. Their president is named Khady; in the photo, she is seated in the middle with her hand raised. She is married and a mother of a family. 

Khady works mostly in commerce and is seeking a loan to buy a large quantity of rice that she can resell afterwards. 

She starts her day at 9 a.m. and finishes at 6 p.m. 

She helps her husband to take care of the everyday family expenses and her children's school fees.

In the future, Khady would like to diversify her products and increase her revenues in order to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her existing mother care products and children’s clothing capacity.

loans.name: Nouhou

texts.fr: Nouhou habite le Sénégal au sud du pays.Il est marié et pére de 2enfants.Son ainé de 4 ans est à la marternelle et le segond a 2ans.Nouhou est un pécheur avec trois employés.L'objectif du crédit est d'acheter une grande pirogue et des filets pour renforcer son activité.Ainsi il pourra améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et recruter plus de jeunes de sa localité.Il a une expérience de 8 ans et péche de 7h à 14h 6jours sur 7.Nouhou tient aussi un petit commerce d'alimentation générale dans sa maison qu'il gére avec sa femme.
texts.en:
Nouhou lives in Southern Senegal. He is married and a father of two. His eldest, who is four, is in kindergarten; the second child is two.
Nouhou is a fisherman with three employees. His goal with this loan is to buy a large canoe and nets to strengthen his business. He will thus be able to improve living conditions for his family and to hire more young people from his town.
He has eight years of experience and fishes from 7 a.m. until 2 p.m. six days of the week. Nouhou also runs a small grocery store with his wife in their house.

loans.use: to buy a largue canoe and fishing nets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of cassava, maize, tinned tomatoes, fresh tomatoes, onions, bush meat and chicken.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothes, lappa (fabric) etc,

loans.name: Munege Group

texts.fr:
Serges fait partie du groupe Munege et habite à  Rumonge. Il  a 27 ans et est marié à  Emelyne, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants,  âgés de  2 à 8 ans, dont 2 étudient.  

Il fait le commerce de  boutique (haricot, riz, huile de palme) depuis 8  ans. 

Il est à son quatrième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter   un sac rempli de chaussures, 100kg haricot, 50kg de sel, à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait  acheter 5 champs de palmiers à huile  et  voir ses enfants  étudier.
texts.en:
Serges is part of the group Munege and lives in Rumonge. He is 27 years old and married to Emelyne, a farmer. Together they have four children, aged 2 to 8 years old, of whom two are students. 

Serges has been running a store (beans, rice, palm oil) for eight years. He is on his fourth Turame loan. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and purchase a sack filled with shoes, 100 kg of beans, and 50 kg of salt to resell, so as to earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to purchase five fields of oil palms and to see his children educated.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, beans, and salt to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Rukinga Group

texts.fr:
Tharcisse fait partie du groupe Rukinga  et habite à  Rumonge. Il  a 34 ans et est marié à  Caritas, une enseignante. Ensemble ils ont 1 enfant, 6 ans,  qui étudie.  

Il fait le commerce d’habits depuis 8 ans. 

Il est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité d’habits à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait  acheter des champs de palmiers à huile et voir ses enfants  étudier.
texts.en:
Tharcisse belongs to the "Rukinga" group and lives in Rumonge. He is 34 years old and married to Caritas, a teacher. Together, they have one child who is 6 years old and in school.

He has sold clothing for eight years.

He is on his third loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan he obtains, he is going to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of clothing for resale in order to earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to buy a field of oil palms and see his children educated.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of clothes for resale, thus earning more.

loans.name: Niyokindi Group

texts.fr:
Marthe fait partie du groupe  Niyokindi  et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle  a 38 ans et est mariée à Bernard un cordonnier. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants âgés de 2 à 20 ans, dont 5 étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce des poissons, de tomates et des épices,… depuis 5  ans. 

Elle est à son quatrième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de poissons, de tomates, et des épices,… à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  acheter un réfrigérateur  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en: Marthe is a part of the Niyokindi group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 38 years old and married to Bernard, a cobbler. Together, they have six children between the ages of 2 and 20, of which five are in school. She has sold fish, tomatoes and spices for five years. She is on her fourth loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan that she obtains, she is going to increase her capital and buy a lot of fish, tomatoes, and spices to resell for a profit. In the coming years, she would like to buy a refrigerator and to see her students in school.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a lot of fish, tomatoes, and spices to resell for a profit.

loans.name: Intwari  Ii Group

texts.fr:
J. Bosco fait partie du groupe Intwari II et habite à Bujumbura. C’est un célibataire de 35 ans.  

Il fait le commerce des habits depuis 8 ans. 

Il  est à son quatrième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’habits  à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait  fonder son foyer.
texts.en:
J. Bosco is part of the Intwari II group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 35 years old and single. He has been trading clothes for the past eight years.

This is his fourth credit loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan, he will increase his working capital and buy a lot of clothes for resale, to earn more.

In coming years, he wants to establish a family.

loans.use: increase his working capital and buy a lot of clothes for resale, to earn more.

loans.name: Umuhora Group

texts.fr:
Epitas  fait partie du groupe Umuhora   et habite à  Rumonge. Il  a 32 ans et est marié à  Constance, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont  4 enfants âgés de 4 à 12 ans dont 4 étudient.  

Il fait le commerce  de palmiers à huile  depuis 3 ans. 

Il est à son cinquième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  un champ de palmiers à huile pour vendre beaucoup de  palmiers à huile, afin de gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait  acheter une moto  et voir ses enfants  étudier.
texts.en:
Epitas belongs to the "Umuhora" group and lives in Rumonge. He is 32 years old and married to Constance, a merchant. Together, they have four children between the ages of 4 and 12, four of whom are in school.

He has run an oil palm business for three years.

He is on his fifth loan with Turame. With the Kiva credit he obtains, he is going to increase his capital and buy a field of oil palms in order to sell more oil palms and earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to buy a motorcycle and see his children educated.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a field of oil palms to sell lots of oil palms in order to earn more.

loans.name: Mushirambeho Group

texts.fr:
Saltiel fait partie du groupe Mushirambeho  et habite à  Rumonge. Il  a 49 ans et est marié à  Rénilde, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 10 enfants âgés de 4 à 24 ans dont 6 étudient.  

Il fait le commerce d’huile de palme  depuis 25 ans. 

Il est à son deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité d’huile de palme(25 bidons de 20 litres chacun) à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait  acheter des champs de palmiers à huile et voir ses enfants  étudier.
texts.en:
Saltiel belongs to the "Mushirambeho" group and lives in Rumonge. He is 49 years old and married to Rénilde, a farmer. Together they have ten children, aged 4 to 24, six of whom are in school.

He has run a business selling palm oil for 25 years.

He is on his second loan with Turame. With the Kiva credit he obtains, his is going to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of palm oil (25 cans, each of 20 litres) for resale in order to earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to buy a field of oil palms and see his children educated.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of palm oil (25 cans, each of 20 litres) to resell in order to earn more.

loans.name: Izigirwa Group

texts.fr:
Paulette fait partie du groupe  Izigirwa  et habite à  Gitega. Elle  a 49 ans et est mariée à Aster, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants,  âgés de 7 à 23 ans,dont 4 étudient.  

Elle  fait le commerce du lait  depuis 15 ans. 

Elle est à son quatorzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de litres de lait à revendre  pour gagner  plus.

Dans les prochaines années,elle voudrait   voir ses enfants  étudier.
texts.en:
Paulette is a member of the Izigirwa group and lives in Gitega. She is 49 years old and is married to Aster, a merchant. Together they have five children, aged from seven to 23 years old. Four of the children go to school.

Paulette has been selling milk for 15 years. She is on her 14th loan with Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, she is going to increase her capital and buy many liters of milk, which she will resell to earn more.

In the coming years, she would like to see her children study.

loans.use: to buy many liters of milk to resell

loans.name: Unganira Group

texts.fr:
Pontien fait partie du groupe  Unganira  et habite à  Gitega. Il  a 38 ans et est marié à Caritas, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants dont 3 étudient.  

Il  fait le commerce de banane depuis  3 ans. 

Elle est à son  sixième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de bananes  à revendre  afin de  gagner plus.

Le gain de son commerce permet de satisfaire les besoins familiaux (se nourrir, se faire soigner,…).
texts.en:
Pontien is a member of the Unganira group and lives in Gitega. He is 38 years old and married to a Caritas, a farmer. Together they have five children, of whom three go to school.

Pontien has been selling bananas for three years. He is on his sixth loan with Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, he is going to increase his capital to buy a large quantity of bananas to resell in order to earn more.

Earnings from this business will allow him to meet the needs of his family (to feed them, to take care of them,…).

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of bananas to resell

loans.name: Baraka Group

texts.fr:
Fatuma  fait partie du groupe  Baraka  et habite à  Bujumbura. Elle  a 37 ans et est mariée à Daniel, un mécanicien. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants,  âgés de 8 à 23 ans, tous  étudient.  

Elle  fait le commerce d’eau froide emballée dans un petit sachet depuis 8 ans. 

Elle est à son neuvième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de sachets (20 000 sachets)servant dans la conservation d'une grande quantité d'eau froide   à revendre  pour gagner  plus.

Dans les prochaines années, elle  voudrait acheter un réfrigérateur et faire le commerce des habits.
texts.en:
Fatuma  is part of the Baraka Group, and lives in Bujumbura.  She is thirty-seven years old and married to Daniel, who is a mechanic.  They have five children, aged between eight and twenty-three years.  All their children attend school.

Fatuma has sold fresh water, packaged in a small sachet, for eight years.

This will be her ninth loan with the field partner, Turame.  She will use her Kiva loan to increase her capital, and buy many (20,000) sachets to be used in the conservation and resale of fresh water.  In this way, she expects to increase her earnings.

In the coming years, Fatuma would like to buy a refrigerator and start selling clothing.

loans.use: to buy 20 000 sachets to be used to sell fresh water.

loans.name: Tubebamwe Group

texts.fr:
Calixte  fait partie du groupe Tubebamwe  et habite à  Bujumbura. Elle a 29 ans et est mariée à Gertrude, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont  6 enfants,  âgés de 4 à 19 ans, dont 4  étudient. 
Il a sous sa charge un enfant membre de sa famille élargie. 

Il  fait le commerce de boutique (riz, savon, huile de palme,…)  depuis  3 ans. 

Il est à son  douzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’articles de sa boutique (haricot, riz, huile de palme, savon,…) à revendre  pour gagner  plus.

Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait faire l’élevage de chèvres et de poules et  voir ses enfants  étudier.
texts.en: Calixte is a member of the Tubebamwe Group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 29 years old and married to Gertrude, a shopkeeper.  Together, they have six children, ages 4 to 19, four of which attend school.  He also has one additional dependent from his extended family.  For the past three years, he has owned a shop that sells rice, soap, palm oil, etc.  He is on his 12th loan with Turame.  With this Kiva loan, he will increase his working capital and buy many items for his store (beans, rice, palm oil, soap, etc) for resale to earn more.  In the coming years, he would like to raise goats and chickens and to see his children attend school.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, palm oil, soap, etc.

loans.name: Imigisha Group

texts.fr:
Calénie fait partie du groupe  Imigisha  et habite à  Gitega. Elle  a 44 ans et est mariée à Roger, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants, dont 3 étudient.  

Elle  fait le commerce de vaches   depuis 13 ans. 

Elle est à son onzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de vaches  à revendre  pour gagner  plus.
texts.en:
Calénie belongs to the Imigisha group and lives in Gitega. She is 44 years old and married to Roger, who is a trader. They have four children together, three of whom are studying.

Calénie has been buying and selling cows for the past 13 years and is on her 11th loan from Turame. With this Kiva loan she is going to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of cows that she will resell in order to make more money.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of cows to resell and make more money.

loans.name: Igiramahoro Group

texts.fr:
Isaac  fait partie du groupe  Igiramahore et habite à  Bubanza. Il  a 27 ans et est marié  à Francine, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants,  âgés de 6 mois  à 8 ans, dont 1 étudie.  

Il  fait le commerce d’huile de palme  depuis  12 ans. 

C’est son premier   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter 5 fûts de noix de palme pour produire une grande quantité de l’huile de palme   à revendre  pour gagner  plus.

Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait  acheter une machine servant dans la  production de l’huile de palme et, voir ses enfants  étudier.
texts.en:
Isaac is a member of the Igiramahore Group, and lives in Bubanza.  He is twenty-seven years old, and married to Francine, who works as a trader.  Together they have four children, aged from six months to eight years.  One of their children attends school.

Isaac has sold palm oil for twelve years.  This will be his first loan with the field partner, Turame.  He will use his loan to increase his working capital and buy five barrels of palm nuts, which he will use to produce a large quantity of palm oil.  He will then sell the oil to increase his earnings.

In the future, Isaac would like to buy a machine to help in the production of palm oil, and provide for his children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy 5 barrels of palm nuts, to produce a large quantity of palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Ubwato Group

texts.fr:
Japhet  fait partie du groupe  Ubwato  et habite à  Bubanza. Il  a 23 ans et est marié  à Joselyne, une infirmière.  

Il  fait le commerce de l’huile de palme depuis  7 ans. 

C’est son premier   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter   des  palmiers à huile pour avoir des noix de palme afin de produire une grande quantité de l’huile de palme  à  vendre,  pour gagner  plus.

Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait  ouvrir une pharmacie et faire la culture de tomates.
texts.en:
Japhet is a member of the Ubwato Group, and lives in Bubanza.  He is twenty-three years old, and married to Joselyne, a nurse.

Japhet has sold palm oil for seven years.  This will be his first loan with the field partner, Turame.  He will use his loan to increase his working capital and buy oil palm trees in order to have palms nuts to use for the production of large quantites of palm oil.  He will then sell the palm oil to increase his earnings.

In the coming years, Japhet would like to open a pharmacy and cultivate tomatoes.

loans.use: to buy oil palm trees to use for palm oil production.

loans.name: Ushirukumwete Group

texts.fr:
Léonidas fait partie du groupe  Ushirukumwete et habite à  Bubanza. Il  a 40 ans et est marié  à Rahab, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants,  âgés de 2 à 12 ans,dont 3 étudient.  

Il  fait le commerce du  riz  depuis  6 ans. 

C’est son premier   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de  kg de riz à revendre  pour gagner  plus.

Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait construire une maison en matériaux durables et voir ses enfants  étudier.
texts.en:
Léonidas is a member of the Ushirukumwete Group, and lives in Bubanza.  He is forty years old, and married to Rahab, who grows vegetables.  Together they have three children, aged from two to twelve years, all of the children attend school.

Léonidas has sold rice for six years.  This will be his first loan with the field partner, Turame.  He will use his loan to increase his working capital and buy many kilos of rice for resale.  In this way, he expects to increase his earnings.

In the future, Léonidas would like to build a solid and long-lasting house, and provide for his children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy rice for resale.

loans.name: Komezadukore Group

texts.fr:
Fitina fait partie du groupe  Komezadukore et habite à  Bujumbura. Elle  a 51 ans et est mariée à Abdoul, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants,  âgés de 6 à 18 ans, tous  étudient.  

Elle  fait le commerce de restaurant depuis 20 ans. 

Elle est à son cinquième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter  de  100kg de haricot, 100kg de riz , 40l  d’huile de palme ,200kg de farine et du bois de chauffage pour vendre de la nourriture cuite, dans son restaurant.

Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait acheter une parcelle et voir ses enfants  étudier.
texts.en:
Fitina is part of the Komezadukore Group and lives in Bujumbura.  She is fifty-one years old and married to Abdoul, who is a trader.  They have six children together, aged between six and eighteen years.  All the children attend school.

Fitina has run a restaurant for twenty years.  

This will be her fifth loan with the field partner, Turame.  She will use her loan to increase her working capital and buy 100kg of beans, 100kg of rice, 40l of palm oil, 200kg of flour and firewood to prepare hot food for sale in her restaurant.

In the coming years, Fitina would like to buy a plot of land and provide for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy 100kg of beans, 100kg of rice, 40l of palm oil, 200kg of flour and firewood to produce food for sale in her restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase his capital and buy four barrels of palm nuts to make palm oil and 80kg of rice for resale, so that he can earn more money.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of tomatoes and onions for resale so he can make more money.

loans.name: Ntarusaku Group

texts.fr:
Emmanuel fait partie du groupe  Ntarusaku et habite à  Bubanza. Il  a 24 ans et est marié  à  M. Goreth, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants,  âgés de 10 mois  à 6 ans.
Elle a sous sa charge un enfant membre de sa famille élargie, qui étudie.  

Il  fait le commerce de boutique (riz, biscuits, huile de palme …)  depuis  4 ans. 

C’est son premier   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter 2 bidons d ’huile de palme et un carton rempli de biscuits  à revendre  pour gagner  plus.

Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait   devenir grossiste des produits de boutique .
texts.en:
Emmanuel is a member of the Ntarusaku Group, and lives in Bubanza.  He is twenty-four years old, and married to M. Goreth, who works as a trader.  Together they have four children, aged from ten months to six years.  He is also responsible for another child, who is studying and is part of Emmanuel's extended family.

Emmanuel has sold food products (rice, biscuits, palm oil, etc) from his shop for four years.

This will be the first loan for Emmanuel from the field partner, Turame.  He will use his loan to increase his working capital and buy two barrels of palm oil and a box of biscuits to resell.  In this way, he will increase his earnings.

In the coming years, Emmanuel would like to become a wholesaler and supply shop-keepers himself.

loans.use: to buy 2 barrels of oil and a box of biscuits for resale.

loans.name: Kijumbu Group

texts.fr:
Félix  fait partie du groupe  Kijumbu  et habite à  Bubanza. Il  a 29 ans et est marié  à Sandrine, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 1 enfant de 3 ans.  

Il  fait le commerce de brochettes  depuis  4 ans. 

C’est son premier   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter   2 chèvres pour préparer des brochettes  à vendre  pour gagner  plus.

Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait faire l’élevage de chèvres  et  voir ses enfants  étudier.
texts.en:
Félix is a member of the Kijumbu Group, and lives in Bubanza.  He is twenty-nine years old and married to Sandrine, who works as a trader.  Together they have a three-year-old child.

Félix has sold meat kebabs for four years.  This will be his first loan with the field partner, Turame.  He will use his loan to increase his working capital and buy two goats to use in his meat kebabs.

In the future, Félix would like to raise his own goats and provide for his children's schooling.

loans.use: to purchase 2 goats for food production for resale.

loans.name: Niyonyishu Group

texts.fr:
Gaspard fait partie du groupe  Niyonyishu  et habite à  Bubanza. Il  a 39 ans et est marié à Sylvie, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants,  âgés de 1 à 6 ans.  

Elle  fait le commerce de patate douce  et de noix de palme  depuis 3 ans. 

C’est son premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter une  grande quantité de patates douces à revendre  pour gagner  plus.

Dans les prochaines années, il  voudrait faire le commerce de restaurant et voir ses enfants  étudier.
texts.en:
Gaspard belongs to the Niyonyishu group and lives in Bubanza. He is 39 years old and married to Sylvie, who is a trader. They have three children together, ranging from one to six years old.

He has been selling sweet potatoes and palm oil for the past three years. It is his first loan from Turame and with this Kiva loan he is going to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of sweet potatoes to resell and make more money.

In the coming years he would like to have a restauration business and see his children go to school.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of sweet potatoes to resell and earn more money.

loans.name: Humuriza Group

texts.fr:
Bernard  fait partie du groupe  Humuriza  et habite à  Bujumbura. Il  a 52 ans et est marié  à Necelate, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants,  âgés de 12 à 25 ans,  tous  étudient.  
Il a sous sa charge un enfant membre de sa famille élargie,  qui étudie.

Il  fait le commerce de boutique (savon, habits, babouches,…)    depuis  6 ans. 

Il est à son quatrième   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de babouches, de savons, d' habits,… à revendre  pour gagner  plus.

Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait construire une maison en matériaux durables, acheter une voiture et    voir ses enfants  étudier.
texts.en:
Bernard  is a member of the Humuriza Group, and lives in Bujumbura.  He is fifty-two years old and married to Necelate, who works as a vegetable grower.  Together they have six children, aged between twelve and twenty-five years.  All their children attend school.  He is also responsible for another child, who is a member of his extended family, and is studying.

Bernard has sold various products (soap, clothes, slippers, etc) from his shop, for six years.  This will be his fourth loan with the field partner, Turame.  He plans to use his loan to increase his working capital and buy slippers, soap and clothing.  He will then sell these products to increase his earnings.

In the coming years, Bernard would like to build a solid and long-lasting house, buy a car and provide for his children's schooling.

loans.use: to purchase slippers, soap and clothing for resale.

loans.name: Rom's Group

texts.en:
Rom, 30, is married and lives with her husband and four children in a village of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. 

She and her husband have been growing chilies and also working as paid workers for 10 years. The current business earns her about 20,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Rom’s group consists of two members who are female. She is a fourth-cycle client while her co-member is new with Kiva’s partner Vision Fund. She has successfully paid back the past loans, which have helped her family relieve its financial burden and improve its livelihood. 

Now leading her group to ask for a loan, Rom is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her chilies. She hopes to earn more income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her chilies.

loans.name: Galina

texts.ru: Галине 59 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитали 5 детей. Все дети проживают самостоятельно и отдельно, кроме младшего сына, он проживает вместе с родителями. Супруг помогает Галине по хозяйству. У Галины - средне-специальное образование. Семья Галины после распада СССР начала заниматься сельским хозяйством, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Галина занимается полеводством, стартовав 23 года назад, с 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Галины, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: земельный надел размером 2,20 ГА, на которой выращивает клевер и фасоль для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 16,000 сом (KGS). В целях дополнительного развития своего хозяйства, Галина обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку одной коровы для увеличения поголовья скота, за счет получения молока от коровы Галина намерена увеличить доходы своей семьи и параллельно заниматься как полеводством, так и животноводством. Доходы от кредита Галина планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку бытовой техники домой.
texts.en:
Galina is 59 years old, married, and together with her spouse raised five children. All the children reside independently and separately, except for the youngest son who lives with his parents. Galina's husband helps her around the homestead. Galina has a secondary specialized education. Galina's family, after the fall of the USSR, began to engage in agriculture. As a main source of income for her family, Galina raises crops, having begun 23 years ago with 5,000 som KGS. 

Thanks to her hard work, Galina currently has on her homestead: arable land measuring 2.20 hectares, on which she grows clover and beans for sale. Monthly income amounts to 16,000 som (KGS). With the aim of additional development of her homestead, Galina applied to the microfinacne bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan - to purchase one cow to increase her livestock count. By collecting milk from a cow, Galina intends to increase income for her family and in parallel to engage in crop cultivation and animal husbandry. 

Galina plans to invest income from the loan in further propagation of the count of domestic animals, and plans to save money to buy home appliances.

loans.use: to buy cow

loans.name: Ingoma Group

texts.fr:
Jérôme fait partie du groupe  Ingoma  et habite à  Rumonge. Il  a 41 ans et est marié  à Eliza, une cultivatrice.  

Il  fait le commerce de  boutique (sucre, farine de sorgho, farine de maïs,…) depuis  5 ans. 

Il est à son quatrième   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter   beaucoup d’articles de sa boutique (sucre, farine de sorgho, farine de maïs,…)   à  revendre  pour gagner  plus.

Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait acheter des terrains cultivables et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Jérôme belongs to the Ingoma group and lives in Rumonge. He is 41 years old and married to Eliza, who is a farmer.

He has been selling products in a shop (sugar, sorghum flour, cornflour, etc.) for the past five years and is on his fourth loan from Turame. With this Kiva loan he is going to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of these products for his shop, which he will resell to make more money.

In the coming years he would like to buy some farmable land and see his children have an education.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of shop products (sugar, sorghum flour, cornflour) to resell and make more money.

loans.name: Savean's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Siem Reap province’s Srey Snom district, Savean is 40-year-old mother of five children, two of whom are still in school. 

She and her husband are rice farmers. Having been in the business for five years, she can make daily income from her current business of 20,000 KHR and is able to save about 10,000 KHR per day after expenses for future needs.

Savean has been with VisionFund for five cycles and completely paid back the past loans which have helped her better support her current business. 

Now leading her group to ask for a loan, Savean will use her portion to pay for harvesting the rice fields. She hopes to earn more income from the rice paddy.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting the rice fields.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Monsieur Drissa est né vers 1980 à Bougouni. Père de 4 enfants il vit dans une famille traditionnelle dans le quartier Torakabougou de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 Il mène des activités de commercialisation de céréales depuis plus de 9 ans. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et reçoit des commandes de céréales, notamment du maïs et du sorgho. Ainsi pour avoir les ressources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ses clients, il collabore avec l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son  7 eme prêt maintenant, les six prêts passés ont été correctement remboursés.  
Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter,  5 tonnes de maïs et 1 tonne de sorgho.
Il s’approvisionne dans les villages de Garalo et environs. Les céréales sont stockées dans son magasin pendant un certain temps. Il  les revend au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes venant de Sikasso et de Bamako et souvent Adama les transporte à Bamako au besoin. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 150 000 FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
Il compte devenir un grossiste à Bougouni.
texts.en:
Mr. Drissa was born around 1980 in Bougouni. The father of four, he lives in a traditional family in the Torakabougou district in Bougouni City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). He has been running a business selling grains for over nine years. His experience in this domain has earned him a good reputation. He receives orders for grains, especially corn and sorghum. So, to obtain the necessary resources for satisfying his customers, he is collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on his seventh loan. The six previous loan were correctly repaid. 

This loan will enable him to purchase 5 tonnes of corn and a tonne of sorghum. He gets his supplies from the villages of Garalo and nearby. The grains are stocked in a store for a certain time. He resells them for cash to a customer base composed of men and women from Sikasso and Bamako and often Adama. He transports them to Bamako as needed. 

With this loan, he envisions making an average monthly profit of 150,000 francs CFA. This profit will allow him to pay the loan interest and invest the rest in his business. He plans on becoming a wholesaler in Bougouni.

loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Fasso Kanou Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe FASSO KANOU ont en moyenne 36 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies     dans la ville de BLA dans la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des  grains de céréales et de la  restauration.
 Les femmes du groupe FASSO KANOU sont à leur  1er   prêt solidaire. SAFI 2 eme  femme à  la droite sur la photo  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 100kg de fonio. Elle s’approvisionne à BLA pendant les jours des foires. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 14 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé et  à la nourriture aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Fasso Kanou Group have an average age of 36 and an average of two children each. They all live in traditional families in the town of Bla, located in the fourth-largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali.

The women know each other because they are related. They work buying and selling cereals and in the food-serving business. This is the first group loan for the women of the Fasso Kanou Group.

Safi is the second woman on the right in the photo. She plans to use this loan to buy 100 kilos of fonio [a species of millet]. She buys her supplies in Bla on market days. She sells to both men and women, in cash and also often on credit. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 14,000 francs CFA, which will be used for health, food and school expenses. She will reinvest the rest in her business.

loans.use: to buy fonio [a species of millet].

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of crates of soda (Fanta, Coke, and Sprite), thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Washizu

texts.en:
Washizu is 20 years old and single with no children. She owns and operates a business venture, sewing. She has two years of experience in this line of business.

Washizu needs a loan to buy materials, threads, zippers, buttons and an overlock machine. She hopes to use her profits to improve her business. She joined SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy materials, threads, zippers, buttons and an overlock machine.

loans.name: Néstor

texts.es:
Néstor es transportista de la ciudad de Pilar, está casado y tiene dos hijos, vive en casa propia, su esposa es funcionaria pública de esa ciudad.
El señor Néstor realiza viajes diarios transportando pasajeros desde varios puntos de la ciudad. Es una persona muy trabajadora, con buenas referencias y con más de 10 años de experiencia en el trabajo que hace. 
Ella solicita el préstamo para reparar el motor de su trasporte y de esa forma poder seguir trabajando y luchando por mejorar cada día. 
Néstor agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder seguir mejorando.
texts.en:
Néstor has a transportation business in the city of Pilar.  He is married, has two children and lives in his own house.  His wife is a civil servant in the city.  Néstor transports passengers on a daily basis to different parts of the city.  He is a hard worker with good references and has been in business for over ten years.

The loan he is requesting is to repair the engine of his vehicle so he can continue working and struggling to improve his daily lifestyle.  Néstor is grateful for the opportunity to continue getting ahead.

loans.use: To repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels of yam tubers.

loans.name: San Pablo Apostol Group

texts.es:
Las 17 integrantes de este grupo son mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, que han visto una gran oportunidad de crecimiento en el programa de comité de mujeres, es por eso que decidieron unirse, para poder trabajar juntas.
La señora Pascuala es integrante del comité, ella es casada y cuenta con una pequeña mercería, donde vende todo tipo de productos con lo cual surte su barrio y da a sus clientes todo lo que necesitan. Por medio de su trabajo y esfuerzo ha ido mejorando y creciendo, y ve una gran oportunidad de seguir creciendo por medio del grupo.
Pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas, zapatos, artículos de bazar y demás. Agradecen por la oportunidad que todas están recibiendo de mejorar sus vidas.
texts.en:
The 17 members of this group are hard-working, determined women who have seen the great growth opportunity in the communal bank, so they decided to band and work together.

One of the members of the group, Pascuala, is married and has a small shop where she sells all kinds of products to people in the neighborhood, including everything her customers need.  Through her work and efforts she has improved and grown, and sees a great opportunity to continue expanding through the group.

She is requesting a loan to buy clothing, shoes, trinkets and other items.  She is grateful for the opportunity all the members are receiving so they can improve their lives.

loans.use: To buy clothing, shoes, trinkets and other items.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 38-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 9 years to 14 years. She describes herself as determined and focused. 

She operates a farm where she grows tea for sale. She has been in this business for six years. She also keeps dairy cows to earn extra income.

She has taken a loan of KES 25,000 to buy a water storage facility. This will enable her family of five store clean water for domestic use. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water storage facility.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a Kiva borrower who is 41 years old and married. She has four children. She describes herself as focused. 

She sells cereals to earn a living. She has been in this business for five years. 

She will use the loan of KES 20,000 to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. The tank will benefit six family members. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to license his business through the state, hire someone to install handicapped-friendly bars, adjust sprinkler heads, and make plumbing modifications.

loans.name: Las 3 Amigas Group

texts.es:
Rudy, tiene 20 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo y vive con sus padres en Olanchito. Ella estuvo estudiando, luego logro dedicarse al comercio, vende ropa, zapatos, plásticos, cosméticos, cremas y electrodomésticos. Las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante y por pedidos. Esta solicitando el cuarto ciclo en forma grupal, particularmente es por 7,000 lempiras con el cual va surtir de mercadería como ropa, zapatos, y electrodomésticos para vender y poder crecer y mejorar los ingresos. Su plan es tener un negocio grande para sacar a su familia adelante. 
El grupo se llama Las 3 Amigas y lo integran tres personas, quienes viven en la misma comunidad, se dedican al comercio y están solicitando 7,000 Lempiras cada uno, haciendo un total de 21,000 lempiras para surtir sus negocios de mercadería y aumentar las ventas. En la foto esta Rudy de blusa blanca, en medio esta José y a la derecha esta Melba.
texts.en:
Rudy, 20, is a single mother with a son and she lives with her parents in Olanchito.  She used to be a student and then began working as a merchant selling clothing, shoes, plastics, cosmetics, creams and domestic appliances.  She works as a street vendor taking orders.  The loan she is requesting through the communal bank is her fourth and the amount is for 7,000 HNL which she will use to buy clothing, shoes and domestic appliances to sell and improve her income.

Her goal is to have a larger business to support the family.  The communal bank, called "Las Tres Amigas" is comprised of three people who all live in the same community.  They are all merchants and each one is requesting 7,000 HNL for a total 21,000 HNL  This is to stock their businesses and increase sales.

In the photograph Rudy is the one in the white blouse, José is in the middle and Melba is on the right.

loans.use: To buy clothing, shoes and domestic appliances to sell.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en: Jesusa is 41 years old and married to a photographer who earns income when hired for special occasions. With her desire to help him, Jesusa started a livestock business raising hogs. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase more feed to ensure that her hogs reach their optimum growth in a healthy and efficient manner.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her hog-raising business

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en:
Charlyn owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting corn for sale to earn a living. She also grows and harvests coconut and sells it in town. 

She has successfully repaid her previous loans from GDMPC that she used to improve the farm. To restore soil fertility, she took a new loan to buy organic fertilizer. In the future, Charlyn hopes to improve her house for a comfortable living for the family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Mutabazi Group

texts.fr:
Oscar  fait partie du groupe  Mutabazi  et habite à  Rumonge. Il  a 38 ans et est marié  à Anastasie, une  cultivatrice.  

Il  fait le commerce de boutique (huile de palme, haricot, riz,…) depuis  6 ans. 

Il est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter   beaucoup d’articles de sa boutique (huile de palme, haricot, riz,…)  à  revendre  pour gagner  plus.

Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait  construire une maison annexe dans sa parcelle et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Oscar is part of the group Mutabazi and lives in Rumonge. He is 38 years old and married to Anastasie, a farmer. 

Oscar has been running a store (palm oil, beans, rice, …) for six years. He is on his third Turame loan. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and purchase many goods for his store (palm oil, beans, rice, …) to resell, so as to earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to build house annex on his plot of land and to see his children educated.

loans.use: to purchase many store goods (palm oil, beans, rice, ...) to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Bubira

texts.ru: Бубире 23 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 1 сына. По характеру Бубира -добрая, отзывчивая и трудолюбивая. Супруг находится на заработках в России. Бубира проживает вместе со свекром и свекровью. Они очень хорошо отзываются о своей невестке. У Бубиры - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Бубира занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав 2 года назад, с суммы в 15,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Бубиры и ее семьи, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, а также земельный надел размером 2,10 ГА, а также они арендуют около 3,0 ГА земли у односельчан. На своей плодотворной земельной доле Бубира выращивает множество видов овощей для реализации, такие как: картофель, помидоры, огурцы, кукурузу, арбузы. Землю постоянно обрабатывают, поэтому урожай всегда хороший. Урожай Бубира реализует оптовым продавцам. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дополнительного развития своего хозяйства, Бубира обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку бычков для откорма и разведения. Бубира знает тонкости животноводства, поэтому она планирует развести скот. Доходы от кредита Бубира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и намерена собрать средства на обеспечение сына всем необходимым.
texts.en:
Bubira is 23 years old, married, and with her husband is raising on son. By character, Bubira is kind, responsive and hardworking. Her husband is working abroad in Russia. Bubira resides with her in-laws. They respond very well to their daughter-in-law. Bubira has a secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, Bubira is involved with crop cultivation and raising livestock, having begun two years ago with a sum of 15,000 som KGS. 

Thanks to the hard work of Bubira and her family, they currently have on their homestead: two dairy cows, arable land measuring 2.10 hectares, and also they rent around 3.0 hectares of land to fellow villagers. On her fruitful share of land, Bubira grows many types of vegetables for sale, such as: potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbes, corn, and watermelons. The earth is continually re-worked, therefore the harvest is always good. Bubira's crop is sold to wholesalers. Monthly income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS). 

With the aim of additional development of her homestead, Bubira turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan - to purchase bulls for fattening and breeding. Bubira knows the specifics of animal husbandry, therefore she plans to breed cattle. 

Bubira plans to invest income from the loan in further propagation of the count of domestic animals, and intends to save money to support her son with all the necessities.

loans.use: to buy calves for fattening and breeding

loans.name: Asatullo

texts.ru: Асатулло позитивный и ответственный мужчина в возрасте 56 лет. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. Он живёт со своей семьёй в небольшом посёлке. Но дом, в котором они живут, маловат и не совсем  благоустроен для хорошего проживания в нём. Жена Асатулло домохозяйка, она очень трудолюбивая и заботливая мама. Сам Асатулло работает продавцом мужской одежды на центральном рынке. Этим бизнесом он занимается вот уже несколько лет  и получает хорошую прибыль. Но этого дохода хватает Асатулло только на проживание. Но у него есть мечта, он хочет построить большой дом для своей семьи. И для этого ему необходимы денежные средства. То, что он зарабатывает не достаточно, чтобы позволить себе построение нового дома. Поэтому Асатулло  обратился в Арванд и  хочет получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов для построения дома. Асатулло  надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд  за поддержку.
texts.en:
Asatullo is a positive and responsible man of 56. He is married and has two children. He lives with his family in a small village. But the house in which they live is quite small and not quite well-constructed for good living in it. Asatullo's wife is a homemaker. She is a very hardworking and loving mother. Asatullo himself works as a salesman of men's clothing in the central market. He has been involved in this business for several years and receives a good income. But this income provides Asatullo only with a subsistence. 

He has dreams: he wants to build a large home for his family. And for this, he needs cash. That which he earns is insufficient to afford building a new home. Therefore, Asatullo turned to Arvand and wants to receive a loan to purchase building materials for построения дома. Asatullo hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Sophal is a 46-year-old mother of five children, two of whom are in school while another two are too young for school. 

She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and planting cassava as the main source of the family’s income. They have been in this business for ten years, earning about 40,000 KHR per day.

Sophal is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is requesting a loan to buy seeds and plow the field. She hopes to make more income from her current business so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy seeds and plow the field.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Choert's Group

texts.en:
Aged 50 years, Choert is widowed and lives with her five children in a rural area located in the Srey Smom district of Siem Reap province. 

She has made a living through farming rice. Having been in this business for 15 years, she is able to earn about 25,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.

Choert has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her better support her family with enough food. She is going to use her portion to pay for harvesting her rice. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting her rice.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Дилафруз позитивная и дружелюбная женщина в возрасте 40 лет. Она живёт вместе со своей семьёй в сельском посёлке.  Дилафруз с детства имела желание научиться готовить разные блюда. Она многому научилась у своей матери. На сегодня этот опыт помогает ей зарабатывать деньги. Для того, чтобы иметь доход в семье, она занимается своим бизнесом. Дилафруз продаёт различные салаты и соленья, которые  приготавливает самостоятельно. Этим делом она занимается вот уже как 3 года. Он также является клиентом Арванд. Первый свой кредит она получила как раз для  того, чтобы начать свой бизнес. Сейчас Дилафруз необходимо закупить ещё продуктов и разных специи для приготовления очередной партии салатов для продажи. Для этого она в очередной раз обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку продуктов и специй. Дилафруз надеется на положительный результат  и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Dilafruz is a positive and outgoing woman of 40 years. She lives with her family in a rural village. Since childhood, Dilafruz has had the desire to learn to cook different dishes. She learned a lot from her mother. Today this experience helps her to earn a living. In order to have an income for her family, she engages in her own business. Dilafruz sells various salads and pickles, which she prepares herself. She has been engaged in this work for three years. 

She is a repeat client of Arvand. Her first loan was received in order to start a business. Now, Dilafruz needs to purchase more products and different spices to prepare another batch of salads for sale. For this, she has once again appealed to Arvand and wants to receive a loan to buy products and spices. Dilafruz needs a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to purchase products and spices

loans.name: Cindy

texts.en:
Pho Realz?!'s last Kiva loan gave them the boost they needed to get their budding business off the ground. As their pop-up noodle business has grown, they are now seeking a second $10,000 Kiva loan to purchase the equipment needed for an additional food tent, enabling them to be at multiple locations simultaneously. They are confident that their business will experience growth in the coming year with the help of Kiva lenders!

Working as a husband and wife team, Cindy and Ves created a mobile food tent which capitalized on their mutual love for South-East Asian food—in particular, pho or Vietnamese rice noodles.  Their shared passion for food instilled in them a desire to provide an experience defined by quality service and authentic delicious food. Although they both loved the idea of opening a food truck, they decided to start small with a food tent instead.  They have since been sharing their love of Pho at farmers markets throughout the San Diego area.

Financial capital has been the chief hurdle that Cindy and her husband have had to overcome.  Furthermore, Cindy shared that their biggest struggle is getting the word out about their unique, local food tent. Regardless of the obstacles, she says that they both enjoy the challenge and are committed to the long-term success of their business.

Cindy finds value and passion in partnering with the local community and giving back, explaining that she has a deep appreciation for a locally oriented, hospitable mindset. She hopes in the future that her business can continue to share a love of different cultures while working with the community.

loans.use: to purchase the equipment needed for an additional food tent

loans.name: Muvafe Group

texts.es:
El grupo Muvafe está en el 2º ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se unieron para poder mejorar sus vidas y poder ayudar a sus hijos.
Sergia es una de ellas, y se dedica a la elaboración de manualidades, termos forrados y otros,  y el crédito que pide lo utilizará para la compra de insumos varios, como pegamento, cuero, pinzas, hilos y demás. 
También se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones que hace a cada una de las integrantes del grupo. Todas quieren mejorar en la actividad que hacen.
texts.en:
The communal bank MUVAFE is in its second loan cycle.  All the members of the group joined together to improve their lifestyles and help their children.  Sergia is one of the members and she works making crafts, including covered thermos bottles.  The loan she is requesting is to buy supplies such as glue, leather, clips, thread and other items.

Worth mentioning is the hard work of the counselors who are continuously following up on the training and verification of the members in the group.  All of them want to improve their businesses.

loans.use: To buy glue, leather, clips, thread and other craft supplies.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is a 38-year-old married woman with three children. She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. Nora has requested a loan to buy chemicals, bush knives, a pickaxe, a digging stick, a shovel and a backpack sprayer. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. 

With her profits, Nora hopes to support her family and to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, bush knives, a pickaxe, a digging stick, a shovel and a backpack sprayer.

loans.name: Foloi

texts.en:
Foloi is a 52-year-old divorced woman with two children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. 

Foloi has requested a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, chemicals, bush-knives, a pickaxe, taro roots, a backpack sprayer and a tarpaulin. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. 

With her profits, Foloi hopes to improve her business and support her family.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, chemicals, bush-knives, a pickaxe, taro roots, a backpack sprayer and a tarpaulin

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of Milo, powdered milk (nido), candies, biscuits, bags of sugar and rice, thus aiding in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of tinned fish, tins of Milo, bags of rice, boxes of soap, and different kinds of canned drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy different sizes of used car tires and inner tubes for resale and to pay for electricity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bags of rice, local red rice, palm fruits, onions, and cartons of fish and meat.

loans.name: Pendyore

texts.en: Pendyore is 26 years old and married with 2 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as chicken, soy sauce, onions, rice, etc. She has been doing this for 4 years. Pendyore needs a loan to buy chicken, rice,  flour, noodles, mosquito coils, milk, soap, soft drinks and snacks. She hopes to use her profits to improve her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy chicken, rice,  flour, noodles, mosquito coils, milk, soap, soft drinks and snacks

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Kyrey  está en su 6to. ciclo  del programa de comité, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, mediante el cual podrán ir mejorando su situación de pobreza.
Lida, una integrante, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, y comenta que gracias a que siempre tiene muy buena variedad es que le está yendo muy bien, ya que se hizo de muy buena clientela.  Su meta es poder llegar a tener un negocio amplio y ahí poder hacer sus ventas y seguir trabajando por mejorar.
Pide hoy este préstamo ya que quiere invertirlo en la compra de cosméticos variados, con lo cual podrá seguir haciendo sus ventas.
texts.en:
The communal bank KUÑA KYREY is in its sixth loan cycle and all the members are committed to working and helping each other get ahead.  They form part of the poverty elimination program aimed at improving their situation.  

One of the members of the group is Lida who sells cosmetics.  She says that thanks to the fact that she always has a wide variety of products sales are going well and she has many customers.  Her goal is to expand her business, increase sales and continue working to prosper.

The loan she is requesting is to buy different cosmetics so she can continue with her sales activity.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi is a 25-year-old married woman with 3 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for 4 years. Naomi has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a weedsprayer, bush knives and a wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. With her profits, Naomi hopes to support her family and to save for unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a weedsprayer, bush knives and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Kalala

texts.en:
Kalala, a 52-year-old married mother of six, has a small garden where she grows cabbages, cucumbers and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for four years.

A member of SPBD since 2007, Kalala is requesting a loan to buy vegetable seeds, a rake, garden hose, wheelbarrow and gloves. 
She will use the profits from her sales to improve her business and help support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, a rake, garden hose, wheelbarrow and gloves.

loans.name: Faataualofa

texts.en:
Faataualofa is 33 years old and lives with her partner and two children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, yams and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for five years. Faataualofa needs a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, a backpack sprayer, bushknives, taro roots, and chemicals. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

 Faataualofa will use the profits from her sales to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, a backpack sprayer, bushknives, taro roots, and chemicals

loans.name: Rema

texts.en: Rema is a farmer in her village. She and her husband work hand and hand to develop their business. Rema hopes for smooth flow of her farming business to be able to give her family a better income and comfortable living situation. However, insufficiency of capital hampers the execution of her farming business. To make it run better, she is requesting additional capital amounting to PHP 12,000. This loan will be used to purchase farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides and pay  labor costs for transplanting seedlings to her farmland.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides and pay  labor costs

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
As a way of generating income, Agnes engages in the cooking and selling of meals and snacks within her community. She is 36 years old and has one school-age child. She aims to earn and save more income in order to satisfy her family's necessities and support the education of their child. 

Due to insufficient capital, Agnes is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000.00 to buy pork, dressed chicken, fish, vegetables and other ingredients needed in her food vending business. Through patience and hard work, she believes that she will be able to improve the business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy pork, dressed chicken, fish, vegetables and other ingredients needed  in her food vending business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn has a general store as her business. She is 38 years of age, married and has one child. Her husband works abroad as a company driver. 

Jocelyn started her business with direct-selling of beauty products in their village.
