When she got tired of doing her daily routine, which was house-to-house delivery of products she offered, she decided to manage a sari-sari store business where she could also display her cosmetic products. At present, she has low stocks of grocery items in her store due to crisis and most of her customers get the products on credit. So she is in need of additional capital amounting to 50,000 PHP to buy grocery items and mobile load to sell. She will do her best in managing the business to grow and prosper.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and mobile load to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena  owns and operates a retail business in the market to earn a living. She has been selling meat for many years and she earns well for the family and has successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC. She used that loan to improve her business. 

Currently, she has taken out a new loan to purchase more meat and other items to sell. In the future, she wants to make improvements on her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more meat and other items to sell

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El comité Oñondivepa se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní gracias a la iniciativa de una de las integrantes, quienes decidieron formar parte del programa. Todas las integrantes son feriantes y tienen un local bien equipado donde ofrecen sus productos de su propia producción como huevo, leche, queso, frutas, y todos los productos agrícolas. 
Ceferiana pide este préstamo para poder comprar huevo y leche, para poder venderlos en la feria y seguir trabajando
texts.en:
The Oñondivepa committee was formed when a number of neighbors from the city of Santaní joined forces. Thanks to the initiative of one of the members, they decided to join the program. Each member has a stall in a well-equipped facility where they sell their products which they produce themselves such as eggs, milk, cheese, fruit, and all kinds of agricultural products. 

Ceferiana is asking for this loan so that she may buy eggs and milk to sell at the market and continue working.

loans.use: to buy eggs and milk for sale

loans.name: Tuiga

texts.en:
Tuiga is 22 years old and single, with no children. To earn a living, she makes and sells 'elei lavalava' (painted fabric) and she has been doing this for two years.

Tuiga has requested a loan to buy materials, fabric paints, elei, carved board, and stencils. She plans to use her profits to improve her business. She joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials, fabric paints, elei, carved board, and stencils.

loans.name: Muia

texts.en:
Muia is 39 years old and married with three children. She makes and sells siapo, kava bowls, earrings, bangles, two-piece dresses, etc. to earn a living and has been doing this for three years.

Muia has requested a loan to buy materials, pandanus leaves, traditional tapa cloth, needles, chicken feathers and kava bowls. She plans to use her profits to improve her business and help her family with everyday needs and wants. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials, pandanus leaves, traditional tapa cloth, needles,  chicken feathers and kava bowls

loans.name: Lise

texts.en:
Lise is 51 years old and married with two children. She owns and operates a small store selling items such as milk, sugar, rice, flour, soap, etc. She has been doing this for 27 years.

Lise needs a loan to buy sugar, rice, flour, salt, boxes of tinned fish, tomato sauce, noodles, cooking oil, chop suey noodles, soy sauce, spaghetti, toilet paper and diapers. She hopes to use her profits to improve her business and support her family financially. She became a member of SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, flour, salt, boxes of tinned fish, tomato sauce, noodles, cooking oil, chop suey noodles, soy sauce, spaghetti, toilet paper and diapers

loans.name: Hector Gonzalo

texts.es:
El socio Hector se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de autopartes para carros,el socio ya tiene varios años y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de autopartes.El socio solicita el credito para comprar parabrisas,siliconas y llantas.

El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas
texts.en:
Hector continues to manages a business of selling automobile parts.  He has been in business for several years and is doing very well.  His dream is to expand his auto parts business.  

Hector is requesting a loan in order to buy windshields, silicone, and tires.  He appreciates the loan that has been provided and promises to complete his payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy windshields, silicone, and tires.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products like perfume, clothing for children, women, men, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, manure, seeds, weed-killer, and insecticides.

loans.name: Ernie

texts.en:
A hard-working farmer, named Ernie, is 31 years of age. He is a father of one child. 

Right now, Ernie is operating his rice field to improve his living conditions. Ernie is now asking for a loan, in the amount of PHP 15,000, to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for labor used to transplant his farmland.

Immediately, Ernie would like to sow his farmland and carefully monitor his crops in order to avail a higher net income for this coming harvest season. He hopes that lenders will grant his requested loan in order to save and secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer and pay for labor used to transplant his farmland.

loans.name: Neris Antonia

texts.es: Doña Neris es originaria de la ciudad de Estelí. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropa usada,la cual le ha permitido obtener mejores ingresos. Se siente agradecida con Kiva y MiCredito ya que ha logrado aumentar sus utilidades y ha podido salir adelante. Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar: Pacas de ropa usada. Con el fin de ofrecer una amplia variedad de ropa y expandir su negocio. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda porque aumentara su negocio y podrá seguir saliendo adelante.
texts.en:
Neris is originally from the city of Estelí. She is a shopkeeper and sells used clothing, which has allowed her to earn more money.

She is thankful for Kiva and MiCredito, since she has been able to increase her profits and continue to move forward.

She requests another loan to purchase packs of used clothing so that she can continue to offer a wide variety of clothing and expand her business. She hopes that the loan will be helpful so that she can grow her business and continue to move forward.

loans.use: to purchase packs of used clothing.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan de 36 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado de educación, está acompañado desde hace 18 años,  su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos y también le colabora al cliente en la agricultura, sus tres hijos aún viven con ellos en casa y ellos están estudiando; pero también le colaboran en el trabajo agrícola que desempeña.


Él se dedica  a la agricultura y la ganadería, se ha dedicado a esta actividad durante 25 años el trabajo agrícola se lo enseño su padre,  quien desde muy pequeño le enseño la labor de sembrar el maíz, el frijol el maicillo, las hortalizas entre otras actividades propias de la agricultura  y la ganadería la aprendió de puro oficio propio de comercialización  del ganado. Juan también tiene como fuente de ingreso el jornal que lo desempeña en las épocas que no tiene trabajo propio, el trabajo del cliente está 4 kilómetros de distancia, el horario de trabajo del cliente es de 9 horas diarias.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para pagar por el arrendamiento de la tierra para cultivar el maíz y el frijol también lo utilizara en poder limpiar y surcar la tierra donde sembrara,  el préstamo le ha asegurara el terreno donde sembrara en la temporada que ya se acerca, la necesidad a satisfacer será la de tener el lugar donde el cliente podrá seguir cultivando el sustento de la familia y así poder  asegurar la alimentación de su familia.

Su sueño para su negocio, es un día comprar su propio terreno  para cultivar,  todos los años  se ve en la necesidad de arrendar  terreno para cultivar, y para su familia ahorita tiene un sueño y es que sus hijos estudien una carrera universitaria y se puedan graduar de algo que a ellos les guste.
texts.en:
Juan is 36 years old. He studied until the third grade. He has been married for 18 years, and his wife is a homemaker and helps him with agriculture. Their three children live at home with them and they are in school. They also help with agriculture.

He makes a living with agriculture and ranching. He has been doing this for 25 years. He learned to farm from his father, who taught him at a young age how to grow corn, beans, sorghum, and vegetables, as well as other activities related to agriculture. He taught himself the ranching business by selling cattle. Juan also earns income as a day laborer, which he does during the seasons where he does not have his own work to do. His job is located 4 kilometers away, and he works for 9 hours per day.

The loan that he is requesting will be used to pay rent on the land where he grows corn and beans. He will also use it to clear and plow the land. The loan will help him to secure the land where he will grow his crops in the upcoming season. He will be able to have a place to continue growing crops to sustain his family so that he can assure that his family will have the proper nutrition.

His dream for his business is to one day purchase his own land on which to grow crops. So far, he has needed to rent land to farm. Now, he has a dream for his family, which is for his children to go to college, graduate, and become what they want to be.

loans.use: to rent the land where he grows corn and beans, and to clear and plow the land.

loans.name: Ana Dermidia

texts.es:
Ana de 36 años de edad, es abogado y notario,  está casada desde hace 9 años, el esposo es comerciante.  Trabaja en el municipio donde vive,  tienen en común 1 hijo el cual tiene 5 años de edad, vive con ellos aun y estudia parvularia.

En casa del cliente viven 4 personas incluyéndola a ella, pues también comparte el domicilio con la suegra quien se dedica a  los oficios domésticos en el hogar.  

Ella posee una farmacia desde hace 19 años, ya que su padre de ella le enseño a manejarlo, es un negocio de familia que viene trascendiendo desde hace 60 años y hoy en día es Ana quien lo administra.

Decide dedicarse a esto, porque aunque tiene una carrera universitaria el área donde vive no es demandada la profesión que ella tiene y prefiere dedicarse al comercio. Como su profesión, lo permite cuando tiene la oportunidad ella hace trabajos propios de abogacía esto le permite tener un ingreso adicional.

El negocio le queda a una distancia de  21 kilómetros que diariamente recorre en bus,  para llegar el horario de trabajo de la cliente es de 12 horas al día. 

 Con el préstamo que esta solicitando, comprara  medicamentos para surtir el negocio, ella en su negocio vende de todo tipo de medicamento para la salud humana y desea mejorar el inventario con nuevas y mejores medicinas que son demandados en el municipio donde tiene su negocio, esto vendrá a beneficiar a la gente y mejorara los ingresos de la cliente.

Ella sueña con dos cosas importantes en su vida, una de ellas es formar su propio bufete de abogados y desempeñar  la labor que le gusta;  pero además desea seguir manteniendo el negocio familiar que por tantos años le ha proveído de sus necesidades desea ampliarlo y llevarlo a los niveles más grandes.

Para su familia desea que su hijo y su familia estén en las mejores condiciones y trabajar fuerte para lograrlo.
texts.en:
Ana, 36, is a lawyer and notary. She has been married for 9 years, and her husband is a retailer. She works in the city where she lives. They have a son who is currently five years old. He lives with them and is in nursery school. There are four people in her house, including her, since they also share the home with her mother-in-law, who takes care of the home.

Ana has had a pharmacy for 19 years. Her father taught her how to run it. It's a family business that has been passed down for 60 years and today, Ana manages it. She works in this sector because, although she has a university degree, her profession is not in demand in their area, and she prefers to work in retail. When she has the opportunity, she does legal work, which allows her to have an extra income. 

Her business is 21 kilometers away, a distance that she travels every day on the bus. She works 12 hours a day. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy medicines to stock her business. She sells all kinds of medicines for people's health and she wants to improve her inventory with new and improved medicines that are in demand in the area where her business is located. This will benefit the people and bring her more income. She has two important dreams for her life. One of them is to start her own law firm and do the work that she likes. But she also wants to maintain the family business that has provided for her needs for so many years. She wants to expand it and take it to a higher level. As for her family, she wants her son and family to live in the best conditions and she wants to work hard to achieve this.

loans.use: to buy medicines to stock her business

loans.name: Sau

texts.en: Sau is 26 years old, married and the mother of three children. She has a small farm where she grows taro and banana that she can sell in her neighborhood or at the local market. She has been doing this for five years and is requesting this loan to buy a weed-sprayer, chemicals, bush knives and spades. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012 and plans to use the profits from her sales to support her family and to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a weed sprayer, pesticides, bush knives and spades.

loans.name: Kilifi

texts.en:
Rasela is 53 years old, married, and has six children. She makes and sells kava bowls, table mats, Samoan fans, etc., which she has been doing for three years.

Rasela is requesting a loan from SPBD, which she will use to buy rolls of pandanus (a fiber made from screw-pine leaves), materials, kava bowls, earrings, and Samoan bangles. She plans to use her profits to improve her business. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to purchase rolls of pandanus, materials, kava bowls, earrings, and Samoan bangles

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina owns and operates a general store selling  various products to earn a living. She has been doing it for six years, and she earns well for the family. To add to her income, she is trying another line of business, weaving nipa (palm frond) leaves into mats to resell and has been doing that for more than a year. 

In 2009, Josefina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She had her previous loan that she used in buying goods for her retail store and she has successfully repaid it. Currently, she has taken out a new loan to buy additional palm leaves.  In the future, Josefina wants to build a house and to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy additional palm leaves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase food items for her restaurant.

loans.name: Brendalee

texts.en: Due to financial insufficiency, Brendalee works at cooking and selling pork and chicken barbecue in her community.She is 50 years old and has six children. She aims to improve her business so she can increase her income to help her husband in financing the education of her children and satisfy their daily needs. In this regard, she is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy pork, chicken heads and feet, hot dogs and seasonings to be cooked and sold in the community. She is hoping that her loan will enable her to further improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy pork, chicken heads and feet, hot dogs and seasonings to cook and sell

location.town: Brgy. Munguia,Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
El grupo Rosa Mística  está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité, es de la ciudad de Concepción, la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aún se encuentra en crecimiento. Es una zona de difícil acceso, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente y que vayan creciendo lentamente.
La Sra.  Del Pilar es una de las integrantes, quien se dedica a la venta de comidas, que ella misma hace, y que sale a vender de forma ambulante. Es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que se está esforzando por poder mejorar su vida y las condiciones de su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para hacer comidas, como ser carne, verduras, hortalizas. Y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
texts.en:
The Rosa Mística group is in its first cycle in the program. It is from the city of Concepción which is somewhat isolated from the downtown area but is still growing. It is a region that is difficult to reach, so the members of this group want to fight to continue to grow and improve the environment where they live as they slowly grow.

Mrs. Del Pilar is one of the members and she sells food that she makes herself. She sells by going door to door.  She is a hard-working and enterprising woman who is trying hard to improve her life and her family's living conditions. She is asking for this loan to buy the ingredients for the food she sells such as meat, greens, and vegetables. In this way she will be able to continue to grow her business and give her family what it needs to have a life without hardship.

loans.use: to buy meat, greens, and vegetables to make food for sale

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es:
Maria tiene 57 años de edad vive en Union Libre tiene dos hijos, vive la esposa u con los hijos vive en el Canton Mocache Perteneciente a la Provicncia de los Rios. 

La ventanilla se llama 27 DE OCTUBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Sara Guerrero, perteneciente al Canton Mocache se dedican a labores Agricolas y Pecuarias. 

Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz. Las compras las realiza en Mocache en la feria de los dias Jueves. Con el dinero ha podido cubrir algunas necesidades como el pago de la mano de obra y adquirir algunos insumos. Enfrenta desafios como la competencia y el clima que no ayuda mucho.

El credito solicito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos semillas liquidos para la maleza y liquidos para matar los insectos. La meta es tener dinero para comprar un terreno para seguir trabajando en la agricultura. En el tiempo libre le gusta escuchar musica.
texts.en:
Maria is 57 years old, is in a common-law relationship and has two children. They live in Mocache canton, part of Los Rios province. She belongs to the "27 DE OCTUBRE" communal bank which is located in Sara Guerrero village, Mocache canton. The members work in agriculture and raise animals. 

Maria grows corn. She buys her goods in Mocache at the Thursday market. With the money from the loan she can pay a few necessities like paying for labor and buying some supplies. Her challenges are the competition and the weather which doesn't help very much. 

With the loan Maria will buy fertilizer, seeds, fungicides and insecticides. Her goal is to have the money to buy a plot of land and continue to work in agriculture. She likes to listen to music in her spare time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, fungicides and insecticides.

loans.name: Taotafa

texts.en: Taotafa is 58 years old, married and the mother of three children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, bananas and other produce that she can sell in her community or at the local market. She has been doing this for two years and is requesting this loan to buy fertilizer, bush knives, weed killer, axes and rakes. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011 and will use the profits from her sales to expand her business and support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Falanika

texts.en:
Falanika is a 37-year-old, widowed woman with four children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro, taamu, yams, and bananas, that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for more than three years. 

Falanika needs a loan to buy chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes, and rakes. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2011. Falanika will use the profits from her sales to improve her plantation, support her family, and support her children's education, as well.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes, and rakes.

loans.name: Sefulutasi

texts.en: Sefulutasi is 40 years old and married with one child. She makes and sells elei lavalava (handpainted cloth skirts) to earn a living and has been doing this for three years. Sefulutasi has requested a loan to buy materials, fabric color paints, brushes, paint rollers, stencils and elei carved board. She plans to use her profits to improve her business. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials, fabric color paints, brushes, paint rollers, stencils and elei carved board

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, a gallon of oil, tinned tomatoes, a crate of eggs, and a carton of fish

loans.name: Sophany

texts.en:
Sophany, 46, is married and a mother of six children. She lives with her spouse and three unmarried children in her own home while the other children are married and live separately in Prey Veng province. Sophany, together with her husband, is engaged in a farming business. She currently cultivates about one hectare of rice paddy and is able to earn approximately USD 3.66 per day.

As this is her first loan, Sophany aims to invest in the purchase of a solar panel system to install on the top roof of her house, which is located in the off-grid area of the province. After this initial investment, Sophany will be able to gain access to clean energy, which she uses to support household appliances such as lights, TV and radio, so everyone in her family can work or study even at night. This is thanks to the green loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL).

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of a solar panel system to install on the top roof of her house, which is located in the off-grid area of the province.

loans.name: Silivia

texts.en: Silivia is a 49-year-old married woman with four children. She has a small farm where she grows cabbage, tomatoes, cucumbers and beans to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years, and is requesting a loan to buy farm supplies, including seeds, fertilizers, bush knives and a rake. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012 and hopes to use her profits to add to her savings and support her family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase charcoal, kerosene, cassava dough, and canned tomatoes

loans.name: Henrietta

texts.en: Henrietta is 21 years old and married with two children. She wants to start a small business making and selling chips in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy a kerosene oven, a frying pan, containers, dripping oil and salt. In the future, Henrietta hopes to improve her business and support her family financially. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a kerosene oven, a frying pan, containers, dripping oil and salt

loans.name: Mark Gil

texts.en: Mark Gil is studying Computer Hardware Services at C-LAN Institute of Technology. He had a part time job harvesting lemons to earn an extra income that he would use for his needs. He joined GDMPC and had borrowed a loan to pay for the school tuition fees for the second semester. He is hopeful to become successful in his studies to be able to help his family and community.

loans.use: to pay for school tuition fees

loans.name: Sofarania

texts.en: Sofarania is 33 years old and married with six children. She owns and operates a small store, selling daily consumption items such as rice, flour, sugar, salt, chicken legs, mutton flaps etc. She has been doing this for five years. Sofarania needs a loan to buy a bag of sugar, a bag of rice, a bag of flour, salt and a freezer. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business and to save for unexpected emergencies. She became a member of SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a bag of sugar, a bag of rice, a bag of flour, salt and a freezer

loans.name: Iulia

texts.en: Iulia is 25 years old, single and the mother of two children. She has a small farm where she grows taro, yams, bananas and other items to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than four years and is requesting this loan to buy fertilizer, knives, weedkiller, axes and rakes. She has been a member of SBPD since 2009  and plans to use her profits to expand her business so that she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Yeny Carolina

texts.es:
Yeny de 26 años de edad,  estudio hasta quinto grado de educación. Es madre soltera tiene un hijo quien vive en casa de ella aun no estudia, tiene 3 años de edad.

En casa del cliente viven cuatro personas 2 hermanas,  las cuales se dedican al comercio individual en la misma comunidad,  también viven sus padres los cuales se dedican a la agricultura todos dependen de sí mismo porque todos trabajan, de la cliente dependen nada más su hijo.


Ella administra su propio cafetín, en la misma comunidad donde vive,  tiene 6 años de tenerlo. el negocio lo aprendió sola un día decidió poner un puesto de venta en la comunidad, porque observo que no habían tiendas y la gente buscaba productos que solo en la ciudad se pueden conseguir, entonces decide un día comprar artículos de primera necesidad para vender y es así como puso su puesto de venta, el negocio de la cliente está cerca de su casa camina 2 cuadras para llagar y va a la ciudad a traer mercadería 3 veces por semana recorre 35 kilómetros, para acercarlos hasta su casa cuando la cliente no puede estar en el negocio también le apoya una hermana de ella, su horario de trabajo es de 12 horas al día de lunes a domingo.


Comprará con el préstamo productos de primera necesidad para la venta como  jabón, detergentes, papel higiénico, arroz, frijol, etc. El préstamo mejorara su vida porque tendrá la oportunidad de vender más y podrá satisfacer algunas necesidades que tiene su hijo y cubrir necesidades puntuales en su casa.
La necesidad  a satisfacer será cubrir la demanda que tiene en la comunidad  y ampliar su negocio 

Sus sueños son hacer crecer su negocio, comprando nuevos productos para la venta y que la gente necesita.
Para su familia desea ver que se superen con esfuerzo y trabajo porque es la única manera, desea que su hijo crezca en un  ambiente sano, estudie y desea ayudarlos a que alcancen sus sueños. El préstamo le ayudara a surtir de mejor manera su negocio y cubrir la demanda que tiene dentro de la comunidad  y pretende ampliar su negocio poniendo un puesto de venta, en la ciudad para tener una mejor ampliación de su negocio.
texts.en:
Yeny is 26 and has studied up to fifth grade. She is a single mother and she has one child, who lives at home with her. He does not yet go to school as he is only 3. Four people live in the house: two sisters and their parents. Both sisters are involved in individual businesses in the same community, and their parents work in agriculture. They all support themselves because everybody is in work and only the child is dependent on Yeny.

Yeny has managed her own snack stand for 6 years n the same community where she lives. She learnt the business herself and one day decided to set up a sales stand in the community because she noticed that there were no shops and that people were looking for goods they could only get hold of in the city. Then one day she decided to buy basic products to sell, and this was how she set up her sales stand. Her business is close to her house - she just has to walk 2 blocks to get there. Three times a week she goes to the city 35 km away to buy goods and bring them home. When she can't be at her business her sister also helps her. Yeny works 12 horas a day from Monday to Sunday.

With the loan Yeny intends to buy basic goods for sale such as soap, detergent, toilet paper, rice and beans. The loan will improve her life because she will have the opportunity to sell more and to be able to meet her son's needs and as well as covering basic household requirements in a timely fashion. There is a need to satisfy demand in the community and grow her business. Her dream is to expand her business by purchasing new products for sale that people need. She wants to see her family get ahead by using effort and hard work, as this is the only way. She wants her son to grow up in a healthy environment and to go to school, and she wants to help everyone to realise their dreams. The loan will help her to stock her business better and meet existing community demand. She intends to broaden her business by establishing a sales stall in the city.

loans.use: to buy basic products for sale such as soap, detergent, toilet paper, rice and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock her cafe and buy supplies to prepare food, candy, and refreshments.

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
Juan, a sus 37 años de edad, es casado y padre de 3 hijos por quienes lucha día a día para sacarlos adelante.
Desde pequeño se involucró en el oficio de reciclador y cuando creció obtuvo empleo en el oficio, en el que aprendió el manejo de esta labor y un tiempo después le sirvió para independizarse.  Actualmente trabaja solo y cuenta con la ventaja de tener diversos clientes a los que les compra excedentes industriales, equipos de oficina y otros productos que los revende y genera utilidades para solventar los gastos básicos de su hogar.
El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de excedentes industriales, equipos de oficina, hierro, cobre y cartón, productos que luego revenderá a un mejor precio y podrá adquirir mayor nivel de ingresos.
Juan manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es tener la capacidad para salir adelante en compañía de su familia y lograr una estabilidad económica que le permita seguir dando educación a sus hijos para que sean personas idóneas y se forjen un futuro exitoso en el futuro.
texts.en:
Juan is 37 years old, married, and father to three children, whom he works hard for each day to help them get ahead.

Since he was little he has been involved in the recycling business. When he grew up he became employed in the profession, from which he learned about the trade. After a while, he was able to work independently. He currently works alone and relies on the advantage of having various clients from whom he purchases industrial surplus, office equipment, and other products that he resells and generates earnings to afford the basic costs of living.

The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase industrial surplus, office equipment, iron, copper, and cardboard, products that he will later resell at a higher price which will increase his earnings.

Juan reveals that his greatest wish is to be able to get ahead with his family and achieve financial stability, which will allow him to continue giving an education to his children so that they become well-rounded people and have a successful future.

loans.use: to purchase industrial surplus, office equipment, iron, copper, and cardboard.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
Actualmente Leticia vive con sus padres, está trabajando y tiene muchas ganas de superarse como profesional. Gracias al apoyo de sus padres fue logrando sus objetivos y metas. Está estudiando la carrera de post grado en didáctica universitaria, con lo cual quiere poder cumplir su meta de ser un profesional exitoso.
Pide de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas, que le permitirá cubrir ese gasto y seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Leticia currently lives with her parents.  She is working, and she has a great desire to succeed as a professional.  Thanks to her parents’ support, she has been achieving her objectives and goals.

She is studying for a post graduate degree in teaching.  With this she wants to be able to reach her goal of being a successful professional.

She is requesting this loan in order to be able to make her payments.  This will allow her to cover this expense and to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to make university payments.

loans.name: Elida

texts.es:
Elida viene de una familia humilde y muy trabajadora, sus padres son empleados públicos, ella comenta que su aspiración es terminar  su carrera y comenzar a trabajar en forma independiente y ser una profesional muy destacada en su ramo.
Está estudiando para ser una excelente contadora que pueda ayudar a las demás personas por medio de los conocimientos que adquiera en sus estudios.
Pide de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de clases y también para cubrir sus gastos de transporte. Agradece también por esta ayuda que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
Elida is from a modest and hard-working family. Her parents are public employees. She comments that she wants to finish her studies and start to work for herself and become a distinguished professional in her field.

Elida is studying to become an excellent accountant who can help others through her knowledge acquired in her studies. She is requesting this loan to invest in the costs of her classes and also to cover the cost of transportation. She is grateful for the support she is receiving.

loans.use: to pay for classes and transportation.

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es:
Yessica es separada,  trabaja en  un negocio familiar con su madre, son comerciantes y se dedican a la venta de todo tipos de ropas y calzados en general  hace más de 3 años.
Ella es también estudiante de la carrera de Derecho, ya que su principal sueño es poder ser una profesional exitosa y que pueda ayudar a los demás. Solicito el préstamo para el pago de cuotas  y  el título ya que está rindiendo sus últimos exámenes y tiene que gestionar su título.  Su aspiración es seguir enriqueciendo sus conocimientos profesionales recibirse y ejercer su profesión
texts.en:
Yessica is separated. She works in a family business with her mother. They are businesspeople who have been selling all kinds of clothing and footwear for the past 3 years. She is also a Law student. Her main dream is to become a successful professional who can help others.

Yessica is requesting a loan to pay for tuition and her graduation certificate as she is taking her final exams and she has to arrange to get her degree. Her goal is to continue expanding her professional knowledge and work in her profession.

loans.use: to pay for tuition and school fees.

loans.name: Horongna Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe HORONGNA ont en moyenne  54 ans, 6 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies     dans la ville de BLA dans la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente de condiments et autres.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe HORONGNA sont à leur  2  eme   prêt solidaire. BANA 1ère femme à  la gauche  sur la photo  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  des parures (20 paires de boucle d’oreilles, 15  chaines pour le  cou et poignets en aluminium, 20 bracelets en caoutchouc. Elle s’approvisionne à BAMAKO. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé et  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Horongna Group are all around 54 years old, and have an average of six children.  They live in traditional, extended families in the town of Bla, in the fourth-largest, administrative region of the republic of Mali.

The women know one another through family ties, and all buy and sell foodstuffs and various other products.

This will be the second group loan for the women, the first loan was correctly repaid.

Bana (on the far left of the photo) will use her loan to buy personal adornment items (20 pairs of earrings, 15 aluminium neck and wrist chains and 20 rubber bracelets.  She buys her stock in Bamako, and sells it to both men and women, for cash or on credit.

Bana expects to earn a monthly average of 30,000 francs CFA, which she will use to cover healthcare expenses, food expenses, school fees and the rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy personal adornment items for resale.

loans.name: Solidario Sembradoras De Sacatepequez Group

texts.es:
solidario sembradoras de Sacatepéquez 
Este solidario está formado por doña Odilia, Ella tiene 54 años de edad y se dedica, a la agricultura y su principal actividad es siembra de ejote, arveja, shuchini, brócoli y zanahoria , ella está solicitando el crédito para la inversión de siembra de shuchini y arveja, compra de insecticida y bactericida para su cultivo, así como abono foliar, para que sus productos tengan una buena calidad ese es su deseo,esperando en Dios y en ustedes que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
The Solidario Sembradoras de Sacatepéquez group was formed by Doña Odilia. She is 54 years old and works in agriculture. Her main activity is planting green beans, peas, zucchinis, broccoli, and carrots. She is requesting the loan to invest in planting zucchini and peas and to buy insecticide and bactericide for cultivation, as well as foliar fertilizer, so that her products have the good quality that she desires.

She is hoping that God and you can help her with the requested loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for cultivating

loans.name: Seneuefa

texts.en: Seneuefa is a 65-year-old widow with seven children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as chicken, sugar, rice, salt, soap, mosquito coils, etc. She has been doing this for 3 years. Seneuefa needs a loan to buy a new freezer, tin boxes, fish, chicken, noodles, milk, soap, toilet paper, and flour. She hopes to use her profits to extend her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2006 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a new freezer, tin boxes, fish, chicken, noodles, milk, soap, toilet paper, and flour.

loans.name: Kilisitina

texts.en:
Kilisitina is a 43 year old woman who is married with 7 children.  She has a taxi business.  She has 2 years experience with this business.

Kilisitina needs a loan to buy a vehicle front windscreen and new tires.  She will use her profits to improve her business.  She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy vehicle front windscreen and new tires.

loans.name: Vegie

texts.en: Vegie is studying at Stella Maris College in Oroquieta City, taking his B.S. in Accountancy course. According to him, ambition is the path to success. He used his previous loan from GDMPC to cover the costs for his school expenses this school year. Recently, Vegie borrowed a new loan to cover the costs for school and miscellaneous expenses for this semester. In the future, Vegie wants to improve the general living situation of his entire family.

loans.use: to cover the costs for school and miscellaneous expenses

loans.name: Sulesa

texts.en: Sulesa is 33 years old, married and the mother of four children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro, yams, bananas and other items to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than four years and is requesting this loan to buy fertilizer, knives, weedkiller, axes and rakes. She has been a member of SBPD since 2009 and plans to use her profits to improve her business to so that she can provide more support to her family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Nereyda Marily

texts.es:
Nereyda de 29 años de edad, esta casada su esposo le ayuda económicamente para mantener a sus hijos, él trabaja de jornalero,tienen dos hijos de 2 y 10 años de edad respectivamente,  solo uno estudia quinto grado en total viven cuatro en casa propia.


Ella administra  un comedor,vende desayunos, almuerzos y cenas el negocio lo tiene hace un año y lo inicio debido a la necesidad de darles la alimentación a sus hijos y el estudio,antes de poner el negocio de comida pasaba en casa elaborando los quehaceres del hogar,donde esta el comedor no esta muy lejos de su casa ; se levanta a las cuatro de la  mañana por el hecho que los clientes llegan muy temprano a desayunar.

 
El préstamo lo utilizara para darles mejor atención a sus clientes y comprar los materiales necesarios para cada día como carnes, pollo, arroz, aceite y utensilios como;cacerolas,cucharas,vasos,tenedores y pintar el local para que se vea mas presentable y una nevera para tener productos helados.

El sueño mas grande seria que sus hijos crezcan y poder darles el estudio para que ellos puedan trabajar y puedan sostenerse por si solos y eso requiere mantener siempre el negocio estable  y tener mas clientes y por supuesto mejores ganancias eso le ayudara a cancelar a tiempo sus cuotas y estar al día con credicampo.
texts.en:
Nereyda , 29 years old, is married. Her husband helps her economically to support their children. He works as a laborer. They have two children ages two and ten. Only one studies and is in the fifth grade. The four of them live in their own house.

She manages a restaurant selling breakfast, lunch and dinner. She has had the business for a year and started it due to the need of providing food and education to her children. Before starting the food business, she does household chores. The kitchen is not very far from the house. She wakes up at four in the morning as her customers arrive very early for breakfast.

She will use the loan to give better service to her customers and to buy the necessary daily materials like beef, chicken, rice, oil, and utensils such as pans, spoons, glasses, forks. She will also use it towards painting the restaurant so that it will be more presentable and for a freezer to have ice cream products.

Her greatest dream is that her children will grow up and she will be able to give them an education so that they can work and sustain themselves which requires always keeping the business stable and having more customers and of course better income. That will help her to remove time from her payments and keep up to date with credicampo.

loans.use: to buy the daily material necessary like beef, chilcken, rice, oil and utensils such as pans, spoons, glasses, forks, to paint the shop so that it is more presentable, and for a freezer in  order to have ice cream products.

loans.name: Ell Freeborge

texts.en:
Ell Freeborge is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration at Misamis University in Oroquieta City. Ell Freeborge helped his parents find ways to support his education. He used his previous loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to pay the school tuition fees for his first semester. 

Currently, he is borrowing a new loan  for his second semester tuition fees and other expenses. He hopes to finish his study and be able to find a job that fits his qualifications in the near future.

loans.use: to pay for his second semester tuition fees and other expenses.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina owns and manages a general store, selling assorted grocery goods and ready-to-wear products to resell. She has been doing this for six years, earning well for the family. She was able to successfully repay her previous loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC), which she had used in purchasing some stocks of items. 

Recently, Gina borrowed a new loan to purchase additional ready-to-wear products and school supplies to resell. She plans to develop her business, for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase additional RTWs and school supplies to resell.

loans.name: Felecitas

texts.en:
For a living, Felecitas helps her husband in operating their own farm. She has been doing this for more than 11 years, earning well for the family's needs. She used her previous loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to buy fertilizer and she had successfully repaid the loan. 

Recently, Felecitas borrowed a new loan to buy fertilizer and organic pesticides. She always find ways to augment her living, to have a better living situation in the near future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and organic pesticides.

loans.name: Leonia

texts.en: Leonia is a 19-year-old single woman with no children. She makes and sells ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has 2 years of experience with this business. Leonia needs a loan to purchase bags of sugar, cordial, a box of foam cups, freezer, etc., to help her in operating her business. She plans to use her profits to extend her business and to support her family. Leonia has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar, cordial, a box of foam cups, freezer, etc.

loans.name: Fetaiai

texts.en: Fetaiai is a 57-year-old woman who is married with 4 children. She runs a small sewing business in her community. She has many years of experience with this business. Fetaiai has requested a loan to buy materials, a sewing machine, timber, nails, cements, and iron roofing. She plans to use her profits to improve her housing and pay for her children's school fees. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, timber, nails, cements, and iron roofing.

loans.name: Mari

texts.en: Mari is a 37-year-old married woman with 4 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. Mari has requested a loan to buy bush knives, a backpack sprayer, chemicals, a pickaxe, and wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Mari hopes to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy bush knives, a backpack sprayer, chemicals, a pickaxe, and wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Rasela

texts.en:
Rasela is 40 years old, married, and has six children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and banana that she sells in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for five years. 

Rasela is requesting a loan from SBPD, which she will use to buy a weed sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, and spades. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. Rasela will use the profits from her sales to support her family and to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase a weed sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, and spades

loans.name: Dúo Alejandra De Vista Hermosa Group

texts.es:
DÚO ALEJANDRA DE VISTA HERMOSA 
La señora Juana Feliciana , quien se dedica a la venta de ropa típica como güipiles, cortes , fajas , blusas típicas y también blusas de tela. Cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su esposo quien la ayuda en todo momento y sus dos hijos quienes conforman su familia. Su sueño es tener un local grande donde vender su mercadería ya que por el momento es vendedora ambulante. tiene varios pedidos de trajes típicos pero el dinero no le alcanza y por tal motivo necesita un préstamo para no quedarles mal a sus clientes.esperando que ustedes le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
Alejandra Duo of Vista Hermosa

Señora Juana Feliciana works selling traditional clothing such as güipils [embroidered, flowing blouses], woven skirts, woven belts, traditional blouses, and also fabric blouses.  She counts on the unconditional support of her husband who helps her all the time, and her two children who also make up her family.

Her dream is to have a large shop where she sells her merchandise because right now she is a mobile vendor.  She has a number of orders for traditional outfits, but the money won’t stretch to cover the cost, and so she needs a loan so as to not leave her customers in the lurch.  She hopes that you can help with the requested loan.

loans.use: to buy new clothing to sell.

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Denis

texts.es:
Denis tiene un negocio de venta y reparación de celulares, donde le esta yendo muy bien, ya que gracias al servicio que ofrece a sus clientes se esta haciendo conocido y crece mas y mas. Comenta que su crédito anterior de Kiva lo uso para comprar carcasas, accesorios, estuches, repuestos y demás, que le permitió poder seguir creciendo y mejorando.
Pide de este nuevo crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de accesorios, repuestos, baterías, etc., que le permitirá poder seguir trabajando y luchando por mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Denis has a business of selling and repairing cell phones.  It is going very well for him.  Thanks to the service he offers his customers, he is becoming well-known and is growing more and more.

He says that he used his previous Kiva loan to buy covers, accessories, cases, replacement parts, and others.  This allowed him to continue growing and improving.

He is requesting this new loan in order to buy accessories, replacement parts, and batteries, etc.  This will allow him to continue working and struggling to improve his income.

loans.use: to buy accessories, replacement parts, and batteries, etc.

loans.name: Sase

texts.en:
Sase is a 53-year-old married woman with nine children. She owns and operates a business sewing puletasi and other items. She has four years of experience in this line of business.

Sase needs a loan to buy a sewing machine, threads, needles, and materials. She joined SPBD in 2013.

She hopes to use her profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials, thread, needles, and scissors

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 36 years old and married with five children. She runs a small business selling barbeque in her community and has been doing this for three years.

Rosa has requested a loan to buy mutton flaps, sausages, tomato sauce, potatoes, rice, foam plates, soy sauce, garlic, onions, foil, and gas. She joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2009 to gain access to capital. 

With her earnings, Rosa will support her family and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy mutton flaps, sausages, tomato sauce, potatoes, rice, foam plates, soy sauce, garlic, onions, foil, and gas.

loans.name: Taeao

texts.en:
Taeao is 32 years old and married with 4 children.  She has a small plantation where she grows taro and banana that she can sell in her community or at the market.  She has been doing this for 5 years. 

Taeao needs a loan to buy a weed-sprayer, chemicals, bush knives and spades.  She has been a member of SBPD since 2012.  Taeao will use the profits from her sales to support her family and to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a weedsprayer, chemicals, bush knives and spades

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of cosmetics, shoes, and clothes.

loans.name: Savaliga

texts.en:
Savaliga is 52 years old and married with 2 children.  She runs a small business selling ice cake in her community and has been doing this for 2 years.

Savaliga has requested a loan to buy a new freezer, Tang, cordial, foam cups and plastic bags.  She joined SPBD in 2007 to gain access to capital.  With her earnings, Savaliga will help her family everyday needs and wants.

loans.use: to buy a new freezer, Tang, cordial, foam cups and plastic bags

loans.name: Von

texts.en:
Von is 30 years old and has three little children.  He is the main breadwinner for his family.  Aside from managing farming activities, Von is also engaged in fishing and selling fish for additional income.  He owns a boat and fishing materials such as nets, hooks and lines, which he uses every day for fishing. Through his effort and perseverance, Von is able to provide enough food and meet the family’s needs. 

Since his fishing materials have been used for a long time and ruined for some reason, Von would like to borrow a loan to buy new fishing materials to support his business.  With this loan amount, he hopes to continue his business in a sustainable way, and continue working to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new fishing materials to support his business.

loans.name: Misael Ángel

texts.es:
Misael de 32 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado de básica, está soltero no tiene hijos solo su mamá depende de él en un 50 % por que le ayudan sus otros hijos, pues solo él vive en la casa con su mamá los demás viven aparte.


Misael el negocio al cual se dedica es la siembra de maíz en invierno y verano de regadillo, por lo que se dedica más de regadillo que es más segura, esto lo ha perfeccionado en sus ocho años que tiene de sembrar, el trabajadero le queda a dos kilómetros de la casa, viaja en bicicleta todos los días ya que le dedica cuatro horas de trabajo todos los días desde que empieza a preparar la tierra,  son cuatro meses sin despegar por cosecha.
 
El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar abono, pagar por que la maquina le rastralle la tierra y pagar mano de obra calificada para la aradura con bueyes. Si logra sembrar los 14,000 metros cuadrados de milpa será un año con esperanzas de tener unos mejores ingresos.

En el futuro, planea  ser independiente para cultivar y que si saca préstamo sea para cultivar más de lo que actualmente hace, quiere ser auto sostenible y tener todo lo necesario en el hogar ya que su mamá cada día va necesitando más recursos debido a su edad  y quiere darle a su madre lo mejor enseñar que con poco se puede hacer mucho y más por una madre.
texts.en:
Misael is 32 years old. He studied until sixth grade. He is single with no children. His mother depends on Misael for half [of what she needs] because her other children help her. He is the only one who lives in the house with his mother; the others live separately. Misael makes a living through the farming of corn in winter and irrigated crops in the summer. He focuses more on irrigated crops because it is more secure. He has perfected this in his eight years of farming. Misael's land is located two kilometers from the house. He travels by bicycle every day. Now he works four hours per day, every day. Since he is starting to prepare the land, there are four mouths without harvesting. 

The loan he is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to buy fertilizer, pay for the machine that tills the land and pay for hired labor qualified to plow with oxen. If he succeeds in farming the 14,000 square meters of maize it will be a year with hopes of having some better income. In the future, he plans to be independent so that he may farm. If he takes out a loan, it would be to grow more than what he does right now. Misael wants to be self-sufficient and have everything they need in the home now that his mother needs more support every day due to her age. He wants to give his mother the best to show that with a little bit, a lot and more can be done for a mother.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pay for the machine that tills the land and pay for hired labor qualified to plow with oxen.

loans.name: Hope

texts.en: Hope is a repeat client who lives in Rwashamaire, Ntungamo district.  Her major activity is mobile money.  She applied for a loan of one million Uganda shillings.  She is a single mother with one child.  Her mobile money float is small yet she has many clients who come for withdrawing, but the challenge is capital and so she approached us for a loan to increase her float so that she can improve her service delivery.  In the photo is Hope with the Ugafode credit officer.

loans.use: To increase capital for the mobile money

loans.name: Mougnou Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe MOUGNOU ont en moyenne  40 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies     dans la ville de BLA dans la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente de condiments, des poissons fumés et de la restauration.
Les femmes du groupe MOUGNOU sont à leur  2ème   prêt solidaire. RABIATOU1ère femme  assise à la gauche sur la photo  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  des paniers de poissons fumés. Elle s’approvisionne à BLA avec les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Mougnou Group are all around 40 years old, and have an average of four children.  They live in traditional, extended families in the town of Bla, in the fourth-largest, administrative region of the republic of Mali.

The women know one another through family ties, and buy and sell foodstuffs and smoked fish, and run restaurants.

This will be the second group loan for the women.

Rabiatou (sitting on the left of the photo) will use her loan to buy baskets of smoked fish.  She buys her supplies from wholesalers in Bla, and sells to men and women for cash or on credit.

Rabiatou expects to earn a monthly average of 10,000 francs CFA, and she will use her earnings for health expenses, food, clothes, school fees and the rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish for resale.

loans.name: La Esperanza 3 Group

texts.es:
17 mujeres integra este grupo llamado La Esperanza 3, ellas forman parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, donde también están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Isabel, quien en su última  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir, que tiene ingresos muy bajos, pero ella a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo está mejorando su situación de pobreza. Ella se dedica a las ventas, ya que tiene una despensa bien surtida en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas. Es una mujer que quiere salir adelante y es por eso que está luchando por crecer.
Pide de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de productos varios para la despensa que tiene, como ser carne, verduras, artículos de limpieza, yerba, bebidas, lácteos, etc., y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas, dando a sus clientes todo lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
Seventeen women make up the La Esperanza 3 group. They form part of the program to eliminate poverty, where they are also taking the poverty elimination survey.

One of the members is Isabel, who showed she was within a level 1 poverty stage on her last survey, meaning she has a very low income. But, through effort and her hard work, she is improving her situation. She works in sales, since she has a well-stocked store where she works everyday, starting very early in the morning. She is a woman who wants to get ahead and that's why she is striving to grow.

She is requesting this loan to buy various products for her store, such as meat, vegetables, cleaning supplies, yerba tea, drinks, dairy products, etc. That way, she can continue with her sales and give her customers everything they need.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, cleaning supplies, yerba tea, drinks, dairy products, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Por El Progreso Group

texts.es: El grupo “MUJERES UNIDAS POR EL PROGRESO” se encuentra conformada por 10 socios trabajadores y puntuales en sus cuotas de grupo. Cristhians tiene 30 años es casado con 02 hijos. Hace 06 seis años trabaja como auxiliar de repartos. Años atrás se dedicaba a cobrar los pasajes en los colectivos. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de electrodoméstico: licuadora plancha y microondas. Su mayor deseo es estudiar una carrera técnica. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Cristhians es el primero del lado derecho
texts.en: The group “MUJERES UNIDAS POR EL PROGRESO” consists of 10 hard-working and punctual members in the group. Cristhians is 30 years old, married, with 2 children. For 6 years he has worked making deliveries. A few years ago he worked collecting fees from passengers in bus taxis. The loan will be used to buy electrodomestic appliances: blender, iron, and microwave. His greatest wish is to study a technical career. The group is grateful to the KIVA investors for the provided support. Cristhians is the first person on the right side of the photo.

loans.use: to buy a blender, iron, and microwave.

loans.name: Asovale

texts.en: Asovale is 45 years old and married with 8 children. She runs a small business selling fish in her community and has been doing this for 5 years. Asovale has requested a loan to buy spears, fishing gears, goggles and fishing net. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Asovale will provide for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy spears, fishing gears, goggles and a fishing net for her fishing business

loans.name: Fatkhiddin

texts.ru: Фатхиддин занят в сфере торговли. Ему 42 года. Он в своем родном городе Исфара имеет частный магазин, в котором продает канцелярские товары. Фатхиддин начал свой бизнес еще в 2004 году и уже 10 лет как он продолжает эту деятельность. Ему помогает во всем его спутница жизни - жена. У них трое сыновей и двое дочерей. Все дети, кроме маленькой дочери учатся в школе. Фатхиддин любит свою семью и старается обеспечить их всем необходимым. Для этого он работает с усердием. Фатхиддин просит кредит для развития бизнеса. Он на сумму кредита хочет приобрести ассортимент канцелярских товаров.
texts.en:
Fatkhiddin works in retail. He is 42 years old. He has his own shop in his home town of Isfara, in which he sells stationery. Fatkhiddin started his business in 2004 and has been doing this job for 10 years now. He is helped in everything by his life companion - his wife. They have three sons and two daughters. All the children apart from their youngest daughter study at school. 

Fatkhiddin loves his family and is trying to provide them with everything they need. To do this he needs to work with all his might. Fatkhiddin is asking for a loan to develop his business. He wants to use this money to buy an assortment of stationery.

loans.use: To buy stationery

loans.name: Evelini

texts.en: Evelini is a 30-year-old single woman with 4 children. She has a small bingo business. She has been in this business for 2 years. Evelini needs a loan to buy a bingo machine, bingo sheets, bingo stamp bottles and noodles, bags of rice and chicken for prizes. She will use her profits to improve her business. Evelini joined SPBD in 2007 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a bingo machine, bingo sheets, bingo stamp bottles and noodles, bags of rice, and chicken for prizes

loans.name: Imeleta

texts.en:
Imeleta is 42 years old and married with eight children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for five years.

Imeleta needs a loan to buy a weed sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, and spades. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2012.

Imeleta will use the profits from her sales to support her family and to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a weed sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, and spades

loans.name: Nuti

texts.en:
Nuti is 61 years old and married with seven children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for five years.

Nuti needs a loan to buy a weed sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, and spades. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2012. 

Nuti will use the profits from her sales to support her family and to save for emergencies.

loans.use: to buy a weed sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, and spades.

loans.name: Seine

texts.en: Seine is 35 years old and married with 7 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as milk, sugar, toilet paper, chicken, noodles, etc. She has been doing this for 1 year. Seine needs a loan to buy a display freezer and deep freezer. She hopes to use her profits to improve her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a display freezer and deep freezer.

loans.name: Enkhjin

texts.en: Ms. Enkhjin is a bachelor degree student who studies information and technology at a private university. She is quite passionate about this job because the monthly salary of the job is quite high in comparison to other professions. She has mentioned that there is no other option to pay for her tuition fee.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fee

loans.name: Aun

texts.en:
From a small village of Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham, Aun is a 45-year-old married woman and a farmer who has been engaged in the agricultural sector for almost 21 years. She primarily grows rice on her own land, which was inherited by both parents. She usually sells her rice product to local grain dealers, earning approximately USD 4.10 per day.

As of now, Aun would like to request a loan of USD 1,500 to drill a rope pump well in her own yard and buy accessories like water pipes for carrying the water. Through the loan help, she won’t face a water shortage in the future and will have no need to spend much time collecting water from the far-distant areas again. She expresses her thanks to all Kiva lenders for showing their interest in poor fellows like her.

loans.use: to drill a rope pump well in her own yard and buy accessories like water pipes for carrying the water.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is an old client, aged 25 years, who applied for a loan of UGX 1,500,000 to buy a motorcycle. He is challenged by limited income and his current savings were not enough to purchase the motorcycle, so he approached UGAFODE for a top up to buy the motorcycle.
He hopes his income will increase after he has gotten a new motorcycle. He is also pledging to start saving so that he is able to build a house for his children. He is a committed man. In the photo is Godfrey with the UGAFODE credit officer and the motorcycle he intends to buy (left to right).

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Phearom's Group

texts.en:
Phearom, age 29 and single, is a local villager from Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. For five years, to cover her daily cost of living, she has grown rice and cucumbers as the main source of income and it has returned her around KHR 27,800 per day. Phearom is a fifth-time borrower with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner), with successful repayment of her past four loans which have helped her to provide enough food for her family. 

Now, in a group of two, she is a leader. For this cycle, Phearom is requesting a loan in the amount of KHR 500,000, while her joint borrower is requesting KHR 1,400,000.  Phearom will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, gasoline, and seeds for her agribusiness. She hopes to earn more income from her business, so that she can keep improving her standard of living at a gradual pace.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, gasoline, and seeds for her agribusiness.

loans.name: Yungueñitas 27 Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento YUNGUEÑITAS 27  está compuesto por diez integrantes de los cuales siete  son mujeres y tres varones que se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco sigue siendo la señora. Paulina tiene 69 años, ella sigue con la misma actividad del tejido de chompas y mantas de Alpaca para la mujeres, tiene su taller y domicilio en la zona de  Pedro Domingo Murillo , cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compara de lana,  en esta ocacion la señora Paulina va a usar este préstamo para la compra de lana de alpaca por mayor para el tejido de sus chompas y mantas ya que por esta fechas de fin de año que se acerca la navidad  tiene mucha venta también entrega pedidos a los distintos mercados de la ciudad de La Paz, se siente feliz y agradecida con los prestamistas de Kiva por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en: The communal bank YUNGUEÑITAS 27  is made up of 10 members, seven women and three men, who have different businesses.  The president of the group is still Paulina.  She is 69 years old and has the same business knitting alpaca sweaters and blankets for women.  She has her workshop and home in the Pedro Domingo Murillo neighborhood.  She tells us that her last loan went well and she used it to purchase wool. She is going to use it to purchase alpaca wool wholesale to knit sweaters and blankets. Towards the end of the year and during Christmas she has a lot of sales.  She also delivers orders to different markets in the city of La Paz.  She is happy and grateful to Kiva lenders for the opportunity they give her to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase Alpaca wool wholesale to knit sweaters.

loans.name: Luisito

texts.en: Luisito owns and operates a business providing bicycle transportation services. He has been providing transportation services to his customers for more than three years. He earns enough money that he is able to provide for the basic needs of his family. He used his previous loans from GDMPC to improve his business, and he has successfully repaid the loans. Recently, he borrowed a new loan to buy new tires to improve his ability to provide secure services. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires

loans.name: Joann

texts.en:
Joann operates a business buying and selling dry goods in town.  She has been doing it for four years and is earning well for the family.  She was able to successfully repay her previous loan from GDMPC that she has used for additional capital for the business.

Recently she borrowed another loan to purchase additional toys and other accessories for sale. She hopes she will be able to support the needs of her children and provide financially for their studies in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase additional toys and other accessories for sale

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Anita

texts.es:
Anita tiene 39 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Oyotun, su población se dedica al cultivo de caña, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral patos, gallinas, pavos, su negocio está ubicado en la parte posterior a su domicilio, Anita realiza esta labor para apoyar su esposo con los gastos familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados y de esta maneta tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Anita is 39 years old.  She lives together with her husband and her two children in the Oyotun district.  These people work in sugar cane farming, trade, and cattle.  It is two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on the north coast of Perú.

She works raising and selling free-range poultry.  Her business is located at her home.  She does this type of work to support her husband with the household expenses.

She has asked for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles for the purchase of balanced animal feed, and in this way to have a better yield to offer her customers, generating a larger income for her family.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth helps her husband in managing their vegetable garden for a living. She has been doing this for six years and she earns well to aid her husband's income as a construction worker. She joined GDMPC and had borrowed a new loan to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides to boost her vegetable garden. She is hopeful to gain more return from her farm so she can save a portion of it for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo tiene 30 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos en el distrito de Cañaris, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su familia tiene una bodeguita donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad, leche azúcar, arroz, aceite entre otros, Lorenzo ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 501 nuevos soles para la compra de abarrotes menestras, fideos, granos, gaseosas, golosinas y de esta manera abastecer su negocio para ofrecer más variedad de productos para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lorenzo is 30 years old and lives with his wife and children in the Cañaris district, two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the north coast of Peru. The people here work in agriculture, livestock and in commerce.

Lorenzo and his family have a small shop where they sell everyday groceries such as milk, sugar, rice, oil and other items. Lorenzo has asked for a loan of 2501 nuevos soles to buy groceries such as vegetable soup, noodles, grains, fizzy drinks and sweets so he can stock his business to offer his customers a better variety of products.

loans.use: to buy groceries to stock his shop.

loans.name: Dany Mariela

texts.es:
Dany Mariela tiene 41 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y su hija en el distrito de Nueva Arica, una zona rural, su población se dedica al cultivo de manzanas, ciruelas, ganadería y comercio, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, en su mismo domicilio, Dany como así la conocen realiza esta labor para apoyar con los gastos de la familia, junto a su esposo tienen sembrado un área de yucas,que luego de cosechar lo ofrecen en el mercado de la zona.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para comprar abono para su cultivo y de esta manera tener una mejor cosecha para ofrecer a sus clientes, generándole al mismo tiempo ingresos adicionales para su familia.
texts.en:
Dany Mariela, 41, lives with her husband and her daughter in the Nueva Arica district, a rural area two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru. The residents there grow apples and plums, raise livestock, and work in the commercial sector.

She makes a living raising pigs at her house.  She has done this work since she got married to help with the family expenses.  She and her family have planted a field of yuca.  Her husband, a farmer, harvests this crop to sell in the market in the area.

She has requested a loan for 1,500 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy soil amendments to grow yuca so she has a better crop to sell to her customers.  At the same time she'll generate additional income for her family.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments to grow yuca

loans.name: Entrada A Chunazana  (Nabón) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Entrada a Chunazana está formado por 6 mujeres quienes viven por los alrededores del cantón de Nabón, este sector goza de un clima frió, de amplios campos que se forman por su geografía accidentada, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo colonial y lo moderno. Su gente es amable, gentil y sobre todo muy trabajadora que siempre luchan día a día en sus trabajos para mejorar la estabilidad económica de sus hogares,  sus costumbres y tradiciones las mantienen con orgullo.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Rosa, se encuentra realizando su primer crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañeras que conforman el grupo de crédito Entrada a Chunazana, le gusta esta forma de crédito por la solidaridad y unión de todas las socias.
Ella tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y ha concebido 5 hijos que son casados y viven  independientes, su esposo labora como jornalero, la casa en la que vive es propia.
La Señora María Rosa se dedica a la agricultura y crianza de animales, en especial tiene cuyes, gallinas de postura y pollos, vende sus animales en la ciudad o en su comunidad, este trabajo le da la oportunidad de mejorar la estabilidad económica de su hogar. 
El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de pollos y cuyes. Su meta es ampliar su negocio con animales de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
The Entrada a Chunazana loan group is made up of six women who live in the area of Nabón Canton.  The area enjoys a cold climate, extensive fields formed from the rugged geography, and a mix of colonial and modern architecture.  The residents are friendly, kind, and above all hardworking, and they strive every day in their jobs to improve the financial stability of their households.  They proudly preserve their customs and traditions.

One of the members of this group is María Rosa.  She's getting her first loan along with her friends and colleagues who make up the Entrada a Chunazana group.  She likes this type of loan because of the solidarity and closeness of all the members.

María Rosa, 53, is married and has five children who are married and live on their own.  Her husband works as a day laborer.  The house she lives in is her own.

María Rosa makes a living in agriculture and raising animals, in particular guinea pigs, laying hens, and chickens.  She sells her animals in the city or in her community.  This job gives her the opportunity to improve her household financial stability.

She's going to invest the money from the loan in chickens and guinea pigs.  Her goal is to expand her business with better-quality animals.

loans.use: to buy chickens and guinea pigs

loans.name: Mirella Carolina

texts.es:
Carolina tiene 30 años de edad, vive en su propia casa de material noble junto a su esposo, en el distrito de La Matanza, es una comunidad tranquila, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores pavos, cerdos y gallinas en la parte posterior a su domicilio, con la finalidad de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 500 nuevos soles para invertir en la construcción de corrales para distribuir de una mejor manera sus animales, y una segunda parte para la compra de alimentos balanceados para una mejor producción y de esta manera ofrecer a la venta pavos, cerdos y gallinas a sus clientes y así generara mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Carolina is 30 years old and lives with her husband in their own house, made of good quality materials, in the district of La Matanza, 2 hours from the city of Piura on the north coast of Peru. It is a quiet community where the people work in agriculture, livestock and commerce.
