Carolina makes a living raising and selling small animals such as turkeys, pigs and chickens at the rear of her home, with the aim of helping her husband with the family expenses.

She has asked for a loan of 3500 nuevos soles and will spend some on building pens so she can organise the animals better and the rest to buy balanced feed to improve her production. By doing this she can offer customers the sale of turkeys, pigs, and chickens and thus generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to build animal pens and buy balanced feed.

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.es:
Eleuterio tiene 62 años de edad vive junto a sus hijos y familiares en el distrito de Cayaltí, su población se dedica al cultivo de caña, arroz, maíz, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de leche fresca y panca en el mercado de su distrito, Eleuterio con la ayuda de sus hijos también se dedican a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores pavos, cerdos y gallinas.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de una vaca y de esta manera ofrecer su producción de leche en mayor cantidad, generándole ingresos adicionales para su familia.
texts.en:
Eleuterio is 62 years old.  He lives together with his children and family members in the Cayaltí district.  The people there work farming sugar cane, rice, and corn.  It is two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on the north coast of Perú.

He works selling fresh milk and peppers in the district market.  Eleuterio says that with the help of his children, they also work raising and selling small barnyard animals such as turkeys, pigs, and hens.

He has asked for a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles for the purchase of a cow.  In this way he can produce milk in larger quantities, generating additional income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow

loans.name: Cristian Celso

texts.es:
Cristian Celso tiene 61 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el caserío El Toro, una zona rural de Oyotun, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi , trasladando a sus clientes a las zonas aledañas a su comunidad, ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para darle mantenimiento a su vehículo y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Cristian Celso is 61 years old and lives with his wife in the town of El Toro in the rural area of Oyotun, whose inhabitants work in farming, commerce, and livestock.  It is two hours from the city of Chiclayo on Peru's northern coast. 

He offers public transportation services on his mototaxi, which he owns, taking his customers to the outlying areas of his community.  He has requested a loan of 500 nuevos soles to perform maintenance on his vehicle so he can make more income for his family.

loans.use: maintenance for his mototaxi

loans.name: Nieta Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe NIETA ont en moyenne  40 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies     dans la ville de BLA dans la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des articles divers, des  habillements etc.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe NIETA sont à leur  2 eme   prêt solidaire. M’PENE 2 eme femme debout à  la gauche sur la photo  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter deux balles de pages waw, 10 complets de prêt à porter pour enfants. Elle s’approvisionne à BAMAKO. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 26 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé et  à la nourriture, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Nieta Group are all around 40 years old, and have an average of three children.  They live in traditional, extended families in the town of Bla, in the fourth-largest, administrative region of the republic of Mali.

The women know one another through family ties, and they buy and sell various items such as clothing, etc. 

This will be the second group loan for the women, their first loan was correctly repaid.

M'Pene (standing second from the left on the photo) will use her loan to buy two bales of wax pagnes (traditional wrap-around clothing) and ten ready-to-wear, children's outfits.  She buys her stocks in Bamako, and sells her products to men and women, for cash or on credit.

M'Pene expects to earn a monthly average of 26,000 francs CFA, which will be used for health expenses, food costs, school fees and the rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a single dressmaker, sewing curtains and other ready-to-wear clothes for a living. She has been doing this for four years, earning well for her needs.

She joined GDMPC  and has borrowed a loan to buy additional textiles and accessories in order to improve her offerings and stock to sell. She is hopeful to gain more income to save for her future.

loans.use: to buy additional textiles and accessories

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.en:
Nicolasa is a single entrepreneur who sells fruits in town for a living. She has been doing this for ten years, earning well for her needs.

She borrowed a loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy additional variety of fruits to resell in order to earn more income. She wants to improve her business and plans to save her profits for her future needs.

loans.use: to buy additional variety of fruits to resell

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes helps her husband in their fishing business and has been doing this for six years. She earns well for the family.

She borrowed a loan to buy new fishing nets in order to improve their income and sell their fish in the market. She always find ways to augment their living and wants to provide better educations for her two children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets

loans.name: Min

texts.en:
Min is 49 years of age and is married with a grown-up son. She divorced her husband in the past ten years due to unavoidable family circumstances so she lives with her son in Baray district, Kampong Thom. She works on her own farm, growing rice and cassavas to make a living. She has been doing farming for almost ten years, and earns well for the family. 

Min has been with HKL for seven loans and has successfully repaid her previous loans. Her previous loans were used to develop her farm and improve her living status. She is taking out a new loan recently to buy one hectare of farm to expand her areas for growing rice and cassavas. She hopes to have more returns from her investments in her farm.

loans.use: to buy one hectare of farm to expand her areas for growing rice and cassavas.

loans.name: Jeane

texts.en:
Jeane is 36 years old and lives in Dumagoc, Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with 4 children.

Jeane has been doing a buy-and-sell business and earns approximately 10,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase additional inventory of general merchandise to sell.

Jeane has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, she hopes to buy a multi-cab for the transportation needs of her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory of general merchandise to sell

location.town: Dumagoc, Pagadian City Zamboanga del Sur, Philippi

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 28 years old and has a live-in partner with two children. With one child currently in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like snack foods, canned goods, soft-drinks, noodles, etc. to sell.

Evelyn has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, soft-drinks, noodles, etc.  Evelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like snack foods, canned goods, soft-drinks, noodles, etc., to sell

loans.name: Sofronio

texts.en:
Sofronio has been raising pigs for sale for more than four years, earning well for the family. He has been doing this so diligently that he was able to successfully repay his previous loan, used in the business. 

Recently, he borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase more livestock feed and other supplies. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to renovate his house.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Genne

texts.en:
Genne is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 31 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Genne has a candle making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials like cord, wax, etc. for her candle making business. She has been in this business for two years. Genne would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials like cord, wax, etc., for her candle making business

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is married and has three children.  She has operated her own sari sari (convenience) store for five years, earning well to aid her husband's income from farming.

She borrowed a loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy additional grocery goods to resell. She is hopeful to gain more profit and wants to improve her store to have a better income in the near future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to resell

loans.name: Neat's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Neat is 31 years old and a mother blessed with three kids.  She deals with her family’s hardship via cassava farming and rice cropping as the main source of income. The business that she has had for 11 years earns her about 20,700 KHR per day. 

This is the third loan for Neat with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner). Her past loan, which she has repaid back completely, has helped her to improve her living better than before. Now, in a group of two, she is  a leader. Neat will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fees, to buy cassava seedlings, and to buy herbicide for her crop. She hopes to gain a good yield, better than before.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and pesticide and to pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Sonet's Group

texts.en: Sonet is a 21-year-old mother of three dependent kids residing in Kampong Cham province. To support the daily cost of living, she raises pigs and works for others for a fee to supplement her income. She has been with this business for three years and it has earned her around 35,000 KHR per day. This is the fifth loan for Sonet and second loan for her co-borrower in a group of two with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan, which she has repaid back completely, has helped her to improve her lifestyle in a better condition with especially sufficient food for her kids. Now, she is seeking a loan for 4,000,000 KHR and her joint borrower is applying for 2,000,000 KHR. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy pigs and pig feed. She hopes to earn more income from her business so that she can send her kids to school, and to renovate her house to a better condition.

loans.use: to buy pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Dalila

texts.es:
Dalila tiene 47 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Oyotun una comunidad que se caracteriza por que su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Tiene una tienda donde ofrece venta de muebles como sillas, mesas, reposteros, es una mujer emprendedora ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para hacer crecer su negocio con la compra de escritorios, muebles de computadoras entre otros y de esta manera ofrecer mas variedad de productos para a sus clientes, generándole mayores ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Dalila is 47 years old. She lives in the district of Oyotun, a community that is characterized by a population that works in agriculture, commerce, and raising livestock. It is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on the north coast of Peru.

She has a store where she offers furniture like chairs, tables, and cabinets. Dalila is an enterprising woman, and has has applied for a loan of 3000 PEN to make her business grow by buying desks and computer tables and in this way offering a greater variety of products to her customers, generating greater income to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase furniture to supply her business

loans.name: Ayub

texts.en:
Ayub lives around the Mount Kenya region in a place called N'timau. He is 38 years old, married and blessed with three children. All his three children attend school. He owns a retail shop that he has been operating for the last two years. He also farms and keeps animals at his farm. He also hopes that in the next five years he will be running a wholesale business.

He knew Milango through friends and now seeks a loan to buy sugar, rice, soap, flour and other retail products for his shop.  The major challenges that he faces in the business include competition and unstable pricing of commodities. The income that he will generate will improve his standard of living and also pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, soap, flour and other retail products

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita, age 59, is married and lives in Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao, Philippines. She has 3 children.

From her desire to help the family, she engaged in egg vending starting up with capital of 3,000 PHP.  It has operated for 2 years already. Carmelita was able to expand the business through the help of Paglaum Coop, where she has found financial assistance.

Now she is planning to borrow 10,000 PHP from Paglaum MP Cooperative, of which she became a member in 2011. She wants to open another stall in the public market to display her stock. Someday she will be happy seeing her family living a comfortable and happy life.

loans.use: to purchase additional trays of eggs to sell

loans.name: Emilio Jr.

texts.en:
Emilio managed his transport service business and earned well so that he was able to successfully repay his previous loan that he used to obtain a tire for his motorcycle. Aside from this business, he also has a farm, which is his main source of income.

Recently he borrowed a new loan to cover the costs of farm weeding labor. He wants to improve his living situation in the coming year.

loans.use: to cover the costs of farm weeding labor

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is married and has four children. She is 55 years old and lives in Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao, Philippines.

Adelaida and her husband earn a living through farming. For the past three years, Adelaida has raised pigs to earn extra income. Recently, she requested this loan to buy bags of rice to sell. 

Adelaida has been a member of PMPC for a year. With her extra income, she hopes to save for future needs.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice to sell

loans.name: Melvin

texts.en:
Melvin is 43 years old. He is very responsible with his household obligations since he has always been known to provide the best for his family. He currently lives with his wife and three children. He is a farmer who plants corn and coconuts.

Melvin wants to increase sales. Consequently, he has requested a loan that will enable him to purchase seeds, compost, and fertilizer, among other items, so that he can continue to put bread on the table in his home.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Elva

texts.es: Elva, de 54 años de edad, está casada con Rosendo y tiene cuatro hijos de 25, 19, 17 y 11 años de edad respectivamente con quienes vive en su casa propia. Elva se dedica a la venta de repuestos de todas las marcas y artículos de ferretería. Cuenta con una tienda que está instalada en su propia casa, ahorrándose de esa manera gastos de alquiler. Siendo muy concurrida por sus clientes ya que  cuenta con un stock muy  variado de artículos de ferretería y repuestos. Lleva en éste negocio desde hace 10 años, contando con la ayuda de su hijo en la atención a los clientes, logrando hacerse muy conocida en la zona. Le gusta su negocio al poder contar con un ingreso económico para apoyar a su esposo. En esta oportunidad solicitara S/.1500, se siente contenta con el apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio, por eso se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. El monto solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de artículos de ferretería al por mayor, así como también en la compra de más repuestos de motos. Buscando precios más cómodos por sus compras en volumen para así obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Elva, 54 years old, is married to Rosendo and has four children, who are 25, 19, 17 and 11 years old, respectively. They live in a house they own. She makes a living selling all brands of spare parts and hardware items. She has a store set up in her home thereby saving the expense of renting. She is very busy with customers since she has a very diverse inventory of hardware and spare parts. She has had this business for 10 years and relies on her husband to help her wait on clients. She has become very well known in the area.

Elva enjoys her business and being able to earn an income to assist her husband. At this time she will request S/. 1,500 and is pleased at the financial support that enables her to succeed in her business. She is committed to being punctual in her loan repayments. She will invest the sum requested in the purchase of hardware items wholesale and also in the purchase of motorcycle spare parts. She is looking for more affordable prices by purchasing in volume so that she will earn more profit.

loans.use: to purchase hardware products.

loans.name: Epenesa

texts.en: Epenesa is 20 years old and married with no children. She makes and sells elei lavalava to earn a living and has been doing this for 1 year. Epenesa has requested a loan to buy materials, fabric, color paint, brushes, stencils, and elei carved board. She plans to use her profits to improve her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials, fabric, color paint, brushes, stencils, and elei carved board.

loans.name: Merita

texts.en:
Merita is a 25-year-old married woman with no children. She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years.

Merita has requested a loan for a backpack sprayer, chemicals, fertilizer, and a wheelbarrow. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2013. 

With her profits, Merita hopes to financially support her family.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, chemicals, fertilizer, and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Faleata

texts.en:
Faleata is 45 years old and married with five children. She runs a small business selling ice cake in her community and has been doing this for two years.

Faleata has requested a loan to buy foam cups, cordials, Tang, Chinese lollies, and sugar. She joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2013 to gain access to capital. 

With her earnings, Faleata will improve her business and financially support her family.

loans.use: to buy foam cups, cordials, Tang, Chinese lollies, and sugar

loans.name: Twikenure Ii Group

texts.fr:
Rashidi fait partie du groupe TwikenureII et habite à Bujumbura. Il a 39 ans et est marié à Félicité, une femme de manage. Ensemble ils ont  4 enfants âgés de 5 à 16 ans et tous étudient.

Il fait le commerce de peinture et de mastic depuis 9 ans.

Il est à son cinquième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  300l de peinture et 10 boîtes de mastic, à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dana les prochaines années il voudrait  construire une maison et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Rashidi is a member of the Twikenure Ii Group, and lives in Bujumbura.  He is 39 years old and married to Félicité, who is a cleaner.  Together they have four children between five and sixteen years old.  All their children attend school.

Rashidi has sold paint and putty for nine years.  This will be his fifth loan with the field partner, Turame.  He will use his loan to increase his capital and buy 300 litres of paint and 10 boxes of putty for resale.  In this way, he hopes to earn more.

In the future, Rashidi would like to build a house and ensure that all his children attend school.

loans.use: to buy 300 litres of paint and 10 boxes of putty for resale.

loans.name: Josepina

texts.en:
Josepina works hard to support her family. Josepina is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Josepina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, biscuits, diapers, etc. to sell.

Josepina has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Josepina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, biscuits, diapers, etc. to sell

loans.name: Presibella

texts.en:
Presibella has a live-in partner with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Presibella is 41 years old and has two children who are in school.

Presibella has had a sewing business in the Philippines for 3 years. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her business, such as threads, fabric, and needles. In the future, Presibella would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials (threads, fabric, needles, etc.).

loans.name: Kuwirirana Group

texts.en:
Phillip managed to buy steel accessories and peanuts  for making peanut butter. He has also managed to finish building his house and now has three tenants where he is getting extra income. Phillip says now he does not face any problems in paying school fees for his children due to the profitability of his business.

Phillip has requested a loan of $600 to buy more peanuts and welding rods and steel for making more machines. He is very grateful to the asistance he is getting from Kiva and Microking. He is also the group leader for Kuwirirana Group.

loans.use: To buy steel accessories and peanuts for making peanut butter.
